prompt: Zack tutors students in groups of 14. Meanwhile, Karen tutors students in groups of 10. While discussing their work, the tutors realize that they both work with the same total number of students. What is the smallest number of students each can have?
summary: var1 = find("Zack's student group") # 14, var2 = find("Karen's student group") # 10, var3 = find_lcm(var1, var2) # LCM(14,10) = 70, return(var3) # 70
fr_prompt: Zack enseigne aux étudiants en groupes de 14. Pendant ce temps, Karen enseigne aux étudiants en groupes de 10. En discutant de leur travail, les tuteurs se rendent compte qu'ils travaillent tous les deux avec le même nombre total d'étudiants. Quel est le plus petit nombre d'élèves que chacun peut avoir ?
fr_summary: var1 = find("Groupe d'étudiants de Zack") # 14, var2 = find("Groupe d'étudiants de Karen") # 10, var3 = find_lcm(var1, var2) # LCM(14,10) = 70, return(var3) # 70

prompt: Their next opponent was the Green Team. If their final score is 68 points and they led by 29 points, what is Green Team's final score?
summary: var1 = find(points scored by Blue Team) # 68, var2 = find(difference in points) # 29, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 68 - 29 = 39, return(var1) # 39
fr_prompt: Leur prochain adversaire était l'équipe verte. Si leur score final est de 68 points et qu'ils menaient de 29 points, quel est le score final de l'équipe verte ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(points marqués par Blue Team) # 68, var2 = find(différence de points) # 29, var1 = soustract(var1, var2), CALL # 68 - 29 = 39, return(var1) # 39

prompt: This afternoon, Alec noticed that the number of the page assigned for homework is divisible by both 4 and 13. What is the smallest possible page number that could have been assigned?
summary: var1 = find("divisor by 4") # 4, var2 = find("divisor by 13") # 13, var3 = find_lcm(var1, var2) # LCM(4,13) = 52, return(var3) # 52
fr_prompt: Cet après-midi, Alec a remarqué que le numéro de la page attribuée aux devoirs est divisible à la fois par 4 et 13. Quel est le plus petit numéro de page possible qui aurait pu être attribué ?
fr_summary: var1 = find("diviseur par 4") # 4, var2 = find("diviseur par 13") # 13, var3 = find_lcm(var1, var2) # LCM(4,13) = 52, return(var3) # 52

prompt: Tyler, an animal rights advocate, decided to build his own animal sanctuary to protect different animals from poachers. The sanctuary was divided into different regions. The first region to be built was a bird sanctuary. Initially, he had 29 endangered bird species on that region. If each species has 7 pairs of birds, how many pairs does he have in total?
summary: var1 = find(species of birds) # 29, var2 = find(pairs per species) # 7, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 29 * 7 = 203, return(var1) # 203
fr_prompt: Tyler, un défenseur des droits des animaux, a décidé de construire son propre sanctuaire animalier pour protéger différents animaux des braconniers. Le sanctuaire était divisé en différentes régions. La première région à être construite était une réserve ornithologique. Initialement, il avait 29 espèces d'oiseaux en voie de disparition dans cette région. Si chaque espèce a 7 couples d'oiseaux, combien de couples a-t-il au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(espèces d'oiseaux) # 29, var2 = trouver(paires par espèce) # 7, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 29 * 7 = 203, retour(var1) # 203

prompt: There are 315 cups of puddings to be distributed to 218 students. If each of them wants an equal number of pudding cups, at least how many more pudding cups are needed?
summary: var1 = find(puddings) # 315, var2 = find(students) # 218, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 315 / 218 = 1.44, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(1.44) = 1, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 218 * 1 = 218, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 315 - 218 = 97, var6 = subtract(var2, var5), CALL # 218 - 97 = 121, return(var6) # 121
fr_prompt: Il y a 315 tasses de puddings à distribuer à 218 élèves. Si chacun d'eux veut un nombre égal de coupes de pudding, au moins combien de coupes de pudding supplémentaires sont nécessaires ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(puddings) # 315, var2 = find(students) # 218, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 315 / 218 = 1.44, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(1.44) = 1, var4 = multiplier (var2, var3), CALL # 218 * 1 = 218, var5 = soustraire (var1, var4), CALL # 315 - 218 = 97, var6 = soustraire (var2, var5), CALL # 218 - 97 = 121, retour(var6) # 121

prompt: At the carnival, the ratio of people who won the ring toss game to lost it was 4:1. If 28 people won, how many people would have lost?
summary: var1 = find(won) # 28, var2 = divide(var1, 4), var3 = multiply(var2, 1 + 4), CALL # (28 / 4) * (1 + 4) = 35, var4 = subtract(var3, var1), CALL # 35 - 28 = 7, return(var4) # 7
fr_prompt: Au carnaval, le ratio de personnes qui ont gagné le jeu du lancer d'anneaux et qui l'ont perdu était de 4:1. Si 28 personnes avaient gagné, combien de personnes auraient perdu ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(gagné) # 28, var2 = diviser(var1, 4), var3 = multiplier(var2, 1 + 4), CALL # (28 / 4) * (1 + 4) = 35, var4 = soustraire(var3 , var1), APPEL # 35 - 28 = 7, retour(var4) # 7

prompt: Jerry had 8 action figures on a shelf in his room. Later he added 2 more figures to the shelf. How many action figures were on his shelf total?
summary: var1 = find(starting figures) # 8, var2 = find(figures added) # 2, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 8 + 2 = 10, return(var3) # 10
fr_prompt: Jerry avait 8 figurines articulées sur une étagère dans sa chambre. Plus tard, il a ajouté 2 autres figurines sur l'étagère. Combien y avait-il de figurines articulées sur son étagère au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(chiffres de départ) # 8, var2 = find(chiffres ajoutés) # 2, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 8 + 2 = 10, return(var3) # 10

prompt: They entered the circus tent and saw that there are four seating sections for the audience. If each section can accommodate 246 people, how many people can the tent accommodate in total?
summary: var1 = find(people per section) # 246, var2 = find(number of sections) # 4, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 246 * 4 = 984, return(var1) # 984
fr_prompt: Ils sont entrés dans le chapiteau du cirque et ont vu qu'il y avait quatre sections de sièges pour le public. Si chaque section peut accueillir 246 personnes, combien de personnes la tente peut-elle accueillir au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(personnes par section) # 246, var2 = find(nombre de sections) # 4, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 246 * 4 = 984, return(var1) # 984

prompt: Mrs. Hilt bought 15 books. She paid $11 for each book. She later sold all 15 books for $25 each. What is the difference between the total amount of money Mrs. Hilt sold the books for and the total amount of money she paid for the books?
summary: var1 = find(books bought) # 15, var2 = find(price per book bought) # 11, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 15 * 11 = 165, var4 = find(price per book sold) # 25, var5 = multiply(var1, var4), CALL # 15 * 25 = 375, var6 = subtract(var5, var3), CALL # 375 - 165 = 210, return(var6) # 210
fr_prompt: Mme Hilt a acheté 15 livres. Elle a payé 11 $ pour chaque livre. Plus tard, elle a vendu les 15 livres pour 25 $ chacun. Quelle est la différence entre le montant total d'argent pour lequel Mme Hilt a vendu les livres et le montant total d'argent qu'elle a payé pour les livres ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(livres achetés) # 15, var2 = trouver(prix par livre acheté) # 11, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 15 * 11 = 165, var4 = trouver(prix par livre vendu) # 25 , var5 = multiplier (var1, var4), APPEL # 15 * 25 = 375, var6 = soustraire (var5, var3), APPEL # 375 - 165 = 210, retour (var6) # 210

prompt: Helen the hippo and her friends are preparing for thanksgiving at Helen's house. Helen baked 197 chocolate chip cookies and 46 raisin cookies yesterday. And she baked 75 raisin cookies and 66 chocolate chip cookies this morning.How many more chocolate chip cookies did Helen bake yesterday compared to today?
summary: var1 = find(yesterday chocolate chip cookies) #197, var2 = find(today chocolate chip cookies) #66, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 197 - 66 = 131, return(var3) #131
fr_prompt: Helen l'hippopotame et ses amis se préparent pour l'action de grâces chez Helen. Helen a préparé 197 biscuits aux pépites de chocolat et 46 biscuits aux raisins secs hier. Et elle a fait cuire 75 biscuits aux raisins secs et 66 biscuits aux pépites de chocolat ce matin. Combien de biscuits aux pépites de chocolat Helen a-t-elle fait hier par rapport à aujourd'hui ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(biscuits aux pépites de chocolat d'hier) #197, var2 = trouver(biscuits aux pépites de chocolat d'aujourd'hui) #66, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 197 - 66 = 131, retour(var3) #131

prompt: The school is planning a field trip. The school has 11 classrooms. There are 100 students in the school and 20 seats on each school bus. How many buses are needed to take the trip?
summary: var1 = find(students) # 100, var2 = find(seats) # 20, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 100 / 20 = 5, var4 = multiply(var3, var2), CALL # 5 * 20 = 100, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 100 - 100 = 0, return(var3) # 5
fr_prompt: L'école prévoit une sortie scolaire. L'école compte 11 salles de classe. Il y a 100 élèves dans l'école et 20 sièges dans chaque autobus scolaire. Combien de bus faut-il pour faire le trajet ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(étudiants) # 100, var2 = trouver(sièges) # 20, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 100 / 20 = 5, var4 = multiplier(var3, var2), APPEL # 5 * 20 = 100, var5 = soustraire(var1, var4), APPEL # 100 - 100 = 0, retour(var3) # 5

prompt: Chris has 18 soccer cards. His friend, Charlie, has 32 cards. How many fewer cards does Chris have?
summary: var1 = find(Chris card) # 18, var2 = find(Charlie cards) # 32, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 32 - 18 = 14, return(var3) # 14

fr_summary: var1 = trouver (carte Chris) # 18, var2 = trouver (cartes Charlie) # 32, var3 = soustraire (var2, var1), APPEL # 32 - 18 = 14, retour (var3) # 14

prompt: An architect was building his two story house. On the first floor the house had 6 bedrooms and the second floor had 4 bedrooms. How many bedrooms does the house have totaled?
summary: var1 = find(first floor bedrooms) # 6, var2 = find(second floor bedrooms) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 4 = 10, return(var3) # 10

fr_summary: var1 = find(chambres au premier étage) # 6, var2 = find(chambres au deuxième étage) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 4 = 10, return(var3) # 10

prompt: A car dealer sold 14 cars on the first day, 16 cars on the second day, and 27 cars on the third day. How many cars did the car dealer sell on the 3 days?
summary: var1 = find(cars sold on first day) # 14, var2 = find(cars sold on second day) # 16, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 14 + 16 = 30, var2 = find(cars sold on third day) # 27, var3 = add(var3, var2), CALL # 30 + 27 = 57, return(var3) # 57
fr_prompt: Un concessionnaire automobile a vendu 14 voitures le premier jour, 16 voitures le deuxième jour et 27 voitures le troisième jour. Combien de voitures le concessionnaire automobile a-t-il vendu sur les 3 jours ?

prompt: Mrs. Hilt bought a yoyo for 24 cents and a whistle for 14 cents. How much did she spend in all for the two toys?
summary: var1 = find(cost of yoyo) # 24 cents, var2 = find(cost of whistle) # 14 cents, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 24 + 14 = 38 cents, return(var3) # 38 cents

fr_summary: var1 = find(coût du yoyo) # 24 cents, var2 = find(coût du sifflet) # 14 cents, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 24 + 14 = 38 cents, return(var3) # 38 cents

prompt: Third-grade students went to a concert in 8 buses. Each bus took 45 students. How many students went to the concert?
summary: var1 = find(students per bus) # 45, var2 = find(number of buses) # 8, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 45 * 8 = 360, return(var3) # 360

fr_summary: var1 = find(élèves par bus) # 45, var2 = find(nombre de bus) # 8, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 45 * 8 = 360, return(var3) # 360

prompt: Shelley has 12 forks and 16 knives to place in silverware holders at the fast food restaurant where she works. She wants to distribute them equally, with no forks or knives left over. What is the greatest number of silverware holders Shelley can stock?
summary: var1 = find("forks") # 12, var2 = find("knives") # 16, var3 = find_gcd(var1, var2) # GCD(12,16) = 4, return(var3) # 4
fr_prompt: Shelley a 12 fourchettes et 16 couteaux à placer dans les porte-argenterie du fast-food où elle travaille. Elle veut les répartir équitablement, sans fourchettes ni couteaux. Quel est le plus grand nombre de supports d'argenterie que Shelley peut stocker ?

prompt: Joy will see her grandma in two days. How many hours until she sees her?

fr_summary: var1 = trouver (jours jusqu'à ce que Joy voit sa grand-mère) # 2, var2 = trouver (heures dans une journée) # 24, var1 = multiplier (var1, var2), APPEL # 2 * 24 = 48, retour (var1) # 48

prompt: Diane wants to buy a package of cookies. The cookies cost 65 cents. Diane has 27 cents. How much more money does she need?

prompt: Jerry had 3 action figures on a shelf in his room. Later he added 4 more action figures to the shelf and removed some of the old ones. If there are 6 action figures on his shelf nowHow many action figures did he remove from the shelf?
summary: var1 = find(action figures) #3, var2 = find(action figures added) #4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 3 + 4 = 7, var4 = find(action figures now) #6, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 7 - 6 = 1, return(var5) # 1
fr_prompt: Jerry avait 3 figurines articulées sur une étagère dans sa chambre. Plus tard, il a ajouté 4 figurines d'action supplémentaires à l'étagère et a supprimé certaines des anciennes. S'il y a 6 figurines articulées sur son étagère maintenant, combien de figurines articulées a-t-il retirées de l'étagère ?

prompt: The puppet show begins at 2:00 p.m. It lasts 1 hour and 30 minutes. What time does it end?
summary: The puppet show ends at 3:30 p.m.

fr_summary: Le spectacle de marionnettes se termine à 15h30.

prompt: On Monday Debby jogged 2 kilometers. On Tuesday she jogged 5 kilometers and on Wednesday she jogged 9. How many kilometers did she jog total?
summary: var1 = find(Monday jog) # 2, var2 = find(Tuesday jog) # 5, var3 = find(Wednesday jog) # 9, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 5 = 7, var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 7 + 9 = 16, return(var5) # 16
fr_prompt: Lundi, Debby a couru 2 kilomètres. Mardi, elle a couru 5 kilomètres et mercredi, elle en a couru 9. Combien de kilomètres a-t-elle parcouru au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(jog du lundi) # 2, var2 = find(jog du mardi) # 5, var3 = find(jog du mercredi) # 9, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 5 = 7, var5 = add (var4, var3), APPEL # 7 + 9 = 16, retour (var5) # 16

prompt: Rachel picked 4 apples from her tree. If the tree had 7 apples initially.How many apples are still there on the tree?
summary: apples_on_tree = find(apples on the tree) # 7, picked_apples = find(picked apples) # 4, remaining_apples = subtract(apples_on_tree, picked_apples), CALL # 7 - 4 = 3, return(remaining_apples) # 3
fr_prompt: Rachel a cueilli 4 pommes de son arbre. Si l'arbre avait initialement 7 pommes. Combien y a-t-il encore de pommes sur l'arbre ?
fr_summary: apples_on_tree = trouver(pommes sur l'arbre) # 7, picked_apples = trouver(cueillir des pommes) # 4, pommes restantes = soustraire(apples_on_tree, picked_apples), CALL # 7 - 4 = 3, return(remaining apples) # 3

prompt: Students from Flora Middle School were asked to participate in the event. They planted 47 apple trees and 27 orange trees in the forest near their school. How many trees in total did the students plant?

fr_summary: var1 = find(pommiers) # 47, var2 = find(orangers) # 27, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 47 + 27 = 74, return(var1) # 74

prompt: Paco had 35 cookies. He ate 6 of them. How many cookies did Paco have left?

fr_summary: var1 = find(cookies originellement) # 35, var2 = find(cookies que Paco a mangé) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 35 - 6 = 29, return(var3) # 29

prompt: Faye had 12 apps on her phone. To free up some space she deleted 8 of the apps. How many apps did she have left?
summary: var1 = find(starting apps) # 12, var2 = find(apps deleted) # 8, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 12 - 8 = 4, return(var3) # 4

prompt: While playing a video game Victor lost fourteen lives. Now he has two lives. What's the difference between the number of the lives that Victor lost and now?
summary: var1 = find(Victor's lives lost) # 14, var2 = find(Victor's lives now) # 2, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 14 - 2 = 12, return(var1) # 12

prompt: Allan brought 3 balloons and Jake brought 5 balloons to the park. Allan then bought 2 more balloons at the park.How many balloons did Allan and Jake have in the park?

prompt: Katie had seventy-two DS games and her friend had twenty-three games. How many do they have total?

fr_summary: var1 = find(Katie games) # 72, var2 = find(friend games) # 23, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 72 + 23 = 95, return(var1) # 95

prompt: An event has 12 adults and 20 children. The event planner wants to make each table identical, with the same combination of adults and children and no people left over. What is the greatest number of tables the planner can set up?

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(adultes) # 12, var2 = trouver(enfants) # 20, var3 = pgcd(var1, var2) # pgcd(12, 20) = 4, retour(var3) # 4

prompt: After eating a hearty meal, they went to see the Buckingham Palace. There, Rachel learned that 583 visitors came to the palace that day. If there were 246 visitors the previous day, how many visited the palace within 2 days?

fr_summary: var1 = find(visiteurs du jour 1) # 583, var2 = find(visiteurs du jour 2) # 246, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 583 + 246 = 829, return(var1) # 829

prompt: Rob is very fond of tall structures. He likes collecting pictures and comparing them. Two of his favorite buildings are Chicago's Sears Tower and Dubai's Burj Khalifa. If Burj Khalifa stands at 830 meters high and Sears stands at 527 meters high, how much higher is Burj Khalifa than Sears?
summary: var1 = find(height of Burj Khalifa) # 830, var2 = find(height of Sears Tower) # 527, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 830 - 527 = 303, return(var1) # 303
fr_prompt: Rob aime beaucoup les structures hautes. Il aime collectionner des images et les comparer. Deux de ses bâtiments préférés sont la Sears Tower de Chicago et le Burj Khalifa de Dubaï. Si Burj Khalifa se dresse à 830 mètres de haut et Sears à 527 mètres de haut, combien est Burj Khalifa plus haut que Sears ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(hauteur de Burj Khalifa) # 830, var2 = find(hauteur de Sears Tower) # 527, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 830 - 527 = 303, return(var1) # 303

prompt: Gary had some stickers. He gave 42 stickers to Lucy and 26 stickers to Alex. If he had 31 stickers left, how many stickers did Gary have at first?
summary: var1 = find(stickers given to Lucy) # 42, var2 = find(stickers given to Alex) # 26, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 42 + 26 = 68, var2 = find(stickers left) # 31, var3 = add(var3, var2), CALL # 68 + 31 = 99, return(var3) # 99
fr_prompt: Gary avait des autocollants. Il a donné 42 autocollants à Lucy et 26 autocollants à Alex. S'il lui restait 31 autocollants, combien d'autocollants Gary avait-il au départ ?

prompt: Roger collected 42 pennies, 36 nickels and 15 dimes. He donated some of his coins and had 27 coins left. How many coins did Roger donate?

summary: var1 = find(dogs) # 22, var2 = find(dog-houses) # 5, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 22 / 5 = 4.4, var3 = round(var3), CALL # round(4.4) = 4, return(var3) # 4
fr_prompt: Il y a 22 chiens dans la ferme. Ils vivent dans 5 niches à parts égales. Combien y a-t-il de chiens dans chaque niche ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(chiens) # 22, var2 = trouver(niches) # 5, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 22 / 5 = 4.4, var3 = round(var3), CALL # round(4.4) = 4, retour(var3) # 4

prompt: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. They have 2 sets of tables, each having the same number of chairs. If there are a total of 12 chairs in the backyardHow many chairs are there for each table?
summary: var1 = find(total chairs) # 12, var2 = find(number of sets) # 2, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 12 / 2 = 6, return(var1) # 6
fr_prompt: Ils ont décidé d'organiser la fête dans leur jardin. Ils ont 2 ensembles de tables, chacun ayant le même nombre de chaises. S'il y a un total de 12 chaises dans le jardin, combien y a-t-il de chaises pour chaque table ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre total de chaises) # 12, var2 = find(nombre d'ensembles) # 2, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 12 / 2 = 6, return(var1) # 6

prompt: When they got there, they saw that SFL is already filled with people. Every entrance has a long line, with 283 people waiting to get in. If SFL has 5 entrances, how many people in total are waiting to get in?
summary: var1 = find(people per entrance) # 283, var2 = find(number of entrances) # 5, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 283 * 5 = 1415, return(var1) # 1415
fr_prompt: Arrivés sur place, ils ont vu que SFL était déjà rempli de monde. Chaque entrée a une longue file d'attente, avec 283 personnes qui attendent pour entrer. Si SFL a 5 entrées, combien de personnes au total attendent pour entrer ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(personnes par entrée) # 283, var2 = find(nombre d'entrées) # 5, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 283 * 5 = 1415, return(var1) # 1415

prompt: Mrs. Hilt read 4 books. Each book had 17 chapters in it. How many chapters did Mrs. Hilt read?
summary: var1 = find(books read) # 4, var2 = find(chapters per book) # 17, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 4 * 17 = 68, return(var3) # 68

fr_summary: var1 = find(livres lus) # 4, var2 = find(chapitres par livre) # 17, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 4 * 17 = 68, return(var3) # 68

prompt: Rachel picked 6 ripe apples from her tree. Now the tree has 2 ripe apples and 4 unripe apples.How many apples did the tree have to begin with?
summary: var1 = find(ripe apples picked) # 6, var2 = find(ripe apples on the tree) # 2, var3 = find(unripe apples on the tree) # 4, var4 = add(var2, var3), var5 = add(var4, var1), CALL # 2 + 4 + 6 = 12, return(var5) # 12

prompt: Rachel picked 3 ripe apples from her tree. Now the tree has 2 ripe apples and 27 unripe apples.How many ripe apples did the tree have to begin with?
summary: var1 = find(Ripe apples picked) # 3, var2 = find(Ripe apples now) # 2, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 3 + 2 = 5, return(var3) # 5
fr_prompt: Rachel a cueilli 3 pommes mûres de son arbre. Maintenant, l'arbre a 2 pommes mûres et 27 pommes non mûres. Combien de pommes mûres l'arbre avait-il au départ ?

prompt: Matthew gave equal numbers of crackers to his 18 friends. If he had 36 crackersHow many crackers did each person eat?
summary: var1 = find(total crackers) # 36, var2 = find(number of friends) # 18, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 36 / 18 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: Faye was placing 30 pencils into rows with 5 pencils in each row.How many rows could she make?

prompt: Some deer families are also moving out to avoid the shortage of grass that will result from occasional blizzards. If there are 79 deer families in the area and around 45 of them stayed, how many deer families moved out?
summary: var1 = find(deer families in the area) # 79, var2 = find(deer families stayed) # 45, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 79 - 45 = 34, return(var1) # 34

prompt: It's Valentine's Day in the city and Mayor Harvey wants to celebrate by giving the institutions for women some flowers. His first beneficiary was the nursing home for old women. He bought 3 sets of flowers, 90 pieces each. How many flowers did he buy for the nursing home?
summary: var1 = find(number of sets of flowers) # 3, var2 = find(pieces per set) # 90, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 3 * 90 = 270, return(var1) # 270
fr_prompt: C'est la Saint-Valentin dans la ville et le maire Harvey veut célébrer en offrant des fleurs aux institutions pour femmes. Son premier bénéficiaire fut la maison de retraite pour femmes âgées. Il a acheté 3 ensembles de fleurs, 90 pièces chacun. Combien de fleurs a-t-il achetées pour la maison de retraite ?

prompt: There are 72 boys and 90 girls on the math team. For the next math competition, Mr. Johnson would like to arrange all of the students in equal rows with only girls or only boys in each row. What is the greatest number of students that can be in each row?
summary: var1 = find(boys) # 72, var2 = find(girls) # 90, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(72,90) = 18, return(var3) # 18
fr_prompt: Il y a 72 garçons et 90 filles dans l'équipe de mathématiques. Pour le prochain concours de mathématiques, M. Johnson aimerait disposer tous les élèves en rangées égales avec uniquement des filles ou uniquement des garçons dans chaque rangée. Quel est le plus grand nombre d'élèves pouvant être dans chaque rangée ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(garçons) # 72, var2 = trouver(filles) # 90, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(72,90) = 18, return(var3) # 18

prompt: Amy uploaded 180 pics to Facebook. If she put the pics into 9 albums with the same number of photos in each album, how many photos were in each album?

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(photos) # 180, var2 = trouver(albums) # 9, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 180 / 9 = 20, retour(var3) # 20

prompt: Every day Ryan spends 5 hours on learning chinese and some more hours on learning english. If he spends 2 hours more on learning english than on learning chineseHow many hours does he spend on learning english?
summary: var1 = find(hours spent on Chinese) # 5, var2 = find(hours spent on English more than Chinese) # 2, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 2 = 7, return(var3) # 7

prompt: An architect built a house with ten bedrooms total. If the second floor had two bedrooms. How many bedrooms does the first floor have?

prompt: An industrial machine made 196 shirts. If it made one minute to make 7 shirts, how many minutes was it working?

prompt: Jesse's rooms are 19 feet long and 18 feet wide. If she has 20 rooms in allHow much carpet does she need to cover the floors of all rooms?

prompt: Annie takes trick or treating seriously. So, days before Halloween, she makes sure that the details of her trick or treating are well planned. prompt: A ballet class wants to divide its 90 members into some large groups at 7 members each and some small groups at 3 members each. In order to make the least number of groups, how many large groups should be made?
summary: var1 = find(ballet class members) # 90, var2 = find(large group size) # 7, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 90 / 7 = 12.86, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(12.86) = 12, return(var3) # 12

fr_summary: var1 = find(jeux gauches) # 6, var2 = find(jeux donnés) # 13, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 13 = 19, return(var3) # 19

prompt: There are 2 American people, 4 French people and 4 Chinese people a meeting room. 3 of them leave. How many people are left the meeting room?
summary: var1 = find(American people) # 2, var2 = find(French people) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 4 = 6, var4 = find(Chinese people) # 4, var5 = add(var3, var4), CALL # 6 + 4 = 10, var6 = find(people leaving) # 3, var7 = subtract(var5, var6), CALL # 10 - 3 = 7, return(var7) # 7
fr_prompt: Il y a 2 américains, 4 français et 4 chinois une salle de réunion. 3 d'entre eux partent. Combien de personnes reste-t-il dans la salle de réunion ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Américains) # 2, var2 = find(Français) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 4 = 6, var4 = find(Chinois) # 4, var5 = add (var3, var4), CALL # 6 + 4 = 10, var6 = find(personnes partant) # 3, var7 = subtract(var5, var6), CALL # 10 - 3 = 7, return(var7) # 7

prompt: After eating a hearty meal they went to see the Buckingham palace. There were 39 paintings in the Buckingham palace. There, Rachel learned that 661 visitors came to the Buckingham palace that day. If there were 600 visitors the previous dayHow many more visitors visited the Buckingham palace on that day than on the previous day?
summary: var1 = find(visitors) #661, var2 = find(previous visitors) #600, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 661 - 600 = 61, return(var3) # 61
fr_prompt: Après avoir mangé un copieux repas, ils sont allés voir le palais de Buckingham. Il y avait 39 peintures dans le palais de Buckingham. Là, Rachel apprend que 661 visiteurs sont venus au palais de Buckingham ce jour-là. S'il y avait 600 visiteurs la veille, combien de visiteurs de plus ont visité le palais de Buckingham ce jour-là que la veille ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(visiteurs) #661, var2 = trouver(visiteurs précédents) #600, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 661 - 600 = 61, retour(var3) # 61

prompt: Faye had seven books. If she bought twelve more at a yard sale, how many would she have total?
summary: var1 = find(starting books) # 7, var2 = find(yard sale books) # 12, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 7 + 12 = 19, return(var1) # 19

fr_summary: var1 = find(starting books) # 7, var2 = find(yard sale books) # 12, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 7 + 12 = 19, return(var1) # 19

prompt: Winnie completed eighty-six consecutive repetitions for rope jumping yesterday. Today she completed only seventy-three. How many repetitions did she fell behind?
summary: var1 = find(yesterday's repetitions) # 86, var2 = find(today's repetitions) # 73, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 86 - 73 = 13, return(var3) # 13
fr_prompt: Hier, Winnie a effectué quatre-vingt-six répétitions consécutives de saut à la corde. Aujourd'hui, elle n'en a terminé que soixante-treize. Combien de répétitions a-t-elle pris du retard ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(répétition d'hier) # 86, var2 = trouver(répétition d'aujourd'hui) # 73, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 86 - 73 = 13, retour(var3) # 13

prompt: George bought 17 pieces of candy to give to 5 of his friends. If he wants to give each friend the same amount, how many pieces would he have left over?
summary: var1 = find("candy pieces") # 17, var2 = find("friends") # 5, var3 = mod(var1, var2) # 17 % 5 = 2, return(var3) # 2

fr_summary: var1 = find("bonbons") # 17, var2 = find("amis") # 5, var3 = mod(var1, var2) # 17 % 5 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: At a comic convention Janet wanted to buy 8 comics, but each one costs 4 dollars, plus it costs 2 to even get in. How much money should she take with her so she can get in and buy what she wants?
summary: var1 = find(comics) # 8, var2 = find(price per comic) # 4, var1 = var1 * var2, CALL # 8 * 4 = 32, var2 = find(entry fee) # 2, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 32 + 2 = 34, return(var1) # 34
fr_prompt: Lors d'une convention de bandes dessinées, Janet voulait acheter 8 bandes dessinées, mais chacune coûte 4 dollars, plus il en coûte même 2 pour entrer. Combien d'argent devrait-elle emporter avec elle pour pouvoir entrer et acheter ce qu'elle veut ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(comics) # 8, var2 = find(prix par comic) # 4, var1 = var1 * var2, CALL # 8 * 4 = 32, var2 = find(frais d'entrée) # 2, var1 = add(var1, var2), APPEL # 32 + 2 = 34, retour (var1) # 34

prompt: Baker made some cakes. He sold 145 of them. If he still has 72 cakes leftHow many cakes did baker make?

prompt: While playing a trivia game, Team A scored 2 points, Team B scored 9 points and Team C scored 4 points. How many points were scored total?
summary: var1 = find(Team A points) # 2, var2 = find(Team B points) # 9, var3 = find(Team C points) # 4, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 9 = 11, var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 11 + 4 = 15, return(var5) # 15
fr_prompt: Lors d'un jeu-questionnaire, l'équipe A a marqué 2 points, l'équipe B a marqué 9 points et l'équipe C a marqué 4 points. Combien de points ont été marqués au total ?

prompt: Randy has some blocks. He uses 52 blocks to build a tower. If there are 38 blocks leftHow many blocks did he have at the start?

prompt: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 5 cups of sugar and 13 cups of flour. She already put in some cups of flour. If she still needs 12 more cups of flourHow many cups of flour did she put in?
summary: var1 = find(flour needed) # 13, var2 = find(additional flour needed) # 12, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 13 - 12 = 1, return(var3) # 1

fr_summary: var1 = find(farine nécessaire) # 13, var2 = find(farine supplémentaire nécessaire) # 12, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 13 - 12 = 1, return(var3) # 1

prompt: A book has two chapters. The first chapter is 48 pages long. The second chapter is 46 pages long. How many pages does the book have altogether?

prompt: The school is planning a field trip. The school has 87 classrooms. There are 58 students in the school with each classroom having the same number of students. If there are 2 seats on each school bus.How many buses are needed to take the trip?
summary: var1 = find(students) #58, var2 = divide(var1, 87), CALL # 58 / 87 = 0.67, var3 = divide(var1, 2), CALL # 58 / 2 = 29, return(var3) # 29
fr_prompt: L'école prévoit une sortie scolaire. L'école compte 87 salles de classe. Il y a 58 élèves dans l'école, chaque classe ayant le même nombre d'élèves. S'il y a 2 sièges dans chaque bus scolaire. Combien de bus faut-il pour faire le voyage ?

prompt: Frank was reading through his favorite book. The book had 41 chapters, each with the same number of pages. It has a total of 450 pages. It took Frank 30 days to finish the book.How many pages did he read per day?
summary: var1 = find(pages in book) # 450, var2 = find(chapters in book) # 41, var3 = divide(var1, var2), var4 = find(days to finish book) # 30, var5 = divide(var1, var4), CALL # 450 / 41 = 10.97, 450 / 30 = 15, return(var5) # 15
fr_prompt: Frank lisait son livre préféré. Le livre avait 41 chapitres, chacun avec le même nombre de pages. Il compte au total 450 pages. Il a fallu 30 jours à Frank pour terminer le livre. Combien de pages lisait-il par jour ?

prompt: An airplane hangar is 300 feet long. How many planes can fit into it, end to end, if each plane is 40 feet long?

prompt: Amy has 67 balloons. 29 of them are red and 17 are green. The rest of the balloons are blue. How many blue balloons does Amy have?

prompt: Veronica is making emergency-preparedness kits to share with friends. She has 20 bottles of water and 12 cans of food, which she would like to distribute equally among the kits, with nothing left over. What is the greatest number of kits Veronica can make?

prompt: James had 39 stickers. He got some more stickers for his birthday. Then he had 61 stickers. How many stickers did James get for his birthday?

prompt: The company has large and small ink cartridges in stock. How many ink cartridges can you buy with 182 dollars if one cartridge costs 14 dollars ?

prompt: Zoe bought an app that cost $5 dollars. Then each month you have to pay $8 to play online. If she played the game online for 2 months, how much money would she have spent total for the app and the online access?

prompt: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 25 sacks of unripe oranges and 5 sacks of ripe oranges per day.How many sacks of ripe oranges will they have after 73 days of harvest?

prompt: Corey earns extra money finding lost golf balls. His goal is to find 48 golfballs every weekend. He found 16 golf balls on Saturday. He found 18 more golf balls on Sunday. How many more golf balls does Corey need to find to reach his goal?
summary: var1 = find(goal golf balls) # 48, var2 = add(16, 18), CALL # 16 + 18 = 34, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 48 - 34 = 14, return(var3) # 14

Il a trouvé 18 autres balles de golf dimanche. Combien de balles de golf Corey doit-il encore trouver pour atteindre son objectif ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (balles de golf de but) # 48, var2 = ajouter (16, 18), APPEL # 16 + 18 = 34, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 48 - 34 = 14, retour (var3) # 14

prompt: White t - shirts can be purchased in packages. If mom buys 66 white t - shirts where each package has 3 white t - shirts.How many packages will she have?

prompt: At the edge of the forest, an anthill is blocking the way out. In order to pass through, he needs to help the ants gather food. If the ants need 911 grains of food and they already have 762, how many more grains are needed to be gathered?
summary: var1 = find(total food needed) # 911 gr., var2 = find(current food gathered by ants) # 762 gr., var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 911 - 762 = 149 gr., return(var1) # 149 gr.
fr_prompt: A l'orée de la forêt, une fourmilière bloque la sortie. Pour passer, il doit aider les fourmis à ramasser de la nourriture. Si les fourmis ont besoin de 911 grains de nourriture et qu'elles en ont déjà 762, combien de grains de plus faut-il récolter ?

prompt: Mr. Lee gave out first place ribbons after each event. He had 38 ribbons at the start. He gave away 14 ribbons in the morning. He gave out 16 ribbons in the afternoon. How many ribbons did Mr. Lee have left?

prompt: If the cave is 974 feet deep and they are already at 588 feet, how much farther until they reach the end of the cave?

prompt: Tiffany was collecting cans for recycling. On monday she had 7 bags of cans. The next day she found 12 more bags worth of cans.How many more bags did she find on the next day than she had on monday?
summary: var1 = find(cans Monday) #7, var2 = find(cans found) #12, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 12 - 7 = 5, return(var3) # 5

fr_summary: var1 = find(cans Monday) #7, var2 = find(cans found) #12, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 12 - 7 = 5, return(var3) # 5

prompt: The Razorback t-shirt shop makes $ 78 dollars off each t-shirt sold. During the Arkansas game and the Texas tech game they sold a total of 186 t-shirts. If they sold 172 t-shirts during the Arkansas gameHow much money did they make from selling the t-shirts during the Texas tech game?

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(t-shirt vendu) #78, var2 = multiplier(var1, 186), APPEL # 78 * 186 = 14148, var3 = trouver(t-shirt jeu Arkansas vendu) #172, var4 = soustraire(186, var3 ), APPEL # 186 - 172 = 14, var5 = multiplier(var4, 78), APPEL # 14 * 78 = 1092, retour(var5) #1092

prompt: Paul had 7 baseball cards he's putting into a binder with 3 on each page. How many cards will he have on the page that isn't full?

summary: var1 = find(girls) #732, var2 = find(girls joined) #682, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 732 + 682 = 1414, var3 = find(boys) #761, var4 = find(boys joined) #8, var3 = add(var3, var4), CALL # 761 + 8 = 769, var5 = add(var1, var3), CALL # 1414 + 769 = 2183, return(var1) # 1414

prompt: Lemon heads come in packages of 5. Ann ate 78 Lemon Heads. How many Lemon Heads does she have left?

prompt: Adam could fit 11 action figures on each shelf in his room. His room has 4 shelves and 40 cabinets.How many total action figures could his shelves hold?

fr_prompt: Adam pouvait placer 11 figurines articulées sur chaque étagère de sa chambre. Sa chambre a 4 étagères et 40 armoires. Combien de figurines au total ses étagères pourraient-elles contenir ?

prompt: 2 children were riding on the bus. At the bus stop some more children got on the bus. Then there were 10 children altogether on the bus.How many more children are on the bus now than there were before the bus stop?

prompt: 5 boats are in the lake. Each boat has 3 people. How many people are on boats in the lake?

prompt: Last week Fred had 33 dollars and Jason had 95 dollars. Over the weekend Fred delivered newspapers earning 16 dollars and washed cars earning 74 dollars.How much money did Fred earn over the weekend?

prompt: At band practice there were 4 rows of students with 8 students in each row and then another 9 students in the back. How many students were there total?

prompt: Henry had $54. Later he sold some of his old toys and got another $2. How much money does he have total?

prompt: Baker made 133 cakes. If he sold 51 of themHow many more cakes did baker make than those he sold?

fr_prompt: Baker a fait 133 gâteaux. S'il en a vendu 51, combien de gâteaux le boulanger a-t-il fait de plus que ceux qu'il a vendus ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(gâteaux faits) # 133, var2 = find(gâteaux vendus) # 51, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 133 - 51 = 82, return(var3) # 82

prompt: Jane's mom picked cherry tomatoes from their backyard. If she gathered 56 cherry tomatoes and is about to place them in small jars which can contain 8 cherry tomatoes at a time, how many jars will she need?
summary: var1 = find(cherry tomatoes) # 56, var2 = find(cherry tomatoes per jar) # 8, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 56 / 8 = 7, return(var1) # 7
fr_prompt: La mère de Jane a cueilli des tomates cerises dans son jardin. Si elle a cueilli 56 tomates cerises et qu'elle est sur le point de les placer dans de petits bocaux pouvant contenir 8 tomates cerises à la fois, de combien de bocaux aura-t-elle besoin ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(tomates cerises) # 56, var2 = trouver(tomates cerises par pot) # 8, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 56 / 8 = 7, retour(var1) # 7

prompt: 9 boys went to water trees. There were 29 trees. If each of them watered the equal amount of trees, how many trees did each boy water?
summary: var1 = find(trees) # 29, var2 = find(boys) # 9, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 29 / 9 = 3.22, var3 = round(var3), CALL # round(3.22) = 3, return(var3) # 3
fr_prompt: 9 garçons sont allés arroser les arbres. Il y avait 29 arbres. Si chacun d'eux a arrosé la même quantité d'arbres, combien d'arbres chaque garçon a-t-il arrosé ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(arbres) # 29, var2 = trouver(garçons) # 9, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 29 / 9 = 3.22, var3 = round(var3), CALL # round(3.22) = 3 , retour(var3) # 3

prompt: I put another number into my machine. The machine added 15 and then subtracted 6. The number 35 came out of the machine. What number did I put in?
summary: var1 = find(result) # 35, var2 = subtract(var1, 15) # 35 - 15 = 20, var3 = add(var2, 6) # 20 + 6 = 26, return(var3) # 26
fr_prompt: J'ai mis un autre numéro dans ma machine. La machine a ajouté 15 puis soustrait 6. Le nombre 35 est sorti de la machine. Quel numéro ai-je mis ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(résultat) # 35, var2 = soustraire(var1, 15) # 35 - 15 = 20, var3 = ajouter(var2, 6) # 20 + 6 = 26, retourner(var3) # 26

prompt: Katie had 57 new games and 39 old games. Her friends had 34 new games.How many more games does Katie have than her friends?
summary: var1 = find(Katie's new games) # 57, var2 = find(friends' new games) # 34, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 57 - 34 = 23, var4 = find(Katie's old games) # 39, var5 = add(var3, var4), CALL # 23 + 39 = 62, return(var5) # 62
fr_prompt: Katie avait 57 nouveaux jeux et 39 anciens jeux. Ses amis avaient 34 nouveaux jeux. Combien de jeux Katie a-t-elle de plus que ses amis ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(les nouveaux jeux de Katie) # 57, var2 = find(les nouveaux jeux d'amis) # 34, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 57 - 34 = 23, var4 = find(les anciens jeux de Katie) # 39 , var5 = ajouter(var3, var4), APPEL # 23 + 39 = 62, retour(var5) # 62

prompt: Allan brought 6 balloons and Jake brought 3 balloons to the park. Jake then bought 4 more balloons at the park.How many more balloons did Jake have than Allan in the park?
summary: var1 = find(Allan balloons) #6, var2 = find(Jake balloons initially) #3, var3 = add(var2, 4), CALL # 3 + 4 = 7, var4 = subtract(var3, var1), CALL # 7 - 6 = 1, return(var4) # 1
fr_prompt: Allan a apporté 6 ballons et Jake a apporté 3 ballons au parc. Jake a ensuite acheté 4 ballons de plus au parc. Combien de ballons de plus Jake avait-il qu'Allan dans le parc ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (Allan ballons) #6, var2 = trouver (Jake ballons initialement) #3, var3 = ajouter (var2, 4), APPEL # 3 + 4 = 7, var4 = soustraire (var3, var1), APPEL # 7 - 6 = 1, retour(var4) # 1

prompt: A chef used five potatoes to make fries for the lunch crowd. Later he used another two potatoes for the dinner crowd. How many potatoes did he use total?
summary: var1 = find(lunch potatoes) # 5, var2 = find(dinner potatoes) # 2, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 2 = 7, return(var3) # 7

fr_summary: var1 = find(pommes de terre) # 5, var2 = find(pommes de terre) # 2, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 2 = 7, return(var3) # 7

prompt: Dave had 10 apps on his phone. He added 11 new apps. After deleting some he had 4 left.How many apps did he delete?

prompt: 19 children take a minibus to the zoo. They are to sit 2 or 3 to a seat. There are 7 seats. How many seats will have 3 children seated on them?
summary: var1 = find(children) # 19, var2 = find(seats) # 7, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 19 / 7 = 2.714 (rounded down to 2), var4 = subtract(var1, var3 * var2), CALL # 19 - (2 * 7) = 5, return(var4) # 5
fr_prompt: 19 enfants prennent un minibus pour le zoo. Ils doivent s'asseoir 2 ou 3 par siège. Il y a 7 places. Combien de sièges auront 3 enfants assis dessus ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(enfants) # 19, var2 = trouver(sièges) # 7, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 19 / 7 = 2,714 (arrondi à 2), var4 = soustraire(var1, var3 * var2 ), APPEL # 19 - (2 * 7) = 5, retour (var4) # 5

prompt: Shannon is making identical balloon arrangements for a party. She has 32 maroon balloons, 24 white balloons, and 16 orange balloons. She wants each arrangement to have the same number of each color. What is the greatest number of arrangements that she can make if every balloon is used?
summary: var1 = find("maroon balloons") # 32, var2 = find("white balloons") # 24, var3 = find_gcd(var1, var2) # GCD(32,24) = 8, var4 = find("orange balloons") # 16, var5 = find_gcd(var3, var4) # GCD(8,16) = 8, return(var5) # 8
fr_prompt: Shannon fait des arrangements de ballons identiques pour une fête. Elle a 32 ballons marrons, 24 ballons blancs et 16 ballons oranges. Elle veut que chaque arrangement ait le même nombre de chaque couleur. Quel est le plus grand nombre d'arrangements qu'elle peut faire si chaque ballon est utilisé ?

prompt: For Gwen's birthday she received 2 dollars from her mom. Her dad gave her 4 more dollars. If she spent 3 dollars.How much money did she still have?
summary: var1 = find(money from mom) # 2, var2 = find(money added by dad) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(money spent) # 3, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 2 + 4 - 3 = 3, return(var5) # 3
fr_prompt: Pour l'anniversaire de Gwen, elle a reçu 2 dollars de sa mère. Son père lui a donné 4 dollars de plus. Si elle a dépensé 3 dollars, combien d'argent avait-elle encore ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(argent de maman) # 2, var2 = trouver(argent ajouté par papa) # 4, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(argent dépensé) # 3, var5 = soustraire(var3, var4) , APPEL # 2 + 4 - 3 = 3, retour(var5) # 3

prompt: A waiter had 47 customers to wait on. If 41 customers left and he got another 20 customers, how many customers would he have?
summary: var1 = find(starting customers) # 47, var2 = find(left customers) # 41, var1 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 47 - 41 = 6, var2 = find(new customers) # 20, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 20 = 26, return(var1) # 26
fr_prompt: Un serveur avait 47 clients à servir. Si 41 clients partaient et qu'il en recevait 20 autres, combien de clients aurait-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(clients débutants) # 47, var2 = trouver(clients restants) # 41, var1 = sub(var1, var2), APPEL # 47 - 41 = 6, var2 = trouver(nouveaux clients) # 20, var1 = ajouter (var1, var2), APPEL # 6 + 20 = 26, retour (var1) # 26

prompt: Next on his checklist is wax to stick the feathers together and colors to paint them. He needs a total of 49 g of colors to paint them. If the feathers require 288 g of wax and right now he just needs 260 gHow many grams of wax does he already have?
summary: var1 = find(required wax for feathers) #288, var2 = find(needed wax) #260, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 288 - 260 = 28, return(var3) #28
fr_prompt: Le prochain sur sa liste de contrôle est la cire pour coller les plumes ensemble et les couleurs pour les peindre. Il lui faut au total 49 g de couleurs pour les peindre. Si les plumes nécessitent 288 g de cire et qu'en ce moment il n'a besoin que de 260 g Combien de grammes de cire a-t-il déjà ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (cire requise pour les plumes) # 288, var2 = trouver (cire nécessaire) # 260, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 288 - 260 = 28, retour (var3) # 28

prompt: After the final bell rang, Buddy ran to the school bus with his new friends. On his ride home, he counted 36 students sitting on the left side of the bus and 27 sitting on the right. How many students are on the bus ride home?
summary: var1 = find(left side students) # 36, var2 = find(right side students) # 27, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 36 + 27 = 63, return(var1) # 63
fr_prompt: Après le dernier coup de cloche, Buddy a couru vers le bus scolaire avec ses nouveaux amis. Lors de son retour à la maison, il a compté 36 élèves assis du côté gauche du bus et 27 assis du côté droit. Combien y a-t-il d'élèves dans le bus pour rentrer chez eux ?

prompt: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 9 cups of sugar 14 cups of flour and 40 cups of salt. She already put in 4 cups of flour.How many more cups of flour than cups of sugar does she need to add now?
summary: var1 = find(calls for sugar cups) # 9, var2 = find(calls for flour cups) # 14, var3 = find(flour cups put in) # 4, var4 = subtract(var2, var3), var5 = subtract(var4, var1), CALL # (14 - 4) - 9 = 10 - 9 = 1, return(var5) # 1
fr_prompt: Marie prépare un gâteau. La recette demande 9 tasses de sucre 14 tasses de farine et 40 tasses de sel. Elle a déjà mis 4 tasses de farine. Combien de tasses de farine de plus que de tasses de sucre doit-elle ajouter maintenant ?

prompt: Bobby had 21 pieces of candy. He ate 5 pieces of candy. Then he ate 9 more.How many pieces of candy does he still have left?
summary: var1 = find(initial pieces of candy) # 21, var2 = find(pieces of candy eaten first time) # 5, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = find(pieces of candy eaten second time) # 9, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 21 - 5 = 16, 16 - 9 = 7, return(var5) # 7
fr_prompt: Bobby avait 21 bonbons. Il a mangé 5 bonbons. Puis il en a mangé 9 de plus. Combien lui reste-t-il de bonbons ?

prompt: Amanda has two pieces of ribbon, one 8 inches long and the other 16 inches long. To decorate an album, she wants to cut them up to produce many pieces of ribbon that are all of the same length, with no ribbon left over. What is the greatest length, in inches, that she can make them?
summary: var1 = find("ribbon 1") # 8, var2 = find("ribbon 2") # 16, var3 = find_gcd(var1, var2) # GCD(8,16) = 8, return(var3) # 8
fr_prompt: Amanda a deux morceaux de ruban, un de 8 pouces de long et l'autre de 16 pouces de long. Pour décorer un album, elle veut les découper pour produire plusieurs morceaux de ruban qui sont tous de la même longueur, sans reste de ruban. Quelle est la plus grande longueur, en pouces, qu'elle peut leur faire ?
fr_summary: var1 = find("ruban 1") # 8, var2 = find("ruban 2") # 16, var3 = find_gcd(var1, var2) # GCD(8,16) = 8, return(var3) # 8

prompt: At the produce store you can buy 2 bags of bananas for $12.46. How much would it cost if you were to buy 6 bags?

prompt: Allan brought 5 balloons and Jake brought 3 balloons to the park.How many more balloons did Allan have than Jake in the park?

fr_prompt: Marie prépare un gâteau. La recette demande 14 tasses de farine et 6 tasses de sucre. Elle a déjà mis 5 tasses de farine. Combien de tasses de farine de plus que de tasses de sucre doit-elle ajouter maintenant ?

prompt: She had 35 mistletoe stickers and wanted to place them equally in 8 cards. How many mistletoe stickers will she have left?

prompt: There were 44 laptops in the shop, and Mike divided them equally into 5 rows. How many are left?
summary: var1 = find(laptops) # 44, var2 = find(rows) # 5, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 44 / 5 = 8.8, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(8.8) = 8, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 5 * 8 = 40, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 44 - 40 = 4, return(var5) # 4

prompt: There are 4 squirrels in a tree with 2 nuts. What's the difference of the number of squirrels and nuts over there?

prompt: Sarah's Shipping and Ryan's Mail Services both ship packages. Sarah's trucks will only carry loads of 18 packages. In contrast, Ryan's trucks will only carry loads of 11 packages. If both businesses ended up shipping the same number of packages this morning, what is the minimum number of packages each must have shipped?

prompt: There are 32 students in the class. The teacher divided them into 5 equal groups. How many students are left?

prompt: Abigail's mom said she will be home from work in 65 minutes. It is 4:27 p.m., and Abigail has dance practice at 6:00 p.m. How much time will Abigail have between the time that her mom gets home from work and the beginning of dance practice?

fr_prompt: La mère d'Abigail a dit qu'elle rentrerait du travail dans 65 minutes. Il est 16h27 et Abigail a une pratique de danse à 18h00. Combien de temps aura Abigail entre le moment où sa mère rentre du travail et le début de la pratique de la danse ?

prompt: There are 22 dogs in the farm. They live in 5 dog-houses equally. How many dogs are left?
summary: var1 = find(dogs) # 22, var2 = find(dog-houses) # 5, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 22 / 5 = 4.4, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(4.4) = 4, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 5 * 4 = 20, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 22 - 20 = 2, return(var5) # 2
fr_prompt: Il y a 22 chiens dans la ferme. Ils vivent dans 5 niches à parts égales. Combien reste-t-il de chiens ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(chiens) # 22, var2 = trouver(niches) # 5, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 22 / 5 = 4.4, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(4.4 ) = 4, var4 = multiplier (var2, var3), APPEL # 5 * 4 = 20, var5 = soustraire (var1, var4), APPEL # 22 - 20 = 2, retour (var5) # 2

prompt: Charlie and his father, an engineer, decided to build a treehouse in their backyard. In order to start constructing the house, Charlie and his father needed to gather some wood from the forest. If they initially have 15 extra planks of wood in the house and Charlie and his father got 10 planks of wood each, how many pieces of wood do they have in total?
summary: var1 = find(extra planks) # 15, var2 = find(Charlie planks) # 10, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 10 = 25, var2 = find(father planks) # 10, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 25 + 10 = 35, return(var1) # 35
fr_prompt: Charlie et son père, un ingénieur, ont décidé de construire une cabane dans les arbres dans leur jardin. Afin de commencer à construire la maison, Charlie et son père devaient ramasser du bois dans la forêt. S'ils ont initialement 15 planches de bois supplémentaires dans la maison et que Charlie et son père ont chacun 10 planches de bois, combien de morceaux de bois ont-ils au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(planches supplémentaires) # 15, var2 = trouver(planches Charlie) # 10, var1 = ajouter(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 10 = 25, var2 = trouver(planches père) # 10, var1 = ajouter (var1, var2), APPEL # 25 + 10 = 35, retour (var1) # 35

prompt: Frank put 11 pieces of candy in each bag. If he had 22 pieces of candyHow many bags would he have?
summary: var1 = find(candy pieces) #22, var2 = find(pieces per bag) #11, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 22 / 11 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: Vondra is putting together bags of groceries to donate to charity. She has 7 boxes of macaroni and cheese and 14 cans of vegetables. prompt: Faye was placing her pencils and crayons into 19 rows with 4 pencils and 27 crayons in each row.How many pencils does she have?
summary: var1 = find(pencils in each row) # 4, var2 = find(rows) # 19, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 4 * 19 = 76, return(var3) # 76
fr_prompt: Faye plaçait ses crayons et ses crayons en 19 rangées avec 4 crayons et 27 crayons dans chaque rangée. Combien de crayons a-t-elle ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(crayons dans chaque rangée) # 4, var2 = find(rows) # 19, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 4 * 19 = 76, return(var3) # 76

prompt: Jerry had $18. He spent $6 on new video games. How much money does he have now?
summary: var1 = find(total money) # 18, var2 = find(spent money) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 18 - 6 = 12, return(var3) # 12
fr_prompt: Jerry avait 18 $. Il a dépensé 6 $ pour de nouveaux jeux vidéo. Combien d'argent a-t-il maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (argent total) # 18, var2 = trouver (argent dépensé) # 6, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 18 - 6 = 12, retour (var3) # 12

prompt: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 82 sacks of ripe oranges and 61 sacks of unripe oranges per day.How many sacks of ripe oranges will they have after 25 days of harvest?
summary: var1 = find(ripe oranges per day) # 82, var2 = find(days of harvest) # 25, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 82 * 25 = 2050, return(var3) # 2050
fr_prompt: Il est ensuite allé voir la récolte des oranges. Il a découvert qu'ils récoltaient 82 sacs d'oranges mûres et 61 sacs d'oranges non mûres par jour. Combien de sacs d'oranges mûres auront-ils après 25 jours de récolte ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(oranges mûres par jour) # 82, var2 = find(jours de récolte) # 25, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 82 * 25 = 2050, return(var3) # 2050

prompt: Hay's Linens sells hand towels in sets of 17 and bath towels in sets of 6. If the store sold the same number of each this morning, what is the smallest number of each type of towel that the store must have sold?
summary: var1 = find(hand towels) # 17, var2 = find(bath towels) # 6, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(17,6) = 102, return(var3) # 102
fr_prompt: Hay's Linens vend des essuie-mains par lots de 17 et des serviettes de bain par lots de 6. Si le magasin a vendu le même nombre de chaque ce matin, quel est le plus petit nombre de chaque type de serviettes que le magasin a dû vendre ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(essuie-mains) # 17, var2 = find(serviettes de bain) # 6, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(17,6) = 102, return(var3) # 102

prompt: The woods behind Jerry's house were 6 miles wide and 3 miles long. What is the area of the woods?
summary: var1 = find(width) # 6, var2 = find(length) # 3, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 6 * 3 = 18, return(var3) # 18
fr_prompt: Les bois derrière la maison de Jerry mesuraient 6 miles de large et 3 miles de long. Quelle est la superficie du bois ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(largeur) # 6, var2 = trouver(longueur) # 3, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 6 * 3 = 18, retour(var3) # 18

prompt: Professor Treehead of the Flora University requested his students to participate. He said that they planted 15 species of trees in the natural park, 20 species of trees in the neighboring forest and 10 species of trees all around different locations in town. How many species of trees were planted by the students?
summary: var1 = find(species of trees in natural park) # 15, var2 = find(species of trees in neighboring forest) # 20, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 20 = 35, var2 = find(species of trees all around town) # 10, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 35 + 10 = 45, return(var1) # 45
fr_prompt: Le professeur Treehead de la Flora University a demandé à ses étudiants de participer. Il a dit qu'ils ont planté 15 espèces d'arbres dans le parc naturel, 20 espèces d'arbres dans la forêt voisine et 10 espèces d'arbres à différents endroits de la ville. Combien d'espèces d'arbres ont été plantées par les élèves ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(espèces d'arbres dans le parc naturel) # 15, var2 = trouver(espèces d'arbres dans la forêt voisine) # 20, var1 = ajouter(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 20 = 35, var2 = trouver(espèces d'arbres tout autour de la ville) # 10, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 35 + 10 = 45, return(var1) # 45

prompt: Sean is playing Monopoly with his friends. He already has 27 houses. Sean traded in 8 houses for money to buy Park Place. He collected so much rent that he decided to buy 12 more houses. How many houses did Sean have then?
summary: var1 = find(houses) # 27, var2 = subtract(var1, 8) # 27 - 8 = 19, var3 = add(var2, 12) # 19 + 12 = 31, return(var3) # 31
fr_prompt: Sean joue au Monopoly avec ses amis. Il a déjà 27 maisons. Sean a échangé 8 maisons contre de l'argent pour acheter Park Place. Il a perçu tellement de loyers qu'il a décidé d'acheter 12 autres maisons. Combien de maisons Sean possédait-il alors ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(maisons) # 27, var2 = soustraire(var1, 8) # 27 - 8 = 19, var3 = ajouter(var2, 12) # 19 + 12 = 31, retourner(var3) # 31

prompt: Lana's mom was buying extra school supplies for her and her siblings. If she bought three packs of glue sticks with seven glue sticks in each pack, how many did she get total?
summary: var1 = find(glue stick packs) # 3, var2 = find(glue sticks per pack) # 7, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 3 * 7 = 21, return(var3) # 21
fr_prompt: La mère de Lana achetait des fournitures scolaires supplémentaires pour elle et ses frères et sœurs. Si elle a acheté trois paquets de bâtons de colle avec sept bâtons de colle dans chaque paquet, combien en a-t-elle reçu au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(colle stick packs) # 3, var2 = find(glue sticks per pack) # 7, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 3 * 7 = 21, return(var3) # 21

prompt: Mrs. Hilt had 15 cents. She bought a pencil for 11 cents. How much money did she have left?
summary: var1 = find(initial cents) # 15, var2 = find(cost of pencil) # 11, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 15 - 11 = 4, return(var3) # 4
fr_prompt: Mme Hilt avait 15 cents. Elle a acheté un crayon pour 11 cents. Combien d'argent lui restait-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(cents initiaux) # 15, var2 = trouver(coût du crayon) # 11, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 15 - 11 = 4, retour(var3) # 4

prompt: There were eight red roses and two white roses in the vase. Melanie cut some more roses from her flower garden. There are now fourteen red roses in the vase. How many red roses did she cut ?
summary: var1 = find(original red roses) # 8, var2 = find(final red roses) # 14, var1 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 14 - 8 = 6, return(var1) # 6
fr_prompt: Il y avait huit roses rouges et deux roses blanches dans le vase. Mélanie a coupé d'autres roses de son jardin fleuri. Il y a maintenant quatorze roses rouges dans le vase. Combien de roses rouges a-t-elle coupées ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(roses rouges originales) # 8, var2 = trouver(roses rouges finales) # 14, var1 = soustraire(var2, var1), APPEL # 14 - 8 = 6, retour(var1) # 6

prompt: Katie was selling her necklaces at a garage sale. She sold four bead necklaces and three gem stone necklaces. If each necklace cost three dollars, how much money did she earn?
summary: var1 = find(bead necklaces) # 4, var2 = find(gem stone necklaces) # 3, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 3 = 7, var2 = find(cost per necklace) # 3, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 7 * 3 = 21, return(var3) # 21
fr_prompt: Katie vendait ses colliers dans un vide-grenier. Elle a vendu quatre colliers de perles et trois colliers de pierres précieuses. Si chaque collier coûte trois dollars, combien d'argent a-t-elle gagné ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (colliers de perles) # 4, var2 = trouver (colliers de pierres précieuses) # 3, var1 = ajouter (var1, var2), APPEL # 4 + 3 = 7, var2 = trouver (coût par collier) # 3, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 7 * 3 = 21, retour(var3) # 21

prompt: Jack received 3 emails and 64 letters in the morning. He then received 5 emails and 54 letters in the afternoon.How many emails did jack receive in the day?
summary: var1 = find(emails in morning) #3, var2 = find(emails in afternoon) #5, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 3 + 5 = 8, return(var3) # 8
fr_prompt: Jack a reçu 3 e-mails et 64 lettres dans la matinée. Il a ensuite reçu 5 e-mails et 54 lettres dans l'après-midi. Combien d'e-mails Jack a-t-il reçus dans la journée ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(emails du matin) #3, var2 = find(emails de l'après-midi) #5, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 3 + 5 = 8, return(var3) # 8

prompt: Cody was helping his mom wash clothes. They washed 4 short sleeve shirts and 5 long sleeve shirts. How many shirts did they wash total?
summary: var1 = find(short sleeve shirts) # 4, var2 = find(long sleeve shirts) # 5, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 5 = 9, return(var3) # 9

fr_summary: var1 = find(chemises à manches courtes) # 4, var2 = find(chemises à manches longues) # 5, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 5 = 9, return(var3) # 9

prompt: Keith has 5530 marbles and 3 pencils. If he shares the marbles among 79 friends, how many marbles does each friend get?
summary: var1 = find(marbles) # 5530, var2 = find(friends) # 79, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 5530 / 79 = 70, var4 = multiply(var3, var2), CALL # 70 * 79 = 5530, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 5530 - 5530 = 0, return(var3) # 70

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(billes) # 5530, var2 = trouver(amis) # 79, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 5530 / 79 = 70, var4 = multiplier(var3, var2), CALL # 70 * 79 = 5530, var5 = soustraire(var1, var4), APPEL # 5530 - 5530 = 0, retour(var3) # 70

prompt: Allen, Shiela's brother, likes to play with blocks. Shiela repainted Allen's old blocks in different colors. If Allen has 49 identical blocks and there are 7 blocks for every color of paint used, how many colors did Shiela use?

prompt: Haley collected 9 cans for recycling. If she put 7 cans in one bag, what's the difference between the number of recycling cans that Haley collected and put in the bag?
summary: var1 = find(Haley's collected cans) # 9, var2 = find(cans put in the bag) # 7, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 9 - 7 = 2, return(var1) # 2

prompt: Henry was playing tic-tac-toe. He won 2 times, lost 2 times and it was a draw 10 times. How many times did Henry play?
summary: var1 = find(Henry wins) # 2, var2 = find(Henry losses) # 2, var3 = find(draws) # 10, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 2 = 4, var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 4 + 10 = 14, return(var5) # 14
fr_prompt: Henry jouait au tic-tac-toe. Il a gagné 2 fois, perdu 2 fois et c'était un match nul 10 fois. Combien de fois Henry a-t-il joué ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Henry gagne) # 2, var2 = find(Henry perd) # 2, var3 = find(nul) # 10, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 2 = 4, var5 = add( var4, var3), APPEL # 4 + 10 = 14, retour (var5) # 14

prompt: Melissa scored a total of 91 points in 13 games scoring the same for each game.How many points did she score in each game?

prompt: A baker made ninety cakes. If he sold eighty-three of them, how many cakes would the baker still have?

summary: var1 = find(crayons) # 210, var2 = find(friends) # 30, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 210 / 30 = 7, var4 = multiply(var3, var2), CALL # 7 * 30 = 210, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 210 - 210 = 0, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: Denise a 210 crayons et 3 blocs. Si elle partage les crayons entre 30 amis, combien de crayons chaque ami reçoit-il ?

prompt: Lizette has 813 stamps. She has 125 more stamps than Minerva. How many stamps does Minerva have?

fr_summary: var1 = find(timbres Lizette) # 813, var2 = find(timbres plus que Minerva) # 125, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 813 - 125 = 688, return(var3) # 688

prompt: The radio station gave away a $100 bill for every 100th caller. Every 30th caller received free concert tickets. How many callers must get through before one of them receives both a coupon and a concert ticket?

prompt: Cheryl counted 16 lemons. Lori bought 28 more lemons. How many lemons do the girls have altogether?
summary: var1 = find(lemons counted by Cheryl) # 16, var2 = add(var1, 28), CALL # 16 + 28 = 44, return(var2) # 44

fr_summary: var1 = find(citrons comptés par Cheryl) # 16, var2 = add(var1, 28), CALL # 16 + 28 = 44, return(var2) # 44

prompt: Chloe was making baggies of cookies with seven cookies in each bag. If she had thirty-four chocolate chip cookies and twenty-nine oatmeal cookies, how many baggies could she make?
summary: var1 = find(chocolate chip cookies) # 34, var2 = find(oatmeal cookies) # 29, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 34 + 29 = 63, var2 = find(cookies per baggy) # 7, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 63 / 7 = 9, return(var3) # 9
fr_prompt: Chloé faisait des sacs de biscuits avec sept biscuits dans chaque sac. Si elle avait trente-quatre biscuits aux pépites de chocolat et vingt-neuf biscuits à l'avoine, combien de sachets pourrait-elle faire ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(biscuits aux pépites de chocolat) # 34, var2 = find(biscuits à l'avoine) # 29, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 34 + 29 = 63, var2 = find(cookies per baggy) # 7, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 63 / 7 = 9, retour(var3) # 9

prompt: 5 children were riding on the bus. At the bus stop 63 children got off the bus while some more got on the bus. Then there were 14 children altogether on the bus.How many more children got on the bus than those that got off?
summary: var1 = find(initial children count) # 5, var2 = find(children off the bus) # 63, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = find(children on the bus) # 14, var5 = subtract(var4, var1), CALL # 5 - 63 = -58, 14 - 5 = 9, return(var5) # 9
fr_prompt: 5 enfants montaient dans le bus. À l'arrêt de bus, 63 enfants sont descendus du bus tandis que d'autres sont montés dans le bus. Ensuite, il y avait 14 enfants en tout dans le bus. Combien d'enfants de plus sont montés dans le bus que ceux qui en sont descendus ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(nombre initial d'enfants) # 5, var2 = trouver(enfants hors du bus) # 63, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(enfants dans le bus) # 14, var5 = soustraire(var4, var1), APPEL # 5 - 63 = -58, 14 - 5 = 9, retour (var5) # 9

prompt: Jared is reviewing his cell phone bill. When he gets to the text message part, he notices that he sent 1 text message in November, 2 text messages in December, 4 text messages in January, and 8 text messages in February. If this pattern continues, how many text messages will Jared send in March?

prompt: Janet was practicing for a marathon. She practiced for 9 days, running 8 miles each day. How many miles did Janet run altogether?

fr_summary: var1 = find(Andy wrappers) # 34, var2 = find(wrappers from Max) # 15, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 34 + 15 = 49, return(var1) # 49

prompt: An envelope from the post office is 4 inches wide and 4 inches long. What is the area of the envelope?
