prompt: Carmen did 4 sit-ups on Sunday, 8 sit-ups on Monday, 16 sit-ups on Tuesday, 32 sit-ups on Wednesday, and 64 sit-ups on Thursday. If this pattern continues, how many sit-ups will Carmen do on Friday?
summary: var1 = find("sit-ups on Sunday") # 4, var2 = find("sit-ups on Monday") # 8, var3 = find("sit-ups on Tuesday") # 16, var4 = find("sit-ups on Wednesday") # 32, var5 = find("sit-ups on Thursday") # 64, var6 = multiply(var5, 2) # 64 * 2 = 128, return(var6) # 128
fr_prompt: Carmen a fait 4 redressements assis dimanche, 8 redressements assis lundi, 16 redressements assis mardi, 32 redressements assis mercredi et 64 redressements assis jeudi. Si cette tendance continue, combien de redressements assis Carmen fera-t-elle vendredi ?
fr_summary: var1 = find("sit-ups on Sunday") # 4, var2 = find("sit-ups on Monday") # 8, var3 = find("sit-ups on Tuesday") # 16, var4 = find(" sit-ups mercredi") # 32, var5 = find("sit-ups jeudi") # 64, var6 = multiplier(var5, 2) # 64 * 2 = 128, return(var6) # 128

prompt: Paco had 26 salty cookies and 17 sweet cookies. He ate 14 sweet cookies and 9 salty cookies.How many salty cookies did Paco have left?
summary: var1 = find(salty cookies Paco had) # 26, var2 = find(salty cookies Paco ate) # 9, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 26 - 9 = 17, return(var1) # 17
fr_prompt: Paco avait 26 biscuits salés et 17 biscuits sucrés. Il a mangé 14 biscuits sucrés et 9 biscuits salés. Combien de biscuits salés restait Paco ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(biscuits salés que Paco avait) # 26, var2 = find(biscuits salés que Paco a mangés) # 9, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 26 - 9 = 17, return(var1) # 17

prompt: George had 648 pieces of candy. If he split the candy into 8 bags with the same amount of candy in each bag, how many pieces would each bag have in it?
summary: var1 = find(candy) # 648, var2 = find(bags) # 8, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 648 / 8 = 81, return(var3) # 81
fr_prompt: George avait 648 bonbons. S'il divise les bonbons en 8 sacs avec la même quantité de bonbons dans chaque sac, combien de morceaux chaque sac contiendra-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(bonbons) # 648, var2 = trouver(sacs) # 8, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 648 / 8 = 81, retour(var3) # 81

prompt: There are 87 oranges and 290 bananas in Philip's collection. If the bananas are organized into 2 groups and oranges are organized into 93 groupsHow big is each group of bananas?
summary: var1 = find(bananas in collection) # 290, var2 = find(banana groups) # 2, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 290 / 2 = 145, return(var3) # 145
fr_prompt: Il y a 87 oranges et 290 bananes dans la collection de Philip. Si les bananes sont organisées en 2 groupes et les oranges en 93 groupes, quelle est la taille de chaque groupe de bananes ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(bananes en collection) # 290, var2 = trouver(groupes de bananes) # 2, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 290 / 2 = 145, retour(var3) # 145

prompt: Lexie's younger brother helped pick up all the paper clips in Lexie's room. He was able to collect 81 paper clips. If he wants to distribute the paper clips in 9 boxes, how many paper clips will each box contain?
summary: var1 = find(number of paper clips) # 81, var2 = find(number of boxes) # 9, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 81 / 9 = 9, return(var1) # 9
fr_prompt: Le frère cadet de Lexie a aidé à ramasser tous les trombones dans la chambre de Lexie. Il a pu collecter 81 trombones. S'il veut répartir les trombones dans 9 boîtes, combien de trombones chaque boîte contiendra-t-elle ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(nombre de trombones) # 81, var2 = trouver(nombre de boîtes) # 9, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 81 / 9 = 9, retour(var1) # 9

prompt: Last week Fred had 49 dollars and Jason had 3 dollars. Fred washed cars over the weekend and now has 112 dollars. Jason delivered newspapers and now has 63 dollars.How much money did Jason earn by delivering newspapers?
summary: var1 = find(Fred initial dollars) # 49, var2 = find(Fred final dollars) # 112, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), var4 = find(Jason initial dollars) # 3, var5 = find(Jason final dollars) # 63, var6 = subtract(var5, var4), CALL # 112 - 49 = 63, 63 - 3 = 60, return(var6) # 60
fr_prompt: La semaine dernière, Fred avait 49 dollars et Jason avait 3 dollars. Fred a lavé des voitures pendant le week-end et a maintenant 112 dollars. Jason a livré des journaux et a maintenant 63 dollars. Combien d'argent Jason a-t-il gagné en livrant des journaux ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(dollars initiaux de Fred) # 49, var2 = trouver(dollars finaux de Fred) # 112, var3 = soustraire(var2, var1), var4 = trouver(dollars initiaux de Jason) # 3, var5 = trouver(dollars finaux de Jason) # 63, var6 = soustraire(var5, var4), APPEL # 112 - 49 = 63, 63 - 3 = 60, retour(var6) # 60

prompt: Debby bought 153 water bottles when they were on sale. She drank the same number of bottles each day. If the bottles lasted for 17 daysHow many bottles did she drink each day?
summary: var1 = find(total bottles) # 153, var2 = find(sale duration) # 17, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 153 / 17 = 9, return(var3) # 9
fr_prompt: Debby a acheté 153 bouteilles d'eau lorsqu'elles étaient en solde. Elle buvait le même nombre de bouteilles chaque jour. Si les bouteilles ont duré 17 jours Combien de bouteilles a-t-elle bues chaque jour ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(total bouteilles) # 153, var2 = trouver(durée de la vente) # 17, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 153 / 17 = 9, retour(var3) # 9

prompt: The drama club meets in the school auditorium every 3 days, and the choir meets there every 5 days. If the groups are both meeting in the auditorium today, then how many days from now will they next have to share the auditorium?
summary: var1 = find("drama club meets") # 3, var2 = find("choir meets") # 5, var3 = find_lcm(var1, var2) # LCM(3,5) = 15, return(var3) # 15
fr_prompt: Le club de théâtre se réunit dans l'auditorium de l'école tous les 3 jours et la chorale s'y réunit tous les 5 jours. Si les groupes se réunissent tous les deux dans l'auditorium aujourd'hui, dans combien de jours devront-ils ensuite partager l'auditorium ?
fr_summary: var1 = find("le club de théâtre se rencontre") # 3, var2 = find("la chorale se rencontre") # 5, var3 = find_lcm(var1, var2) # LCM(3,5) = 15, return(var3) # 15

prompt: A teacher had 38 worksheets to grade. If she graded 4, but then another 15 were turned in, how many worksheets would she have to grade?
summary: var1 = find(worksheets) # 38, var2 = find(graded worksheets) # 4, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 38 - 4 = 34, var2 = find(newly turned in worksheets) # 15, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 34 + 15 = 49, return(var1) # 49
fr_prompt: Un enseignant avait 38 feuilles de travail à noter. Si elle a noté 4, mais qu'ensuite 15 autres ont été rendues, combien de feuilles de travail devrait-elle corriger ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(feuilles de travail) # 38, var2 = trouver(feuilles de travail notées) # 4, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 38 - 4 = 34, var2 = trouver(feuilles de travail nouvellement rendues) # 15, var1 = ajouter(var1, var2), APPEL # 34 + 15 = 49, retour(var1) # 49

prompt: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 12 cups of flour and 13 cups of sugar. She already put in 2 cups of sugar.How many more cups of sugar does she need to add?
summary: var1 = find(sugar needed) # 13, var2 = find(sugar added) # 2, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 13 - 2 = 11, return(var3) # 11
fr_prompt: Marie prépare un gâteau. La recette demande 12 tasses de farine et 13 tasses de sucre. Elle a déjà mis 2 tasses de sucre. Combien de tasses de sucre doit-elle ajouter ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(sucre nécessaire) # 13, var2 = find(sucre ajouté) # 2, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 13 - 2 = 11, return(var3) # 11

prompt: David did 56 more push-ups than Zachary in gym class today. If David did 38 push-upsHow many push-ups did Zachary and David do altogether?
summary: var1 = find(David push-ups) # 38, var2 = find(difference between David and Zachary push-ups) # 56, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = add(var1, var3), CALL # 38 + (38 - 56) = 38 - 18 = 20, return(var4) # 20
fr_prompt: David a fait 56 pompes de plus que Zachary en cours de gym aujourd'hui. Si David a fait 38 pompesCombien de pompes Zachary et David ont-ils fait en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(David push-ups) # 38, var2 = find(difference between David and Zachary push-ups) # 56, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = add(var1, var3), CALL # 38 + (38 - 56) = 38 - 18 = 20, retour(var4) # 20

prompt: There were 51 geese in the farmer's field. 28 of the geese flew away. How many geese were left in the field?
summary: var1 = find(geese in the field) # 51, var2 = find(geese that flew away) # 28, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 51 - 28 = 23, return(var1) # 23
fr_prompt: Il y avait 51 oies dans le champ du fermier. 28 des oies se sont envolées. Combien d'oies restaient-elles dans le champ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(oies dans le champ) # 51, var2 = trouver(oies qui se sont envolées) # 28, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 51 - 28 = 23, retour(var1) # 23

prompt: Bianca was practicing for a marathon. To prepare she ran 8 miles the first day and 4 miles the next day. How many miles did Bianca run altogether?
summary: var1 = find(miles ran first day) # 8, var2 = find(miles ran second day) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 8 + 4 = 12, return(var3) # 12
fr_prompt: Bianca s'entraînait pour un marathon. Pour se préparer, elle a couru 8 miles le premier jour et 4 miles le lendemain. Combien de kilomètres Bianca a-t-elle parcourus en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(miles parcourus le premier jour) # 8, var2 = find(miles parcourus le deuxième jour) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 8 + 4 = 12, return(var3) # 12

prompt: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 16 sacks per day and that each sack containes 57 oranges.How many days will it take to harvest 80 sacks of oranges?
summary: var1 = find(oranges in one sack) # 57, var2 = find(sacks harvested per day) # 16, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), var4 = find(total sacks to harvest) # 80, var5 = divide(var4, var2), CALL # 57 * 16 = 912, 80 / 16 = 5, return(var5) # 5
fr_prompt: Il est ensuite allé voir la récolte des oranges. Il a découvert qu'ils récoltaient 16 sacs par jour et que chaque sac contenait 57 oranges. Combien de jours faudra-t-il pour récolter 80 sacs d'oranges ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(oranges dans un sac) # 57, var2 = trouver(sacs récoltés par jour) # 16, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(total des sacs à récolter) # 80, var5 = diviser(var4 , var2), APPEL # 57 * 16 = 912, 80 / 16 = 5, retour (var5) # 5

prompt: Rachel picked 7 ripe apples from her tree. Now the tree has 5 apples still on it. If 3 of those are ripe and the rest are unripeHow many unripe apples does the tree have now?
summary: var1 = find(apples picked) # 7, var2 = find(apples still on tree) # 5, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(ripe apples still on tree) # 3, var5 = subtract(var2, var4), CALL # 5 - 3 = 2, return(var5) # 2
fr_prompt: Rachel a cueilli 7 pommes mûres de son arbre. Maintenant, l'arbre a encore 5 pommes dessus. Si 3 d'entre elles sont mûres et que les autres ne sont pas mûres, combien de pommes non mûres l'arbre a-t-il maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(pommes cueillies) # 7, var2 = trouver(pommes encore sur l'arbre) # 5, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(pommes mûres encore sur l'arbre) # 3, var5 = soustraire(var2, var4), APPEL # 5 - 3 = 2, retour (var5) # 2

prompt: 29 campers went rowing and 66 campers went hiking in the morning. 26 campers went rowing in the afternoon.How many more campers went rowing in the morning than in the afternoon?
summary: var1 = find(Morning rowing) # 29, var2 = find(Afternoon rowing) # 26, var3 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 29 - 26 = 3, return(var3) # 3
fr_prompt: 29 campeurs ont fait de l'aviron et 66 campeurs ont fait de la randonnée le matin. 26 campeurs ont ramé l'après-midi. Combien de campeurs de plus ont ramé le matin que l'après-midi ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(aviron du matin) # 29, var2 = find(aviron de l'après-midi) # 26, var3 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 29 - 26 = 3, return(var3) # 3

prompt: While playing a video game Ned lost thirteen lives. Now he has seventy lives. How many lives did Ned have at the start?
summary: var1 = find(current lives) # 70, var2 = find(lost lives) # 13, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 70 + 13 = 83, return(var3) # 83

fr_summary: var1 = find(vies actuelles) # 70, var2 = find(vies perdues) # 13, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 70 + 13 = 83, return(var3) # 83

prompt: Rachel had to complete 5 pages of math homework, 10 pages of reading homework and 6 more pages of biology homework.How many pages of reading and biology homework did she have to complete?

prompt: There are 5 flowers and 3 bees. What's the difference of the number of flowers and bees over there?

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(fleurs) # 5, var2 = trouver(abeilles) # 3, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 5 - 3 = 2, retour(var1) # 2

prompt: The cave is 1218 feet deep and they are already at 849 feet. If they are travelling at speed of 17How much farther until they reach the end of the cave?
summary: var1 = find(depth of the cave) # 1218, var2 = find(depth travelled) # 849, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 1218 - 849 = 369, return(var3) # 369
fr_prompt: La grotte a 1218 pieds de profondeur et ils sont déjà à 849 pieds. S'ils voyagent à une vitesse de 17, combien de temps jusqu'à ce qu'ils atteignent la fin de la grotte ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(profondeur de la grotte) # 1218, var2 = find(profondeur parcourue) # 849, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 1218 - 849 = 369, return(var3) # 369

prompt: She also tried to get to know the teachers in the school. She found out that there are 7 departments in the school and each department has 20 teachers. How many teachers are there in total?
summary: var1 = find(number of departments) # 7, var2 = find(number of teachers per department) # 20, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 7 * 20 = 140, return(var1) # 140
fr_prompt: Elle a également essayé de connaître les enseignants de l'école. Elle a découvert qu'il y avait 7 départements dans l'école et que chaque département comptait 20 enseignants. Combien y a-t-il d'enseignants au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre de départements) # 7, var2 = find(nombre d'enseignants par département) # 20, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 7 * 20 = 140, return(var1) # 140

prompt: Upon finishing the treehouse, Charlie's mother served them freshly baked cookies. If Charlie ate 15 cookies, his father ate 10 and his mother only ate 5, how many cookies were eaten in total?
summary: var1 = find(Charlie cookies) # 15, var2 = find(father cookies) # 10, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 10 = 25, var2 = find(mother cookies) # 5, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 25 + 5 = 30, return(var1) # 30
fr_prompt: Après avoir terminé la cabane dans les arbres, la mère de Charlie leur a servi des biscuits fraîchement sortis du four. Si Charlie a mangé 15 biscuits, son père en a mangé 10 et sa mère n'en a mangé que 5, combien de biscuits ont été mangés au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Charlie cookies) # 15, var2 = find(father cookies) # 10, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 10 = 25, var2 = find(mother cookies) # 5, var1 = add (var1, var2), APPEL # 25 + 5 = 30, retour (var1) # 30

prompt: Gwen was organizing her book case making sure each of the shelves had exactly four books on it. If she had five shelves of mystery books and three shelves of picture books, how many books did she have total?
summary: var1 = find(mystery shelves) # 5, var2 = find(picture shelves) # 3, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 3 = 8, var4 = find(books per shelf) # 4, var5 = multiply(var3, var4), CALL # 8 * 4 = 32, return(var5) # 32
fr_prompt: Gwen organisait sa bibliothèque en s'assurant que chacune des étagères contenait exactement quatre livres. Si elle avait cinq étagères de livres mystérieux et trois étagères de livres d'images, combien de livres avait-elle au total ?

prompt: Next on his checklist are wax glues to stick the feathers together. If the feathers require 469 g of wax and right now he just needs 257 g, how many grams of wax glue does he already have?
summary: var1 = find(total wax needed) # 469 g, var2 = find(current wax) # 257 g, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 469 - 257 = 212 g, return(var1) # 212 g
fr_prompt: Le prochain sur sa liste de contrôle est la colle à la cire pour coller les plumes ensemble. Si les plumes nécessitent 469 g de cire et qu'en ce moment il n'a besoin que de 257 g, combien de grammes de cire colle a-t-il déjà ?

prompt: Melody made 26 cut-outs of Christmas trees with red shiny balls. If she planned to paste 4 of this to the front cover of a certain number of cards, how many cut-outs of Christmas trees will Melody have left?
summary: var1 = find(cut-outs) # 26, var2 = find(cut-outs per card) # 4, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 26 / 4 = 6 with a remainder of 2, var4 = find(remainder) # 2, return(var4) # 2
fr_prompt: Melody a réalisé 26 découpes d'arbres de Noël avec des boules rouges brillantes. Si elle prévoyait d'en coller 4 sur la couverture d'un certain nombre de cartes, combien de sapins de Noël découpés restera-t-il à Melody ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(découpes) # 26, var2 = find(découpes par carte) # 4, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 26 / 4 = 6 avec un reste de 2, var4 = find( reste) # 2, retour(var4) # 2

prompt: A pet store had sixty-eight gerbils. If they sold fourteen of them, what's the difference between the number of gerbils that they had before selling and they sold?
summary: var1 = find(gerbils before selling) # 68, var2 = find(gerbils sold) # 14, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 68 - 14 = 54, return(var1) # 54
fr_prompt: Une animalerie avait soixante-huit gerbilles. S'ils en ont vendu quatorze, quelle est la différence entre le nombre de gerbilles qu'ils avaient avant de vendre et qu'ils ont vendues ?

prompt: Baker's friend bought 137 cakes from him. If he had made 169 cakes initiallyHow many cakes would baker still have?

prompt: Every day Ryan spends 6 hours on learning english 7 hours on learning chinese and 3 hours on learning spanish.How many hours does he spend on learning english, chinese and spanish in all?
summary: var1 = find(hours spent on learning english) # 6, var2 = find(hours spent on learning chinese) # 7, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(hours spent on learning spanish) # 3, var5 = add(var3, var4), CALL # 6 + 7 = 13, 13 + 3 = 16, return(var5) # 16
fr_prompt: Chaque jour, Ryan passe 6 heures à apprendre l'anglais, 7 heures à apprendre le chinois et 3 heures à apprendre l'espagnol. Combien d'heures passe-t-il à apprendre l'anglais, le chinois et l'espagnol en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(heures passées à apprendre l'anglais) # 6, var2 = find(heures passées à apprendre le chinois) # 7, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(heures passées à apprendre l'espagnol) # 3, var5 = ajouter(var3, var4), APPEL # 6 + 7 = 13, 13 + 3 = 16, retour(var5) # 16

prompt: If Lewis earns a total of $ 460 during 5 weeks of harvestHow much money does he earn each week?

prompt: Jose has 28 chickens and 18 ducks. How many fowls does he have?

fr_summary: var1 = find(poulets) # 28, var2 = find(canards) # 18, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 28 + 18 = 46, return(var3) # 46

prompt: A lawn care company bought 4 lawnmower blade for $8 each. They also bought a spool of weed eater string for $7. How much money did they spend on supplies?
summary: var1 = find(blades) # 4, var2 = find(blade cost) # 8, var1 = var1 * var2, CALL # 4 * 8 = 32, var2 = find(string cost) # 7, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 32 + 7 = 39, return(var1) # 39
fr_prompt: Une entreprise d'entretien des pelouses a acheté 4 lames de tondeuse à gazon pour 8 $ chacune. Ils ont également acheté une bobine de ficelle pour 7 $. Combien d'argent ont-ils dépensé en fournitures?

prompt: Sam received eighty-seven dollars for his birthday. He went to a sporting goods store and bought a baseball glove, baseball, and bat. He had twenty-three dollars left over, how much did he spent on the baseball gear ?
summary: var1 = find(Sam's birthday money) # 87, var2 = find(amount left over) # 23, var2 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 87 - 23 = 64, return(var2) # 64
fr_prompt: Sam a reçu quatre-vingt-sept dollars pour son anniversaire. Il est allé dans un magasin d'articles de sport et a acheté un gant de baseball, une balle de baseball et une batte. Il lui restait vingt-trois dollars, combien a-t-il dépensé pour l'équipement de base-ball ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(argent d'anniversaire de Sam) # 87, var2 = find(montant restant) # 23, var2 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 87 - 23 = 64, return(var2) # 64

prompt: Jack received 3 emails in the afternoon, 5 emails in the morning and 16 emails in the evening.How many more emails did Jack receive in the morning than in the afternoon?
summary: var1 = find(morning emails) # 5, var2 = find(afternoon emails) # 3, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 5 - 3 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: Jack a reçu 3 e-mails l'après-midi, 5 e-mails le matin et 16 e-mails le soir. Combien d'e-mails Jack a-t-il reçus de plus le matin que l'après-midi ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(courriels du matin) # 5, var2 = find(courriels de l'après-midi) # 3, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 5 - 3 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: During summer break 819058 kids from Lawrence county go to camp and the other 668278 kids stay home.How many more kids spent their summer break at the camp compared to those who stayed home?
summary: var1 = find(kids at camp) # 819058, var2 = find(kids stayed home) # 668278, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 819058 - 668278 = 150780, return(var3) # 150780
fr_prompt: Pendant les vacances d'été, 819 058 enfants du comté de Lawrence vont au camp et les 668 278 autres enfants restent à la maison. Combien d'autres enfants ont passé leurs vacances d'été au camp par rapport à ceux qui sont restés à la maison ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(enfants au camp) # 819058, var2 = trouver(enfants restés à la maison) # 668278, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 819058 - 668278 = 150780, retour(var3) # 150780

prompt: Bridget wants to win the giant stuffed panda bear. She needs a total of 75 points to get it. Bridget already scored 35 points at the penny pitch booth. She scored 18 more points on her next try. How many more points does Bridget need?
summary: var1 = find(points needed) # 75, var2 = find(Bridget's points) # 35, var3 = add(var2, 18), CALL # 35 + 18 = 53, var4 = subtract(var1, var3), CALL # 75 - 53 = 22, return(var4) # 22
fr_prompt: Bridget veut gagner le panda géant en peluche. Elle a besoin d'un total de 75 points pour l'obtenir. Bridget a déjà marqué 35 points au stand de penny pitch. Elle a marqué 18 points de plus lors de son essai suivant. De combien de points Bridget a-t-il encore besoin ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(points nécessaires) # 75, var2 = find(points de Bridget) # 35, var3 = add(var2, 18), CALL # 35 + 18 = 53, var4 = subtract(var1, var3), CALL # 75 - 53 = 22, retour(var4) # 22

prompt: The wolves, though accustomed to cold weather, also wanted to move away from the incoming winter. If there are 43 packs of wolves living in the forest and 31 packs went away, how many wolf packs were left in the forest?
summary: var1 = find(wolf packs in the forest) # 43, var2 = find(wolf packs migrated) # 31, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 43 - 31 = 12, return(var1) # 12
fr_prompt: Les loups, bien qu'habitués au froid, voulaient aussi s'éloigner de l'hiver qui arrivait. S'il y a 43 meutes de loups vivant dans la forêt et que 31 meutes ont disparu, combien de meutes de loups sont restées dans la forêt ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(meutes de loups dans la forêt) # 43, var2 = trouver(meutes de loups migrées) # 31, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 43 - 31 = 12, retour(var1) # 12

prompt: Billy was painting a wall in his room. The total area was 8 square feet. If the wall was 2 feet wide, how tall is it?
summary: var1 = find(area) # 8, var2 = find(width) # 2, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 8 / 2 = 4, return(var3) # 4
fr_prompt: Billy peignait un mur dans sa chambre. La superficie totale était de 8 pieds carrés. Si le mur avait 2 pieds de large, quelle est sa hauteur ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(aire) # 8, var2 = trouver(largeur) # 2, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 8 / 2 = 4, retour(var3) # 4

prompt: Because of the decision Sofia asked the students to suggest specific types of food. 457 students suggested adding mashed potatoes while others suggested adding bacon to the menu. If 63 more students suggested adding mashed potatoes than those that suggested baconHow many students suggested bacon?
summary: var1 = find(mashed potatoes students) # 457, var2 = find(difference in students) # 63, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 457 - 63 = 394, return(var3) # 394
fr_prompt: En raison de la décision, Sofia a demandé aux étudiants de suggérer des types d'aliments spécifiques. 457 étudiants ont suggéré d'ajouter de la purée de pommes de terre tandis que d'autres ont suggéré d'ajouter du bacon au menu. Si 63 élèves de plus ont suggéré d'ajouter de la purée de pommes de terre que ceux qui ont suggéré du bacon, combien d'élèves ont suggéré du bacon ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (étudiants en purée de pommes de terre) # 457, var2 = trouver (différence entre les étudiants) # 63, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 457 - 63 = 394, retour (var3) # 394

prompt: Finally, they had to roam around 169 factories to make sure they are throwing their wastes properly. If their group went to 69 factories and the second went to 52, how many factories remain unchecked?
summary: var1 = find(total number of factories) # 169, var2 = find(factories checked by Lizzie's group) # 69, var3 = find(factories checked by other group) # 52, var2 = add(var2, var3), CALL # 69 + 52 = 121, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 169 - 121 = 48, return(var1) # 48
fr_prompt: Enfin, ils ont dû parcourir 169 usines pour s'assurer qu'ils jetaient correctement leurs déchets. Si leur groupe est allé à 69 usines et le second à 52, combien d'usines restent non contrôlées ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre total d'usines) # 169, var2 = find(usines vérifiées par le groupe de Lizzie) # 69, var3 = find(usines vérifiées par un autre groupe) # 52, var2 = add(var2, var3), CALL # 69 + 52 = 121, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 169 - 121 = 48, retour(var1) # 48

prompt: The area of a rectangular garden is 1800 sq. ft. Find the width if its height measures 40 ft.
summary: var1 = find(area) # 1800, var2 = find(height) # 40, var3 = divide(var1, var2) # 1800 / 40 = 45, return(var3) # 45

prompt: Mrs. Hilt has 40 markers. They are divided equally into 7 packages. Mrs. Hilt wants to know how many markers are in each package?
summary: var1 = find(markers) # 40, var2 = find(packages) # 7, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 40 / 7 = 5.71 (rounded to 5), return(var3) # 5

fr_summary: var1 = find(marqueurs) # 40, var2 = find(packages) # 7, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 40 / 7 = 5.71 (arrondi à 5), return(var3) # 5

prompt: Paco had 97 salty cookies and 34 sweet cookies. He ate 15 sweet cookies and 56 salty cookies.How many sweet cookies did Paco have left?
summary: var1 = find(initial sweet cookies) # 34, var2 = find(sweet cookies eaten) # 15, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 34 - 15 = 19, return(var3) # 19

fr_summary: var1 = find(biscuits sucrés initiaux) # 34, var2 = find(biscuits sucrés mangés) # 15, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 34 - 15 = 19, return(var3) # 19

prompt: At the bird zoo, the kids were able to visit 5 different bird cages, each containing 8 different kinds of birds. How many different kinds of birds did the children see from the bird cages?
summary: var1 = find(number of bird cages) # 5, var2 = find(birds per cage) # 8, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 5 * 8 = 40, return(var1) # 40

prompt: An industrial machine worked for 5 minutes. It can make 4 shirts a minute.How many shirts did machine make?

fr_summary: var1 = find(machine a travaillé) #5, var2 = find(chemises par minute) #4, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 5 * 4 = 20, return(var3) # 20

prompt: Annie's friends wanted to make sure that there will be enough utensils to go around. If they already have 10 spoons and 10 forks and they bought 30 more for forks and 20 more spoons, how many utensils do they have available for the party?
summary: var1 = find(initial spoons) # 10, var2 = find(spoons to be added) # 20, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 10 + 20 = 30, var2 = find(initial forks) # 10, var3 = find(forks to be added) # 30, var2 = add(var2, var3), CALL # 10 + 30 = 40, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 30 + 40 = 70, return(var1) # 70
fr_prompt: Les amis d'Annie voulaient s'assurer qu'il y aurait suffisamment d'ustensiles pour tout le monde. S'ils ont déjà 10 cuillères et 10 fourchettes et qu'ils en ont acheté 30 autres pour les fourchettes et 20 autres cuillères, combien d'ustensiles ont-ils à leur disposition pour la fête ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(cuillères initiales) # 10, var2 = trouver(cuillères à ajouter) # 20, var1 = ajouter(var1, var2), CALL # 10 + 20 = 30, var2 = trouver(fourchettes initiales) # 10, var3 = find(forks à ajouter) # 30, var2 = add(var2, var3), CALL # 10 + 30 = 40, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 30 + 40 = 70, return(var1) # 70

prompt: After resting they decided to go for a swim. The depth of the water is 9 times Dean's height. If Ron is 15 feet tall and Dean is 6 feet shorter than RonHow deep was the water?
summary: var1 = find(Ron height) # 15, var2 = find(Dean height difference) # 6, var3 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 15 - 6 = 9, var4 = find(Water depth ratio) # 9, var5 = mult(var3, var4), CALL # 9 * 9 = 81, return(var5) # 81
fr_prompt: Après s'être reposés, ils décidèrent d'aller se baigner. La profondeur de l'eau est 9 fois la hauteur de Dean. Si Ron mesure 15 pieds et que Dean mesure 6 pieds de moins que Ron, quelle était la profondeur de l'eau ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Hauteur de Ron) # 15, var2 = find(Différence de hauteur de Dean) # 6, var3 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 15 - 6 = 9, var4 = find(Rapport de profondeur d'eau) # 9, var5 = mult(var3, var4), APPEL # 9 * 9 = 81, retour(var5) # 81

prompt: There are 5 people on the Green Bay High track team. If a relay race is 150 meters long, and all 5 team members participate, how far will each team member have to run?

prompt: A waiter at 'The Greasy Spoon' restaurant had 39 customers to wait on. During the lunch rush he added another 12 customers. If 49 of the customers didn't leave him a tip, how many customers did leave a tip?
summary: var1 = find(original customers) # 39, var2 = find(added customers) # 12, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 39 + 12 = 51, var4 = subtract(var3, 49), CALL # 51 - 49 = 2, return(var4) # 2
fr_prompt: Un serveur du restaurant 'The Greasy Spoon' avait 39 clients à attendre. Pendant le rush du déjeuner, il a ajouté 12 autres clients. Si 49 des clients ne lui ont pas laissé de pourboire, combien de clients ont laissé un pourboire ?

prompt: There are 10 peaches distributed equally in some baskets. If each basket has 4 red peaches and 6 green peachesHow many baskets of peaches are there?
summary: var1 = find(red peaches) # 4, var2 = find(green peaches) # 6, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(total peaches) # 10, var5 = divide(var4, var3), CALL # 4 + 6 = 10, 10 / 10 = 1, return(var5) # 1
fr_prompt: Il y a 10 pêches réparties équitablement dans certains paniers. Si chaque panier contient 4 pêches rouges et 6 pêches vertes, combien y a-t-il de paniers de pêches ?

prompt: At the arcade Dave spent forty-three tickets on stuffed tiger. Then he had fifty-five left. How many tickets did Dave have to start with?

prompt: Lizzie lives in a very big and polluted city. Being an advocate for the environment, she organized a cleanup drive to help reduce the pollution. They started by cleaning the rivers that flow through and around the city. If her group was able to collect 387 pounds of garbage and another group gathered 39 pounds less than Lizzie's group, how much garbage were the two groups able to gather?
summary: var1 = find(garbage collected by Lizzie's group) # 387, var2 = find(garbage collected by the other group) # 387 - 39 = 348, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 387 + 348 = 735, return(var1) # 735

Ils ont commencé par nettoyer les rivières qui traversent et entourent la ville. Si son groupe a pu ramasser 387 livres de déchets et qu'un autre groupe en a ramassé 39 livres de moins que le groupe de Lizzie, quelle quantité de déchets les deux groupes ont-ils pu ramasser ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(garbage collecté par le groupe de Lizzie) # 387, var2 = find(garbage collecté par l'autre groupe) # 387 - 39 = 348, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 387 + 348 = 735, return( var1) # 735

prompt: There are 40 students in the school band. If the band instructor put the students into rows with 5 students in each row, how many rows could he make?

prompt: Roger had sixty-three dollars. If he spent forty-eight bucks on a new game, how many three dollar toys could he buy with the money he had left?
summary: var1 = find(money) # 63, var2 = find(money spent) # 48, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 63 - 48 = 15, var2 = find(price of toy) # 3, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 15 / 3 = 5, return(var3) # 5
fr_prompt: Roger avait soixante-trois dollars. S'il dépensait quarante-huit dollars pour un nouveau jeu, combien de jouets à trois dollars pourrait-il acheter avec l'argent qu'il lui restait ?

prompt: The roller coaster at the state fair costs 6 tickets per ride. If 8 friends were going to ride the roller coaster, how many tickets would they need?

prompt: Lucy went to the grocery store. She bought 2 packs of cookie and 12 packs of cake. In the end she had 56 amount of change remaining.How many packs of groceries did she buy in all?
summary: var1 = find(cookie) #2, var2 = add(var1, 12), CALL # 2 + 12 = 14, var3 = divide(56, 14), CALL # 56 / 14 = 4, return(var2) #14
fr_prompt: Lucy est allée à l'épicerie. Elle a acheté 2 paquets de biscuits et 12 paquets de gâteaux. À la fin, il lui restait 56 pièces de monnaie. Combien de paquets d'épicerie a-t-elle achetés en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(cookie) #2, var2 = ajouter(var1, 12), CALL # 2 + 12 = 14, var3 = diviser(56, 14), CALL # 56 / 14 = 4, return(var2) #14

prompt: There were 12 people on the bus. At the next stop 4 more people got on the bus. Each bus can not have more than 36 people.How many people are there on the bus now?
summary: var1 = find(people on the bus) # 12, var2 = find(additional people) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(maximum people the bus can carry) # 36, if (var3 > var4), return(var4) # 36, else, return(var3) # 16
fr_prompt: Il y avait 12 personnes dans le bus. Au prochain arrêt, 4 autres personnes sont montées dans le bus. Chaque bus ne peut pas avoir plus de 36 personnes. Combien y a-t-il de personnes dans le bus maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(personnes dans le bus) # 12, var2 = find(personnes supplémentaires) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(maximum de personnes que le bus peut transporter) # 36, if (var3 > var4 ), retour(var4) # 36, sinon, retour(var3) # 16

prompt: There are 757 pounds of sand to be filled into bags. If each bag has a capacity of 65 pounds, how many pounds of sand are there in the bag that is not full?
summary: var1 = find(sand to be filled) # 757, var2 = find(capacity of bag) # 65, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 757 / 65 = 11.71, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(11.71) = 11, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 65 * 11 = 715, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 757 - 715 = 42, return(var5) # 42
fr_prompt: Il y a 757 livres de sable à remplir dans des sacs. Si chaque sac a une capacité de 65 livres, combien de livres de sable y a-t-il dans le sac qui n'est pas plein ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(sable à remplir) # 757, var2 = find(capacité du sac) # 65, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 757 / 65 = 11.71, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round vers le bas (11,71) = 11, var4 = multiplier (var2, var3), CALL # 65 * 11 = 715, var5 = soustraire (var1, var4), CALL # 757 - 715 = 42, retour (var5) # 42

prompt: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 5 sacks of ripe oranges and 74 sacks of unripe oranges per day.How many more sacks of unripe oranges than ripe oranges are harvested per day?
summary: var1 = find(ripe oranges harvested per day) # 5, var2 = find(unripe oranges harvested per day) # 74, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 74 - 5 = 69, return(var3) # 69
fr_prompt: Il est ensuite allé voir la récolte des oranges. Il a découvert qu'ils récoltaient 5 sacs d'oranges mûres et 74 sacs d'oranges non mûres par jour. Combien de sacs d'oranges non mûres de plus que d'oranges mûres sont récoltés par jour ?

prompt: After eating at the restaurant, Mary, Nancy, and Fred decided to divide the bill evenly. Nancy did not have dessert. If each person paid 33 dollars, what was the total of the bill ?
summary: var1 = find(people paying) # 3, var2 = find(amount paid by each person) # 33, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 3 * 33 = 99, return(var1) # 99

prompt: For a party Cody bought eleven cupcakes. After the party he had two left. How many were eaten at the party?
summary: var1 = find(total cupcakes) # 11, var2 = find(left cupcakes) # 2, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 2 = 9, return(var3) # 9

fr_summary: var1 = find(total cupcakes) # 11, var2 = find(left cupcakes) # 2, var3 = soustract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 2 = 9, return(var3) # 9

prompt: There was 1,050 ml of tea in a pot. Anna poured the tea into some cups. If there were 65 ml of tea in each cup, how many cups were filled with tea?
summary: var1 = find(tea in pot) # 1050, var2 = find(tea per cup) # 65, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 1050 / 65 = 16.15, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(16.15) = 16, return(var3) # 16

prompt: Marco and his dad went strawberry picking. Marco's dad's strawberries weighed 11 pounds. If together their strawberries weighed 30 pounds.How much did Marco's strawberries weigh?
summary: var1 = find(dad strawberries) # 11, var2 = find(total strawberries) # 30, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 30 - 11 = 19, return(var3) # 19

fr_summary: var1 = find(papa fraises) # 11, var2 = find(total fraises) # 30, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 30 - 11 = 19, return(var3) # 19

prompt: Mrs. Hilt's favorite first grade classes are baking muffins. Mrs. Brier's class bakes 18 muffins, Mrs. MacAdams's class bakes 20 muffins, and Mrs. Flannery's class bakes 17 muffins. How many muffins does first grade bake in all?

prompt: Mr. Lee wants to load 134 tons of his fruits. A large truck can load 15 tons of fruits and small truck can load 7 tons. In order to use the least number of trucks and have every truck fully occupied, how many small trucks should be used?
summary: var1 = find(tons of fruits) # 134, var2 = find(large truck capacity) # 15, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 134 / 15 = 8.93, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(8.93) = 8, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 15 * 8 = 120, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 134 - 120 = 14, var6 = find(small truck capacity) # 7, var7 = divide(var5, var6), CALL # 14 / 7 = 2, var7 = round_up(var7), CALL # round up(2) = 2, return(var7) # 2
fr_prompt: M. Lee veut charger 134 tonnes de ses fruits. Un gros camion peut charger 15 tonnes de fruits et un petit camion peut charger 7 tonnes. Afin d'utiliser le moins de camions et que chaque camion soit entièrement occupé, combien de petits camions faut-il utiliser ?

prompt: In preparation for a party, Brant is putting desserts onto platters. The chocolate cake is cut into 15 pieces and the cheesecake is cut into 6 pieces. If he wants to prepare identical platters without having any cake left over, what is the greatest number of platters he can prepare?

prompt: I have 3 hundreds, 8 tens, and 3 ones. What number am I?

fr_prompt: Le prochain sur sa liste de courses sont les œufs. S'il a besoin de 222 œufs pour son gâteau et que son ami Andrew lui en a donné 155, combien d'œufs de plus devrait-il acheter ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (nombre total d'œufs nécessaires) # 222, var2 = trouver (œufs actuels) # 155, var1 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 222 - 155 = 67, retour (var1) # 67

prompt: Zoe was unboxing some of her old winter clothes. She found eight boxes of clothing and inside each box there were four scarves and six mittens. How many pieces of winter clothing did Zoe have total?
summary: var1 = find(boxes of clothing) # 8, var2 = find(scarves per box) # 4, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 8 * 4 = 32, var4 = find(mittens per box) # 6, var5 = multiply(var1, var4), CALL # 8 * 6 = 48, var6 = add(var3, var5), CALL # 32 + 48 = 80, return(var6) # 80
fr_prompt: Zoe était en train de déballer certains de ses vieux vêtements d'hiver. Elle a trouvé huit boîtes de vêtements et à l'intérieur de chaque boîte il y avait quatre foulards et six mitaines. Combien de pièces de vêtements d'hiver Zoe avait-elle au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(boîtes de vêtements) # 8, var2 = trouver(écharpes par boîte) # 4, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 8 * 4 = 32, var4 = trouver(mitaines par boîte) # 6, var5 = multiplier (var1, var4), APPEL # 8 * 6 = 48, var6 = ajouter (var3, var5), APPEL # 32 + 48 = 80, retour (var6) # 80

prompt: Haley has 63 magazines in her cabinet. She plans to send it to the recycling office in their area. If she places it in boxes which can contain 9 magazines, how many boxes will she use?
summary: var1 = find(magazines) # 63, var2 = find(magazines per box) # 9, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 63 / 9 = 7, return(var1) # 7
fr_prompt: Haley a 63 magazines dans son armoire. Elle prévoit de l'envoyer au bureau de recyclage de leur région. Si elle le place dans des boîtes pouvant contenir 9 magazines, combien de boîtes utilisera-t-elle ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(magazines) # 63, var2 = find(magazines per box) # 9, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 63 / 9 = 7, return(var1) # 7

prompt: Alyssa has 30 books in her library. She bought several books at a yard sale over the weekend. She now has 88 books in her library. How many books did she buy at the yard sale ?
summary: var1 = find(books before) # 30, var2 = find(books after) # 88, var3 = subtract(var2, var1) # 88 - 30 = 58, return(var3) # 58
fr_prompt: Alyssa a 30 livres dans sa bibliothèque. Elle a acheté plusieurs livres lors d'un vide-grenier ce week-end. Elle a maintenant 88 livres dans sa bibliothèque. Combien de livres a-t-elle achetés au vide-grenier ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(livres avant) # 30, var2 = trouver(livres après) # 88, var3 = soustraire(var2, var1) # 88 - 30 = 58, retour(var3) # 58

prompt: There was 1,050 ml of tea in a pot. Anna poured the tea into some cups. If there were 65 ml of tea in each cup, how much tea was left in the pot?
summary: var1 = find(tea in pot) # 1050, var2 = find(tea per cup) # 65, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 1050 / 65 = 16.15, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(16.15) = 16, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 65 * 16 = 1040, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 1050 - 1040 = 10, return(var5) # 10
fr_prompt: Il y avait 1 050 ml de thé dans une théière. Anna a versé le thé dans des tasses. S'il y avait 65 ml de thé dans chaque tasse, combien de thé restait-il dans la théière ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(thé en pot) # 1050, var2 = trouver(thé par tasse) # 65, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 1050 / 65 = 16.15, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down (16.15) = 16, var4 = multiplier (var2, var3), APPEL # 65 * 16 = 1040, var5 = soustraire (var1, var4), APPEL # 1050 - 1040 = 10, retour (var5) # 10

prompt: Shannon, Brenda's neighbor, joined Brenda in making bracelets. She brought 48 heart-shaped stones and wanted to have 8 of this type of stone in each of the bracelet she makes. How many bracelets with heart-shaped stones can Shannon make?
summary: var1 = find(heart-shaped stones) # 48, var2 = find(stones per bracelet) # 8, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 48 / 8 = 6, return(var1) # 6
fr_prompt: Shannon, la voisine de Brenda, s'est jointe à Brenda pour fabriquer des bracelets. Elle a apporté 48 pierres en forme de cœur et voulait en avoir 8 de ce type dans chacun des bracelets qu'elle fabrique. Combien de bracelets avec des pierres en forme de cœur Shannon peut-elle fabriquer ?

prompt: Tom used 2 batteries on his flashlights, 15 in his toys and 2 in his controllers. What's the difference between the number of Tom's batteries on flashlights and in toys?
summary: var1 = find(Tom's batteries on flashlights) # 2, var2 = find(Tom's batteries in toys) # 15, var1 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 15 - 2 = 13, return(var1) # 13

prompt: A restaurant has 67 tomatoes. 32 are made into salads. Another 21 are made into pasta sauce. How many tomatoes are left?
summary: var1 = find(tomatoes for salad) # 32, var2 = find(tomatoes for sauce) # 21, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 32 + 21 = 53, var4 = find(total tomatoes) # 67, var5 = subtract(var4, var3), CALL # 67 - 53 = 14, return(var5) # 14

prompt: Haley collected 9 cans for recycling. If she put 7 cans in one bag, how many cans did she have left?
summary: var1 = find(total cans) # 9, var2 = find(cans in bag) # 7, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 9 - 7 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: Harry Hound had a terrible earache yesterday. When I peered into his ears yesterday, I found 36 frisky fleas having a party in his right ear and 85 baby fleas sleeping peacefully in his left ear. I cleaned out Harry Hound's ears. How many fleas perished?

prompt: Mrs. Hilt had 43 cents. She bought a pencil for 20 cents and a piece of candy for 5 cents. How much money did she have left?
summary: var1 = find(cost of pencil) # 20 cents, var2 = find(cost of candy) # 5 cents, var3 = find(money Mrs. Hilt had) # 43 cents, var4 = subtract(var3, var1 + var2), CALL # 43 - (20 + 5) = 18, return(var4) # 18 cents

prompt: Luke had 48 dollars in January. By March he had spent 11 dollars. If he got another 21 dollars from his mom, how much money would he have?
summary: var1 = find(Luke's January dollars) # 48, var2 = find(spent dollars) # 11, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 48 - 11 = 37, var2 = find(new dollars from mom) # 21, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 37 + 21 = 58, return(var1) # 58

prompt: Dave had sixteen apps on his phone. After deleting some, he had eight left. How many apps did he delete?

prompt: There are less than 6 dozen eggs in a basket. If the eggs are counted 2, 3, 4, or 5 at a time, there are none left over. How many eggs are there in the basket?
summary: var = find(number of eggs in basket), for i in range(12, 72):, if i % 2 == 0 and i % 3 == 0 and i % 4 == 0 and i % 5 == 0:, var = i, break, return(var) # 60

summary: var1 = find(trees) # 29, var2 = find(boys) # 9, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 29 / 9 = 3.22, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(3.22) = 3, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 9 * 3 = 27, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 29 - 27 = 2, return(var5) # 2

prompt: Adam has 29 marbles in his collection. Mary has 11 fewer marbles than Adam. Greg has 14 more marbles than Adam. How many marbles does Greg have?

prompt: Winter is almost here and most animals are migrating to warmer countries. There are 67 bird families living near the mountain. If 32 bird families flew away for winter, how many bird families were left near the mountain?
summary: var1 = find(bird families near the mountain) # 67, var2 = find(bird families migrated for winter) # 32, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 67 - 32 = 35, return(var1) # 35
fr_prompt: L'hiver est presque là et la plupart des animaux migrent vers des pays plus chauds. Il y a 67 familles d'oiseaux vivant près de la montagne. Si 32 familles d'oiseaux se sont envolées pour l'hiver, combien de familles d'oiseaux sont restées près de la montagne ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(familles d'oiseaux près de la montagne) # 67, var2 = trouver(familles d'oiseaux migrées pour l'hiver) # 32, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 67 - 32 = 35, retour(var1) # 35

prompt: Mayor Harvey wanted to add color to the party. He bought 7 flowers each representing the 7 colors of the rainbow. If he had 70 bouquets of flowers for each color, how many bouquets are there in all?
summary: var1 = find(number of colors) # 7, var2 = find(bouquets per color) # 70, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 7 * 70 = 490, return(var1) # 490
fr_prompt: Le maire Harvey voulait ajouter de la couleur à la fête. Il a acheté 7 fleurs représentant chacune les 7 couleurs de l'arc-en-ciel. S'il avait 70 bouquets de fleurs de chaque couleur, combien y a-t-il de bouquets en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre de couleurs) # 7, var2 = find(bouquets par couleur) # 70, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 7 * 70 = 490, return(var1) # 490

prompt: Mrs. Hilt is baking bread. She needs 5 cups of flour to bake two loaves of bread. How much flour will she need to make one loaf of bread?
summary: var1 = find(flour needed to bake two loaves) # 5, var2 = find(loaves) # 2, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 5 / 2 = 2.5, return(var3) # 2.5
fr_prompt: Mme Hilt fait du pain. Elle a besoin de 5 tasses de farine pour cuire deux miches de pain. De combien de farine aura-t-elle besoin pour faire une miche de pain ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(farine nécessaire pour cuire deux pains) # 5, var2 = find(pains) # 2, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 5 / 2 = 2.5, return(var3) # 2.5

prompt: Tiffany was buying sodas for her and her friends. They needed nine sodas, but Tiffany bought seven extra. How many did she buy?
summary: var1 = find(needed sodas) # 9, var2 = find(extra sodas) # 7, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 9 + 7 = 16, return(var3) # 16
fr_prompt: Tiffany achetait des sodas pour elle et ses amis. Ils avaient besoin de neuf sodas, mais Tiffany en a acheté sept supplémentaires. Combien en a-t-elle acheté ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(besoins sodas) # 9, var2 = find(extra sodas) # 7, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 9 + 7 = 16, return(var3) # 16

prompt: Isabella's hair is 18 inches long. If she gets a haircut and now her hair is 9 inches long, how much of Isabella's hair got cut off?
summary: var1 = find(Isabella's hair was long) # 18, var2 = find(Isabella's hair is long) # 9, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 18 - 9 = 9, return(var3) # 9
fr_prompt: Les cheveux d'Isabella mesurent 18 pouces de long. Si elle se fait couper les cheveux et que ses cheveux mesurent maintenant 9 pouces de long, combien de cheveux d'Isabella ont été coupés ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(les cheveux d'Isabelle étaient longs) # 18, var2 = trouver(les cheveux d'Isabelle sont longs) # 9, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 18 - 9 = 9, retour(var3) # 9

prompt: Kyle bought 3 presents. The first present cost $18. The second present cost $7 more than the first. The third present cost $11 less than the first. How much did Kyle pay for all 3 presents?
summary: var1 = find(first present cost) # 18, var2 = add(var1, 7) # 18 + 7 = 25, var3 = subtract(var1, 11) # 18 - 11 = 7, var4 = add(var1, var2) # 18 + 25 = 43, var5 = add(var4, var3) # 43 + 7 = 50, return(var5) # 50
fr_prompt: Kyle a acheté 3 cadeaux. Le premier cadeau a coûté 18 $. Le deuxième cadeau a coûté 7 $ de plus que le premier. Le troisième cadeau a coûté 11 $ de moins que le premier. Combien Kyle a-t-il payé pour les 3 cadeaux ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(premier coût actuel) # 18, var2 = ajouter(var1, 7) # 18 + 7 = 25, var3 = soustraire(var1, 11) # 18 - 11 = 7, var4 = ajouter(var1, var2) # 18 + 25 = 43, var5 = addition(var4, var3) # 43 + 7 = 50, retour(var5) # 50

prompt: A book has 31 chapters. Each chapter is 61 pages long.How many pages does the book have altogether?
summary: var1 = find(chapters) # 31, var2 = find(pages per chapter) # 61, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 31 * 61 = 1891, return(var3) # 1891
fr_prompt: Un livre comporte 31 chapitres. Chaque chapitre compte 61 pages. Combien de pages le livre compte-t-il en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(chapitres) # 31, var2 = trouver(pages par chapitre) # 61, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 31 * 61 = 1891, retour(var3) # 1891

prompt: The grasshopper, the frog and the mouse had a jumping contest. The grasshopper jumped 25 inches. The frog jumped 32 inches farther than the grasshopper and the mouse jumped 26 inches lesser than the frog.How far did the mouse jump?
summary: var1 = find(jump of grasshopper) # 25, var2 = find(additional jump by frog) # 32, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(difference in jump between frog and mouse) # 26, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 25 + 32 = 57, 57 - 26 = 31, return(var5) # 31
fr_prompt: La sauterelle, la grenouille et la souris ont fait un concours de sauts. La sauterelle a sauté de 25 pouces. La grenouille a sauté 32 pouces de plus que la sauterelle et la souris a sauté 26 pouces de moins que la grenouille. À quelle distance la souris a-t-elle sauté ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(saut de sauterelle) # 25, var2 = trouver(saut supplémentaire par grenouille) # 32, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(différence de saut entre grenouille et souris) # 26, var5 = soustraire (var3, var4), APPEL # 25 + 32 = 57, 57 - 26 = 31, retour (var5) # 31

prompt: While playing a game Sam had ninety-two points. If he scored another three points, how many points would he have total?
summary: var1 = find(starting points) # 92, var2 = find(new points) # 3, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 92 + 3 = 95, return(var1) # 95
fr_prompt: En jouant à un jeu, Sam avait quatre-vingt-douze points. S'il marquait encore trois points, combien de points aurait-il au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(points de départ) # 92, var2 = find(nouveaux points) # 3, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 92 + 3 = 95, return(var1) # 95

prompt: Across the river, he fell into a hole. To get out, he needs to fill it with 823 gallons of water. If the hole initially has 676 gallons, how much water does he need to fill it?
summary: var1 = find(total water needed) # 823 gal., var2 = find(current water in the hole) # 676 gal., var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 823 - 676 = 147 gal., return(var1) # 147 gal.
fr_prompt: De l'autre côté de la rivière, il est tombé dans un trou. Pour sortir, il doit le remplir de 823 gallons d'eau. Si le trou a initialement 676 gallons, combien d'eau a-t-il besoin pour le remplir ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (eau totale nécessaire) # 823 gal., var2 = trouver (eau actuelle dans le trou) # 676 gal., var1 = soustraire (var1, var2), CALL # 823 - 676 ​​= 147 gal., retour (var1 ) # 147 gal.

prompt: Janet's dad took the family out to eat for her birthday. There were 10 people total. There were 8 kids and everyone else was an adult. How many adults were there?
summary: var1 = find(total) # 10, var2 = find(kids) # 8, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 10 - 8 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: Le père de Janet a emmené la famille manger pour son anniversaire. Il y avait 10 personnes au total. Il y avait 8 enfants et tout le monde était un adulte. Combien y avait-il d'adultes ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(total) # 10, var2 = trouver(enfants) # 8, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 10 - 8 = 2, retour(var3) # 2

prompt: Denver the Dog is a famous architect in the city of Animapolis. Together with his engineer friend Wally the Wolf, they decided to build the tallest building ever, the Animus Tower. To make sure the framework of the tower is strongly built, they hired the best builders in town. If they hired 318 beavers and 544 spiders, how many workers in total did they hire to make the framework?
summary: var1 = find(beaver workers) # 318, var2 = find(spider workers) # 544, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 318 + 544 = 862, return(var1) # 862
fr_prompt: Denver the Dog est un célèbre architecte de la ville d'Animapolis. Avec son ami ingénieur Wally le loup, ils ont décidé de construire le plus haut bâtiment de tous les temps, la tour Animus. Pour s'assurer que la charpente de la tour est solidement construite, ils ont embauché les meilleurs constructeurs de la ville. S'ils ont embauché 318 castors et 544 araignées, combien d'ouvriers au total ont-ils embauchés pour fabriquer la charpente ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (travailleurs castors) # 318, var2 = trouver (travailleurs araignées) # 544, var1 = ajouter (var1, var2), APPEL # 318 + 544 = 862, retour (var1) # 862

prompt: Virginia had 13 Sweettarts. If Virginia gave equal numbers of Sweettarts to her 4 friends and then she ate what was left, how many Sweettarts did each person eat?
summary: var1 = find(Sweettarts) # 13, var2 = find(friends) # 4, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 13 / 4 = 3.25, var4 = floor(var3), CALL # floor(3.25) = 3, var5 = multiply(var4, var2), CALL # 3 * 4 = 12, var6 = subtract(var1, var5), CALL # 13 - 12 = 1, return(var4) # 3
fr_prompt: Virginia avait 13 Sweettarts. Si Virginie a donné un nombre égal de Sweettarts à ses 4 amis et qu'elle a ensuite mangé ce qui restait, combien de Sweettarts chaque personne a-t-elle mangées ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Sweettarts) # 13, var2 = find(friends) # 4, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 13 / 4 = 3.25, var4 = floor(var3), CALL # floor(3.25) = 3 , var5 = multiplier(var4, var2), CALL # 3 * 4 = 12, var6 = soustraire(var1, var5), CALL # 13 - 12 = 1, return(var4) # 3

prompt: Faye was placing her pencils into rows with 22 pencils in each row. She had 6 packs of pencils each one having 14 pencils.How many pencils does she have?
summary: var1 = find(pencils in a pack) #14, var2 = multiply(var1, 6), CALL # 14 * 6 = 84, return(var2) # 84
fr_prompt: Faye plaçait ses crayons en rangées avec 22 crayons dans chaque rangée. Elle avait 6 paquets de crayons chacun contenant 14 crayons. Combien de crayons a-t-elle ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(crayons dans un pack) #14, var2 = multiplier(var1, 6), CALL # 14 * 6 = 84, return(var2) # 84

prompt: The ratio of the length of Joey's rope to Chad's rope is 8:3. Joey's rope is 56 cm long. How long is Chad's rope?
summary: var1 = find(Joey rope length) # 56, var2 = find(Joey to Chad ratio) # 8, var3 = find(Chad to Joey ratio) # 3, var4 = multiply(var1, var3), var5 = divide(var4, var2), return(var5) # 21
fr_prompt: Le rapport entre la longueur de la corde de Joey et celle de Chad est de 8:3. La corde de Joey mesure 56 cm de long. Quelle est la longueur de la corde de Chad ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Joey rope length) # 56, var2 = find(Joey to Chad ratio) # 8, var3 = find(Tchad to Joey ratio) # 3, var4 = multiplier(var1, var3), var5 = diviser(var4, var2), retour(var5) # 21

prompt: A museum had thirteen paintings. If they got rid of eight of them, how many pictures would they have left?
summary: var1 = find(total paintings) # 13, var2 = find(gotten rid paintings) # 8, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 13 - 8 = 5, return(var3) # 5
fr_prompt: Un musée avait treize tableaux. S'ils se débarrassaient de huit d'entre eux, combien d'images leur resterait-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(tableaux totaux) # 13, var2 = find(tableaux débarrassés) # 8, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 13 - 8 = 5, return(var3) # 5

prompt: Matt has two pieces of cord, one 15 feet long and the other 12 feet long. He wants to cut them up to produce many pieces of cord that are all of the same length, with no cord left over. What is the greatest length, in feet, that he can make them?
summary: var1 = find(cord 1) # 15, var2 = find(cord 2) # 12, var3 = gcd(var1, var2) # gcd(15, 12) = 3, return(var3) # 3
fr_prompt: Matt a deux morceaux de corde, l'un de 15 pieds de long et l'autre de 12 pieds de long. Il veut les couper pour produire de nombreux morceaux de corde qui sont tous de la même longueur, sans reste de corde. Quelle est la plus grande longueur, en pieds, qu'il puisse leur faire ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(corde 1) # 15, var2 = trouver(corde 2) # 12, var3 = pgcd(var1, var2) # pgcd(15, 12) = 3, retour(var3) # 3

prompt: Paco had 40 cookies. He ate 2 of them. Then he bought 37 more cookiesHow many cookies did Paco have left?
summary: var1 = find(cookies) #40, var2 = subtract(var1, 2), CALL # 40 - 2 = 38, var3 = add(var2, 37), CALL # 38 + 37 = 75, return(var3) # 75
fr_prompt: Paco avait 40 biscuits. Il en a mangé 2. Puis il a acheté 37 autres cookiesCombien de cookies reste-t-il à Paco ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(cookies) #40, var2 = soustraire(var1, 2), CALL # 40 - 2 = 38, var3 = add(var2, 37), CALL # 38 + 37 = 75, return(var3) # 75

prompt: Lexie has a lot of art materials. She needs to organize all these materials into containers. She counted her crayons and found out that she has 80 crayons which she will place in crayon boxes. Every crayon box can contain 8 crayons. How many crayon boxes does she need?
summary: var1 = find(crayons per box) # 8, var2 = find(number of crayons) # 80, var1 = divide(var2, var1), CALL # 80 / 8 = 10, return(var1) # 10
fr_prompt: Lexie a beaucoup de matériel d'art. Elle doit organiser tous ces matériaux dans des conteneurs. Elle a compté ses crayons et a découvert qu'elle avait 80 crayons qu'elle placerait dans des boîtes de crayons. Chaque boîte de crayons peut contenir 8 crayons. De combien de boîtes de crayons a-t-elle besoin ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(crayons par boîte) # 8, var2 = trouver(nombre de crayons) # 80, var1 = diviser(var2, var1), APPEL # 80 / 8 = 10, retour(var1) # 10

prompt: While building the house, Charlie noticed that they were running out of nails so he told his father he's going to buy some. If they still have 9 nails left and Charlie bought 2 boxes of nails, the big one containing 55 nails and the small one containing 31, how many nails will they have?
summary: var1 = find(nails left) # 9, var2 = find(nails in big box) # 55, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 9 + 55 = 64, var2 = find(nails in small box) # 31, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 64 + 31 = 95, return(var1) # 95
fr_prompt: Pendant la construction de la maison, Charlie a remarqué qu'ils manquaient de clous, alors il a dit à son père qu'il allait en acheter. S'il leur reste encore 9 clous et que Charlie a acheté 2 boîtes de clous, la grande contenant 55 clous et la petite contenant 31, combien de clous auront-ils ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(clous restants) # 9, var2 = find(clous dans une grande boîte) # 55, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 9 + 55 = 64, var2 = find(clous dans une petite boîte) # 31 , var1 = ajouter(var1, var2), APPEL # 64 + 31 = 95, retour(var1) # 95

prompt: Lisa invited the entire third grade to her party. There are 48 students altogether. 23 of the students are boys and 25 are girls. 9 students will not be able to go to the party. How many students will be there?
summary: var1 = find(students in 3rd grade) # 48, var2 = find(students not going) # 9, var3 = subtract(var1, var2) # 48 - 9 = 39, return(var3) # 39
fr_prompt: Lisa a invité toute la troisième année à sa fête. Il y a 48 étudiants en tout. 23 des élèves sont des garçons et 25 sont des filles. 9 élèves ne pourront pas se rendre à la fête. Combien y aura-t-il d'élèves ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(élèves en 3e année) # 48, var2 = trouver(élèves qui ne vont pas) # 9, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2) # 48 - 9 = 39, retour(var3) # 39

prompt: There are 544 pots in each of the 10 gardens. Each pot has 32 flowers in it.How many flowers are there in all?
summary: var1 = find(pots in each garden) #544, var2 = multiply(var1, 10), CALL # 544 * 10 = 5440, var3 = multiply(var2, 32), CALL # 5440 * 32 = 174080, return(var3) # 174080
fr_prompt: Il y a 544 pots dans chacun des 10 jardins. Chaque pot contient 32 fleurs. Combien y a-t-il de fleurs en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(pots dans chaque jardin) #544, var2 = multiplier(var1, 10), CALL # 544 * 10 = 5440, var3 = multiplier(var2, 32), CALL # 5440 * 32 = 174080, return(var3) # 174080

prompt: Lexie's mom gathered all her watercolor paintings and thought of placing an equal number of paintings in four of the rooms in the house. If Lexie has 32 watercolor paintings, how many paintings will be placed in each of the four rooms?
summary: var1 = find(number of paintings) # 32, var2 = find(number of rooms) # 4, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 32 / 4 = 8, return(var1) # 8
fr_prompt: La mère de Lexie a rassemblé toutes ses aquarelles et a pensé à placer un nombre égal de peintures dans quatre des pièces de la maison. Si Lexie a 32 aquarelles, combien de peintures seront placées dans chacune des quatre pièces ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(nombre de tableaux) # 32, var2 = trouver(nombre de pièces) # 4, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 32 / 4 = 8, retour(var1) # 8

prompt: The Math Counts Club had a party at school. There were 20 cookies and 40 slices of pizza to be shared equally. Each student had the same number of whole cookies and the same number of slices of pizza with nothing left over. What is the greatest number of cookies and pizza slices the students can each get?
summary: var1 = find(20 cookies) # 20, var2 = find(40 slices of pizza) # 40, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(20,40) = 20, var4 = var1/var3, var5 = var2/var3, return(var3) # 20
fr_prompt: Le Math Counts Club a organisé une fête à l'école. Il y avait 20 biscuits et 40 tranches de pizza à partager également. Chaque élève avait le même nombre de biscuits entiers et le même nombre de tranches de pizza sans rien en trop. Quel est le plus grand nombre de biscuits et de tranches de pizza que les élèves peuvent obtenir chacun ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(20 cookies) # 20, var2 = find(40 tranches de pizza) # 40, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(20,40) = 20, var4 = var1/var3, var5 = var2/var3, retour(var3) # 20

prompt: Gary had 73 dollars. He spent 55 dollars on a pet snake. How many dollars did Gary have left?
summary: var1 = find(Gary's dollars) # 73, var2 = find(dollars spent on snake) # 55, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 73 - 55 = 18, return(var1) # 18
fr_prompt: Gary avait 73 dollars. Il a dépensé 55 dollars pour un serpent de compagnie. Combien de dollars Gary a-t-il laissé ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (dollars de Gary) # 73, var2 = trouver (dollars dépensés pour le serpent) # 55, var1 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 73 - 55 = 18, retour (var1) # 18

prompt: Luke was trying to expand his game collection. He bought 2 games from a friend and bought 2 more at a garage sale. If 2 of the games didn't work, how many good games did he end up with?
summary: var1 = find(games bought from friend) # 2, var2 = find(games bought at garage sale) # 2, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 2 = 4, var4 = subtract(var3, 2), CALL # 4 - 2 = 2, return(var4) # 2
fr_prompt: Luke essayait d'élargir sa collection de jeux. Il a acheté 2 jeux à un ami et en a acheté 2 autres lors d'un vide-grenier. Si 2 des jeux n'ont pas fonctionné, combien de bons jeux a-t-il obtenus ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(jeux achetés à un ami) # 2, var2 = find(jeux achetés au vide-grenier) # 2, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 2 = 4, var4 = subtract(var3, 2) , APPEL # 4 - 2 = 2, retour(var4) # 2

prompt: Oliver won 11 tickets playing games at the arcade. If he spent 5 tickets buying a water gun, how many tickets did he still have?
summary: var1 = find(tickets won) # 11, var2 = find(tickets spent) # 5, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 5 = 6, return(var3) # 6

fr_summary: var1 = find(tickets gagnés) # 11, var2 = find(tickets dépensés) # 5, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 5 = 6, return(var3) # 6

prompt: There were forty-seven bales of hay in the barn and forty bales in the shed. Benny stacked more bales in the barn today. There are now eighty-two bales of hay in the barn. How many bales did he store in the barn ?
summary: var1 = find(original hay in barn) # 47, var2 = find(final hay in barn) # 82, var1 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 82 - 47 = 35, return(var1) # 35
fr_prompt: Il y avait quarante-sept balles de foin dans la grange et quarante balles dans le hangar. Benny a empilé plus de balles dans la grange aujourd'hui. Il y a maintenant quatre-vingt-deux balles de foin dans la grange. Combien de balles a-t-il stockées dans la grange ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(foin d'origine dans la grange) # 47, var2 = trouver(foin final dans la grange) # 82, var1 = soustraire(var2, var1), APPEL # 82 - 47 = 35, retour(var1) # 35

prompt: Rachel had to complete 2 pages of math homework, 3 pages of reading homework and 10 more pages of biology homework.How many pages did she have to complete in all?
summary: var1 = find(math homework) # 2, var2 = find(reading homework) # 3, var3 = find(biology homework) # 10, var4 = add(var1, var2), var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 2 + 3 + 10 = 15, return(var5) # 15
fr_prompt: Rachel devait terminer 2 pages de devoirs de mathématiques, 3 pages de devoirs de lecture et 10 pages de plus de devoirs de biologie. Combien de pages devait-elle terminer en tout ?

prompt: Iesha has 344 books. 136 are about school and the rest are about sports. How many books about sports does Iesha have?

fr_summary: var1 = find(Iesha books) # 344, var2 = find(books about school) # 136, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 344 - 136 = 208, return(var3) # 208

prompt: There were some birds sitting on the fence. 4 more birds came to join them. If there are a total of 5 birds on the fence nowHow many birds had been sitting on the fence at the start?
summary: var1 = find(birds) #5, var2 = find(birds joined) #4, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 5 - 4 = 1, return(var3) # 1

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(oiseaux) #5, var2 = trouver(oiseaux joints) #4, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 5 - 4 = 1, retour(var3) # 1

prompt: He then classified some of the rocks into igneous, metamorphic and sedimentary. If each classification has 246 samples each, how many rocks does he have in all?
summary: var1 = find(samples per classification) # 246, var2 = find(number of classifications) # 3, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 246 * 3 = 738, return(var1) # 738

prompt: The Sumata family took a five-day vacation by car. Each day they drove 250 miles. How many total miles did they drive?

prompt: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 5 cups of sugar and 14 cups of flour. She already put in 11 cups of flour.How many more cups of sugar than cups of flour does she need to add now?

prompt: Julia played tag with 15 kids on monday, 18 kids on tuesday and 7 kids on wednesday.How many more kids did she play with on monday and tuesday than on wednesday?
