prompt: At a bus stop five people got off the bus. Now there were ninety people on the bus. What's the difference between the number of people getting off the bus and still on the bus?
summary: var1 = find(People got off bus) # 5, var2 = find(People on bus now) # 90, var1 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 90 - 5 = 85, return(var1) # 85
fr_prompt: À un arrêt de bus, cinq personnes sont descendues du bus. Il y avait maintenant quatre-vingt-dix personnes dans le bus. Quelle est la différence entre le nombre de personnes qui descendent du bus et qui sont encore dans le bus ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Les gens sont descendus du bus) # 5, var2 = find(Les gens dans le bus maintenant) # 90, var1 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 90 - 5 = 85, return(var1) # 85

prompt: Kaleb was collecting cans for recycling. On Saturday he filled five bags up and on Sunday he filled five more bags. If each bag had four cans in it, how many cans did he pick up total?
summary: var1 = find(Saturday bags) # 5, var2 = find(Sunday bags) # 5, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 5 = 10, var4 = find(cans per bag) # 4, var5 = multiply(var3, var4), CALL # 10 * 4 = 40, return(var5) # 40
fr_prompt: Kaleb ramassait des canettes pour les recycler. Samedi, il a rempli cinq sacs et dimanche, il en a rempli cinq autres. Si chaque sac contenait quatre canettes, combien de canettes a-t-il ramassées au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(sacs du samedi) # 5, var2 = find(sacs du dimanche) # 5, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 5 = 10, var4 = find(canettes par sac) # 4, var5 = multiplier(var3, var4), APPEL # 10 * 4 = 40, retour(var5) # 40

prompt: Victor had nineteen apps on his phone. He deleted eight of them. How many apps does Victor have left?
summary: var1 = find(total apps) # 19, var2 = find(deleted apps) # 8, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 19 - 8 = 11, return(var3) # 11
fr_prompt: Victor avait dix-neuf applications sur son téléphone. Il en a supprimé huit. Combien d'applications reste-t-il à Victor ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (applications totales) # 19, var2 = trouver (applications supprimées) # 8, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 19 - 8 = 11, retour (var3) # 11

prompt: Jake bought a book of tickets for the rides at Fun Land. 8 of the tickets were red. There were twice as many blue tickets as red tickets. Jake used all 6 of his yellow tickets first. How many tickets did Jake buy in all?
summary: var1 = find(red tickets) # 8, var2 = multiply(var1, 2) # 8 * 2 = 16, var3 = add(var1, var2) # 8 + 16 = 24, var4 = find(yellow tickets) # 6, var5 = add(var3, var4) # 24 + 6 = 30, return(var5) # 30
fr_prompt: Jake a acheté un carnet de billets pour les manèges à Fun Land. 8 des billets étaient rouges. Il y avait deux fois plus de tickets bleus que de tickets rouges. Jake a d'abord utilisé ses 6 billets jaunes. Combien de billets Jake a-t-il achetés en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(billets rouges) # 8, var2 = multiplier(var1, 2) # 8 * 2 = 16, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2) # 8 + 16 = 24, var4 = trouver(billets jaunes) # 6, var5 = addition(var3, var4) # 24 + 6 = 30, retour(var5) # 30

prompt: Atomic fireballs come in packages of 9. Barbara ate 59 Atomic Fireballs. How many Atomic Fireballs does she have left?
summary: var1 = find(Atomic Fireballs) # 59, var2 = find(Fireballs per package) # 9, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 59 / 9 = 6.5555.., var4 = floor(var3), CALL # floor(6.5555..) = 6, var5 = multiply(var4, var2), CALL # 6 * 9 = 54, var6 = subtract(var1, var5), CALL # 59 - 54 = 5, return(var6) # 5
fr_prompt: Les boules de feu atomiques sont vendues en paquets de 9. Barbara a mangé 59 boules de feu atomiques. Combien lui reste-t-il de boules de feu atomiques ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Atomic Fireballs) # 59, var2 = find(Fireballs per package) # 9, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 59 / 9 = 6.5555.., var4 = floor(var3), CALL # floor (6.5555..) = 6, var5 = multiplier(var4, var2), CALL # 6 * 9 = 54, var6 = soustraire(var1, var5), CALL # 59 - 54 = 5, return(var6) # 5

prompt: Jill invited 37 people to her birthday party. They each ate 8 pieces of pizza. How many pieces of pizza did they eat?
summary: var1 = find(people invited) # 37, var2 = find(pizza pieces per person) # 8, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 37 * 8 = 296, return(var3) # 296
fr_prompt: Jill a invité 37 personnes à sa fête d'anniversaire. Ils ont chacun mangé 8 pizzas. Combien de morceaux de pizza ont-ils mangés ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(personnes invitées) # 37, var2 = find(morceaux de pizza par personne) # 8, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 37 * 8 = 296, return(var3) # 296

prompt: Mrs. Hilt has 40 markers. They are divided equally into 7 packages. Mrs. Hilt wants to know how many markers are leftover?
summary: var1 = find(markers) # 40, var2 = find(packages) # 7, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 40 / 7 = 5.71 (rounded to 5), var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 7 * 5 = 35, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 40 - 35 = 5, return(var5) # 5
fr_prompt: Mme Hilt a 40 marqueurs. Ils sont répartis à parts égales en 7 forfaits. Mme Hilt veut savoir combien de marqueurs il reste ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(marqueurs) # 40, var2 = find(packages) # 7, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 40 / 7 = 5.71 (arrondi à 5), var4 = multiplier(var2, var3), CALL # 7 * 5 = 35, var5 = soustraire(var1, var4), APPEL # 40 - 35 = 5, retour(var5) # 5

prompt: I have 80 cents to buy candy. If each gumdrop costs 4 cents, how many gumdrops can I buy?
summary: var1 = find(money available) # 80, var2 = find(cost of gumdrop) # 4, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 80 / 4 = 20, return(var3) # 20
fr_prompt: J'ai 80 cents pour acheter des bonbons. Si chaque boule de gomme coûte 4 cents, combien de boules de gomme puis-je acheter ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(argent disponible) # 80, var2 = trouver(coût de la boule de gomme) # 4, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 80 / 4 = 20, retour(var3) # 20

prompt: An industrial machine can make 3 shirts per minute. It made 6 shirts in all.How many minutes was the machine working?
summary: var1 = find(shirts made) #6, var2 = divide(var1, 3), CALL # 6 / 3 = 2, return(var2) # 2
fr_prompt: Une machine industrielle peut fabriquer 3 chemises par minute. Il a fait 6 chemises en tout. Combien de minutes la machine a-t-elle fonctionné ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(chemises faites) #6, var2 = diviser(var1, 3), CALL # 6 / 3 = 2, return(var2) # 2

prompt: Matthew had 27 crackers. If Matthew gave equal numbers of crackers to his 9 friends, how many crackers did each person eat?
summary: var1 = find(crackers) # 27, var2 = find(friends) # 9, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 27 / 9 = 3, return(var3) # 3
fr_prompt: Matthew avait 27 biscuits. Si Matthieu a donné un nombre égal de craquelins à ses 9 amis, combien de craquelins chaque personne a-t-elle mangés ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(crackers) # 27, var2 = find(friends) # 9, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 27 / 9 = 3, return(var3) # 3

prompt: Jake has 36 comic books. His brother has 15 more comic books than Jake. How many comic books do they have altogether?
summary: var1 = find(Jake comic books) # 36, var2 = add(var1, 15) # 36 + 15 = 51, var3 = add(var1, var2) # 36 + 51 = 87, return(var3) # 87
fr_prompt: Jake a 36 bandes dessinées. Son frère a 15 bandes dessinées de plus que Jake. Combien de bandes dessinées ont-ils en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Jake comics) # 36, var2 = add(var1, 15) # 36 + 15 = 51, var3 = add(var1, var2) # 36 + 51 = 87, return(var3) # 87

prompt: Oliver was yard sale shopping. He ended up buying 11 video games, but only 6 of them worked. How many bad games did he buy?
summary: var1 = find(total games) # 11, var2 = find(good games) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 6 = 5, return(var3) # 5
fr_prompt: Oliver faisait du débarras. Il a fini par acheter 11 jeux vidéo, mais seuls 6 d'entre eux fonctionnaient. Combien de mauvais jeux a-t-il acheté ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(total games) # 11, var2 = find(good games) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 6 = 5, return(var3) # 5

prompt: In a school there are 569 girls and 236 boys.How many more girls than boys does the school have?
summary: var1 = find(girls) # 569, var2 = find(boys) # 236, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 569 - 236 = 333, return(var3) # 333
fr_prompt: Dans une école, il y a 569 filles et 236 garçons. Combien y a-t-il de filles de plus que de garçons dans l'école ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(filles) # 569, var2 = trouver(garçons) # 236, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 569 - 236 = 333, retour(var3) # 333

prompt: Jaden is putting together first-aid kits. He has 39 large bandages and 26 small bandages, and he wants each kit to be identical, with no bandages left over. What is the greatest number of first-aid kits Jaden could put together?
summary: var1 = find("large bandages") # 39, var2 = find("small bandages") # 26, var3 = find_gcd(var1, var2) # GCD(39,26) = 13, return(var3) # 13
fr_prompt: Jaden prépare des trousses de premiers soins. Il a 39 grands bandages et 26 petits bandages, et il veut que chaque kit soit identique, sans bandages restants. Quel est le plus grand nombre de trousses de premiers soins que Jaden pourrait assembler ?
fr_summary: var1 = find("grands bandages") # 39, var2 = find("petits bandages") # 26, var3 = find_gcd(var1, var2) # GCD(39,26) = 13, return(var3) # 13

prompt: White t - shirts can be purchased in packages of 53. If mom buys 57 packages of white t - shirts and 34 trousersHow many white t - shirts will she have?
summary: var1 = find(Packages of t-shirts) # 57, var2 = find(Number of t-shirts per package) # 53, var1 = mul(var1, var2), CALL # 57 * 53 = 3021, return(var1) # 3021
fr_prompt: Les t-shirts blancs peuvent être achetés en paquets de 53. Si maman achète 57 paquets de t-shirts blancs et 3 4 pantalons Combien de t-shirts blancs aura-t-elle ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Packages de t-shirts) # 57, var2 = find(Nombre de t-shirts par colis) # 53, var1 = mul(var1, var2), CALL # 57 * 53 = 3021, return(var1) # 3021

prompt: Maria took sixteen fish out of her fish tank. Now there are three fish in the tank. How many fish were in the tank to start with?
summary: var1 = find(current fish) # 3, var2 = find(taken fish) # 16, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 3 + 16 = 19, return(var3) # 19
fr_prompt: Maria a sorti seize poissons de son aquarium. Maintenant, il y a trois poissons dans le réservoir. Combien y avait-il de poissons dans l'aquarium pour commencer ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(poisson actuel) # 3, var2 = find(poisson pris) # 16, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 3 + 16 = 19, return(var3) # 19

prompt: Mrs. Griffin went to the grocery store with $70. She had $16 left after shopping. How much did Mrs. Griffin spend?
summary: var1 = find(money Mrs. Griffin had) # 70, var2 = find(money left) # 16, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 70 - 16 = 54, return(var3) # 54
fr_prompt: Mme Griffin est allée à l'épicerie avec 70 $. Il lui restait 16 $ après le magasinage. Combien Mme Griffin a-t-elle dépensé ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (argent que Mme Griffin avait) # 70, var2 = trouver (argent restant) # 16, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 70 - 16 = 54, retour (var3) # 54

prompt: A piece of sheetrock was cut so its length was 6 feet by 5 feet. What is the area of the sheetrock?
summary: var1 = find(length of sheetrock) # 6, var2 = find(width of sheetrock) # 5, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 6 * 5 = 30, return(var1) # 30
fr_prompt: Un morceau de gypse a été coupé de sorte que sa longueur était de 6 pieds sur 5 pieds. Quelle est l'aire de la plaque de plâtre ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(longueur de la plaque de plâtre) # 6, var2 = trouver(largeur de la plaque de plâtre) # 5, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 6 * 5 = 30, retour(var1) # 30

prompt: Enzo and Beatriz are playing games at their local arcade. Incredibly, Enzo wins 5 tickets from every game, and Beatriz wins 11 tickets from every game. When they stopped playing games, Enzo and Beatriz had won the same number of total tickets. What is the minimum number of games that Enzo could have played?
summary: var1 = find(Enzo winning tickets) # 5, var2 = find(Beatriz winning tickets) # 11, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(5,11) = 1, return(var3) # 1
fr_prompt: Enzo et Beatriz jouent à des jeux dans leur arcade locale. Incroyablement, Enzo gagne 5 billets à chaque match et Beatriz gagne 11 billets à chaque match. Lorsqu'ils ont arrêté de jouer, Enzo et Beatriz avaient gagné le même nombre de billets au total. Quel est le nombre minimum de parties auxquelles Enzo aurait pu jouer ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(billets gagnants Enzo) # 5, var2 = trouver(billets gagnants Beatriz) # 11, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(5,11) = 1, return(var3) # 1

prompt: To make sure that the cake is sweet, he needs 450 lbs. of sugar. If he has 287 lbs. of sugar stored in his house, how much additional sugar will he need?
summary: var1 = find(total sugar needed) # 450 lbs, var2 = find(current sugar) # 287 lbs, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 450 - 287 = 163 lbs, return(var1) # 163 lbs
fr_prompt: Pour s'assurer que le gâteau est sucré, il a besoin de 450 livres. de sucre. S'il a 287 livres. de sucre stocké dans sa maison, de combien de sucre supplémentaire aura-t-il besoin ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (sucre total nécessaire) # 450 livres, var2 = trouver (sucre actuel) # 287 livres, var1 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 450 - 287 = 163 livres, retour (var1) # 163 livres

prompt: Frank had 42 pieces of candy. If he put them equally into 2 bagsHow many pieces of candy are in each bag?
summary: var1 = find(Frank candy) #42, var2 = divide(var1, 2), CALL # 42 / 2 = 21, return(var2) # 21
fr_prompt: Frank avait 42 bonbons. S'il les met également dans 2 sachets, combien y a-t-il de bonbons dans chaque sachet ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Frank candy) #42, var2 = diviser(var1, 2), CALL # 42 / 2 = 21, return(var2) # 21

prompt: One of his favorites is a book called Encyclopedia of Life and Everything Else. The book has 7 large chapters, each having 566 pages. How many pages does the encyclopedia have in total?
summary: var1 = find(pages per chapter) # 566, var2 = find(number of chapters) # 7, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 566 * 7 = 3962, return(var1) # 3962
fr_prompt: L'un de ses livres préférés est un livre intitulé Encyclopedia of Life and Everything Else. Le livre a 7 grands chapitres, chacun ayant 566 pages. Combien de pages l'encyclopédie compte-t-elle au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pages par chapitre) # 566, var2 = find(nombre de chapitres) # 7, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 566 * 7 = 3962, return(var1) # 3962

prompt: Her mom also baked some cookies. If she baked 5 pans of cookies and there are 8 cookies per pan, how many cookies did her mom bake for her birthday?
summary: var1 = find(number of pans of cookies) # 5, var2 = find(cookies per pan) # 8, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 5 * 8 = 40, return(var1) # 40
fr_prompt: Sa mère a également fait des biscuits. Si elle a fait cuire 5 moules de biscuits et qu'il y a 8 biscuits par moule, combien de biscuits sa mère a-t-elle fait cuire pour son anniversaire ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre de moules de cookies) # 5, var2 = find(cookies par moule) # 8, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 5 * 8 = 40, return(var1) # 40

prompt: Teacher buys 4 black pens and 4 blue pens for students as awards. How many pens does the teacher buy altogether?
summary: var1 = find(black pens) # 4, var2 = find(blue pens) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 4 = 8, return(var3) # 8
fr_prompt: L'enseignant achète 4 stylos noirs et 4 stylos bleus pour les élèves en récompense. Combien de stylos l'enseignant achète-t-il en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(stylos noirs) # 4, var2 = find(blue stylos) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 4 = 8, return(var3) # 8

prompt: Ramon works at the supermarket. He put 26 boxes of Choco Delights on the shelf. There were already 15 boxes there. Later that day, Ramon counted 22 boxes on the shelf. How many boxes of Choco Delights were missing?
summary: var1 = add(26, 15), CALL # 26 + 15 = 41, var2 = find(boxes on shelf) # 22, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 41 - 22 = 19, return(var3) # 19
fr_prompt: Ramon travaille au supermarché. Il a mis 26 boîtes de Choco Delights sur l'étagère. Il y avait déjà 15 boîtes là-bas. Plus tard dans la journée, Ramon a compté 22 boîtes sur l'étagère. Combien de boîtes de Choco Delights manquaient ?
fr_summary: var1 = add(26, 15), CALL # 26 + 15 = 41, var2 = find(boxes on shelf) # 22, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 41 - 22 = 19, return(var3) # 19

prompt: After Sam and Bob left, Mary, John and Sue decided to go home as well. They counted the total amount of treats that the three of them got. They were able to sort out 60 chewing gums, 55 chocolate bars and another 40 candies of different flavors. How many treats did Mary, John and Sue have in total?
summary: var1 = find(chewing gums) # 60, var2 = find(chocolate bars) # 55, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 60 + 55 = 115, var2 = find(candies of different flavors) # 40, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 115 + 40 = 155, return(var1) # 155
fr_prompt: Après le départ de Sam et Bob, Mary, John et Sue ont également décidé de rentrer chez eux. Ils comptèrent le nombre total de friandises qu'ils reçurent tous les trois. Ils ont pu trier 60 chewing-gums, 55 tablettes de chocolat et 40 autres bonbons de différentes saveurs. Combien de friandises Mary, John et Sue ont-ils eu au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(chewing-gums) # 60, var2 = find(barres de chocolat) # 55, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 60 + 55 = 115, var2 = find(bonbons de différentes saveurs) # 40, var1 = ajouter(var1, var2), APPEL # 115 + 40 = 155, retour(var1) # 155

prompt: Tom had thirty-six pieces of clothing to wash. He put eighteen of them in one load, but decided to split the rest into two equal loads. How many pieces of clothing could go in each of the small loads?
summary: var1 = find(pieces in first load) # 18, var2 = find(pieces total) # 36, var2 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 36 - 18 = 18, var3 = find(loads) # 2, var4 = divide(var2, var3), CALL # 18 / 2 = 9, return(var4) # 9
fr_prompt: Tom avait trente-six vêtements à laver. Il en a mis dix-huit en un seul chargement, mais a décidé de diviser le reste en deux chargements égaux. Combien de vêtements pourraient contenir chacune des petites charges ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pieces in first load) # 18, var2 = find(pieces total) # 36, var2 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 36 - 18 = 18, var3 = find(loads) # 2, var4 = diviser(var2, var3), APPEL # 18 / 2 = 9, retour(var4) # 9

prompt: Mr. Lee harvested 495 apples and he packed them evenly in some baskets. If there are 25 apples in each basket, how many apples were left unpacked?
summary: var1 = find(apples harvested) # 495, var2 = find(apples per basket) # 25, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 495 / 25 = 19.80, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(19.80) = 19, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 25 * 19 = 475, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 495 - 475 = 20, return(var5) # 20
fr_prompt: M. Lee a récolté 495 pommes et les a emballées uniformément dans des paniers. S'il y a 25 pommes dans chaque panier, combien de pommes sont restées non emballées ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pommes récoltées) # 495, var2 = find(pommes par panier) # 25, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 495 / 25 = 19.80, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down( 19.80) = 19, var4 = multiplier (var2, var3), APPEL # 25 * 19 = 475, var5 = soustraire (var1, var4), APPEL # 495 - 475 = 20, retour (var5) # 20

prompt: Frank was reading through some books. Each book had 66 pages and it took Frank 12 days to finish each book. If he takes 492 days to finish all booksHow many books did he read?
summary: var1 = find(Days) # 492, var2 = find(Days per book) # 12, var3 = div(var1, var2), CALL # 492 / 12 = 41, return(var3) # 41
fr_prompt: Frank lisait quelques livres. Chaque livre avait 66 pages et il a fallu 12 jours à Frank pour terminer chaque livre. S'il met 492 jours pour terminer tous les livres, combien de livres a-t-il lu ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Jours) # 492, var2 = find(Jours par livre) # 12, var3 = div(var1, var2), CALL # 492 / 12 = 41, return(var3) # 41

prompt: Robin is making bead necklaces. She wants to use 31 beads to make 4 necklaces. If she wants each necklace to have the same number of beads, how many beads will she have left over?
summary: var1 = find("beads") # 31, var2 = find("necklaces") # 4, var3 = mod(var1, var2) # 31 % 4 = 3, return(var3) # 3
fr_prompt: Robin fabrique des colliers de perles. Elle veut utiliser 31 perles pour faire 4 colliers. Si elle veut que chaque collier ait le même nombre de perles, combien de perles lui restera-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = find("perles") # 31, var2 = find("colliers") # 4, var3 = mod(var1, var2) # 31 % 4 = 3, return(var3) # 3

prompt: Andrew is having his friends over for game night. So he decided to prepare the snacks and the games. He started by making mini sandwiches. If he has 4 friends coming over and he made 3 sandwiches for each one of them, how many sandwiches did he make in total?
summary: var1 = find(number of friends coming over) # 4, var2 = find(sandwich per person) # 3, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 4 * 3 = 12, return(var1) # 12
fr_prompt: Andrew reçoit ses amis pour une soirée jeux. Alors il a décidé de préparer les goûters et les jeux. Il a commencé par faire des mini sandwichs. S'il a 4 amis qui viennent et qu'il a fait 3 sandwichs pour chacun d'eux, combien de sandwichs a-t-il fait au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre d'amis qui viennent) # 4, var2 = find(sandwich par personne) # 3, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 4 * 3 = 12, return(var1) # 12

prompt: Li Na is going to plant 63 tomato plants and 81 rhubarb plants. Li Na would like to plant the plants in rows where each row has the same number of tomato plants and each row has the same number of rhubarb plants. What is the greatest number of rows Li Na can plant?
summary: var1 = find(tomato plants) # 63, var2 = find(rhubarb plants) # 81, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(63,81) = 9, return(var3) # 9
fr_prompt: Li Na va planter 63 plants de tomates et 81 plants de rhubarbe. Li Na aimerait planter les plantes en rangées où chaque rangée a le même nombre de plants de tomates et chaque rangée a le même nombre de plants de rhubarbe. Quel est le plus grand nombre de rangs que Li Na peut planter ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(plants de tomates) # 63, var2 = find(plants de rhubarbe) # 81, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(63,81) = 9, return(var3) # 9

prompt: Frank bought his family 14 pieces of chicken for dinner. If they only ate 7, how many pieces does he have left?
summary: var1 = find(pieces of chicken) # 14, var2 = find(pieces eaten) # 7, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 14 - 7 = 7, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: Frank a acheté à sa famille 14 morceaux de poulet pour le dîner. S'ils n'en ont mangé que 7, combien lui reste-t-il de morceaux ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(morceaux de poulet) # 14, var2 = trouver(morceaux mangés) # 7, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 14 - 7 = 7, retour(var3) # 7

prompt: After resting they decided to go for a swim. The depth of the water is 15 times Dean's height. Dean is 4 feet taller than Ron. If Ron stands at 13 feetHow deep was the water?
summary: var1 = find(Ron's height) #13, var2 = find(Dean is 4 feet taller) #4, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 13 + 4 = 17, var3 = find(depth of water) #15, var4 = multiply(var1, var3), CALL # 17 * 15 = 255, return(var4) # 255
fr_prompt: Après s'être reposés, ils décidèrent d'aller se baigner. La profondeur de l'eau est de 15 fois la hauteur de Dean. Dean mesure 4 pieds de plus que Ron. Si Ron se tient à 13 pieds, quelle était la profondeur de l'eau ?

prompt: Next on her list are the homeless people where she spent a total of $900.00. If she gave $325.00 to the first set of homeless families and $260.00 to the second set of families, how much did she give to the last set of homeless families?

fr_prompt: Les prochains sur sa liste sont les sans-abri pour lesquels elle a dépensé un total de 900,00 $. Si elle a donné 325,00 $ au premier groupe de familles sans abri et 260,00 $ au deuxième groupe de familles, combien a-t-elle donné au dernier groupe de familles sans abri ?

prompt: The school is planning a field trip. The school has 24 classrooms. There are 120 students in the school with each classroom having the same number of students. There are 84 seats on each school bus.How many students are in each class?

summary: var1 = find(yellow buttons) # 24, var2 = find(black buttons) # 16, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 24 + 16 = 40, var4 = find(green buttons) # 19, var5 = add(var3, var4), CALL # 40 + 19 = 59, var6 = find(buttons left) # 13, var7 = subtract(var5, var6), CALL # 59 - 13 = 46, return(var7) # 46
fr_prompt: La Géorgie avait 24 boutons jaunes, 16 boutons noirs et 19 boutons verts. Elle a donné quelques-uns des boutons à Mary et il reste maintenant à Georgia 13 boutons. Combien de boutons Georgia a-t-elle donné à Mary ?

prompt: It's Halloween in Chicago. Bob, Mary, John, Sue and Sam dressed as superheroes and went out to do some trick or treating. After passing through the houses on Main Street, the five friends counted how much candy they have. If Bob has 10 candies, Mary has 5, Sue has 20, John has 5 as well and Sam has also 10 candies. How many candies did they have together?
summary: var1 = find(Bob candies) # 10, var2 = find(Mary candies) # 5, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 10 + 5 = 15, var2 = find(Sue candies) # 20, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 20 = 35, var2 = find(John candies) # 5, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 35 + 5 = 40, var2 = find(Sam candies) # 10, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 40 + 10 = 50, return(var1) # 50
fr_prompt: C'est Halloween à Chicago. Bob, Mary, John, Sue et Sam se sont déguisés en super-héros et sont sortis pour faire des tours ou des friandises. Après avoir traversé les maisons de Main Street, les cinq amis ont compté la quantité de bonbons qu'ils avaient. prompt: A worker needs to cut a 27-yard long rope into some long pieces at 4 yard each and some short pieces at 1 yard each. In order to make the least number of pieces, how many short pieces should be cut for?
summary: var1 = find(total length of rope) # 27, var2 = find(long piece length) # 4, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 27 / 4 = 6.75, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(6.75) = 6, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 4 * 6 = 24, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 27 - 24 = 3, return(var5) # 3
fr_prompt: Un travailleur doit couper une corde de 27 mètres de long en quelques longs morceaux de 4 mètres chacun et en quelques morceaux courts de 1 mètre chacun. Afin de faire le moins de pièces possible, combien de pièces courtes faut-il couper ?

summary: var1 = find(zoo pictures) # 24, var2 = find(museum pictures) # 12, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 24 + 12 = 36, var4 = subtract(var3, 14), CALL # 36 - 14 = 22, return(var4) # 22
fr_prompt: Pendant ses vacances, Debby a pris 24 photos au zoo et 12 au musée. Si elle a ensuite supprimé 14 des photos, combien de photos de ses vacances avait-elle encore ?

prompt: Adam has 10 apples. Jackie has 2 apples.How many more apples does Adam have than Jackie?

prompt: Whitney has collected 4 T-shirts and 20 buttons from her favorite band. She wants to combine them into identical sets to sell, with no pieces left over. What is the greatest number of sets Whitney can make?

fr_prompt: Whitney a collectionné 4 T-shirts et 20 boutons de son groupe préféré. Elle veut les combiner en ensembles identiques à vendre, sans pièces restantes. Quel est le plus grand nombre de sets que Whitney peut faire ?

prompt: Joe, Susie's brother, collected all 94 trading cards scattered in his room and placed them in boxes. If a full box can hold a maximum of 8 cards, how many cards are there in the unfilled box?

fr_prompt: Joe, le frère de Susie, a rassemblé les 94 cartes à collectionner dispersées dans sa chambre et les a placées dans des boîtes. Si une boîte pleine peut contenir au maximum 8 cartes, combien y a-t-il de cartes dans la boîte vide ?

prompt: At a concert, the band has 20 men's T-shirts and 8 women's T-shirts. The band wants to set up tables to sell the shirts, with an equal number of men's and women's shirts available at each table and no shirts left over. What is the greatest number of tables the band can sell shirts from?

Le groupe veut mettre en place des tables pour vendre les chemises, avec un nombre égal de chemises pour hommes et pour femmes disponibles à chaque table et aucune chemise restante. Quel est le plus grand nombre de tables à partir desquelles le groupe peut vendre des chemises ?
fr_summary: var1 = find("T-shirts homme") # 20, var2 = find("T-shirts femme") # 8, var3 = find_gcd(var1, var2) # GCD(20,8) = 4, return(var3) # 4

prompt: Baker made 173 cakes. He bought 103 new cakes and sold 86 cakes.How many cakes does baker still have?
summary: var1 = find(original cakes) # 173, var2 = find(new cakes) # 103, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(sold cakes) # 86, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # (173 + 103) - 86 = 276 - 86 = 190, return(var5) # 190
fr_prompt: Baker a fait 173 gâteaux. Il a acheté 103 nouveaux gâteaux et en a vendu 86. Combien de gâteaux le boulanger a-t-il encore ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(original cakes) # 173, var2 = find(new cakes) # 103, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(sold cakes) # 86, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # (173 + 103) - 86 = 276 - 86 = 190, retour(var5) # 190

prompt: Baker made 144 cakes. He sold 71 of them. Then he made 111 more cakes.How many more cakes did baker make than those he sold?
summary: var1 = find(cakes) #144, var2 = subtract(var1, 71), CALL # 144 - 71 = 73, var3 = add(var2, 111), CALL # 73 + 111 = 184, return(var3) #184
fr_prompt: Baker a fait 144 gâteaux. Il en a vendu 71. Puis il a fait 111 gâteaux de plus. Combien de gâteaux de plus le boulanger a-t-il fait que ceux qu'il a vendus ?

prompt: Jerry had 2 action figures and 10 books on a shelf in his room. Later he added 4 more action figures to the shelf.How many more books than action figures were on his shelf?

fr_prompt: Jerry avait 2 figurines et 10 livres sur une étagère dans sa chambre. Plus tard, il a ajouté 4 autres figurines articulées sur l'étagère. Combien y avait-il de plus de livres que de figurines articulées sur son étagère ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(figurines d'action initiales) # 2, var2 = trouver(figures d'action supplémentaires) # 4, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(livres sur l'étagère) # 10, var5 = soustraire(var4, var3 ), APPEL # 2 + 4 = 6, 10 - 6 = 4, retour(var5) # 4

prompt: Sally memorized eight poems. After some time she could only recite three of them. How many poems did she forget?
summary: var1 = find(memorized poems) # 8, var2 = find(recited poems) # 3, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 8 - 3 = 5, return(var3) # 5

fr_summary: var1 = find(poèmes mémorisés) # 8, var2 = find(poèmes récités) # 3, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 8 - 3 = 5, return(var3) # 5

prompt: There were six roses in the vase. Jessica cut some more roses from her flower garden. There are now eighteen roses in the vase. How many roses did she cut ?
summary: var1 = find(roses before) # 6, var2 = find(roses after) # 18, var3 = subtract(var2, var1) # 18 - 6 = 12, return(var3) # 12

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(roses avant) # 6, var2 = trouver(roses après) # 18, var3 = soustraire(var2, var1) # 18 - 6 = 12, retour(var3) # 12

prompt: Bobby had 32 pieces of candy. He ate some pieces of candy. If he has 20 pieces of candy leftHow many pieces of candy did Bobby eat?

prompt: On a table there were 2 green apples, 3 red apples and 14 yellow apples. How many apples were on the table?
summary: var1 = find(green apples) # 2, var2 = find(red apples) # 3, var3 = find(yellow apples) # 14, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 3 = 5, var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 5 + 14 = 19, return(var5) # 19

prompt: At the school Halloween party 2 girls and 9 boys dressed as ghosts. How many people total dressed as a ghost?
summary: var1 = find(girls dressed as ghosts) # 2, var2 = find(boys dressed as ghosts) # 9, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 9 = 11, return(var3) # 11

prompt: After Jessie started to go jogging everyday she lost 126 kilograms. She currently weighs 66 kilograms.How much did she weigh before starting to jog?
summary: var1 = find(weight lost) # 126, var2 = find(current weight) # 66, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 126 + 66 = 192, return(var3) # 192

prompt: Billy was playing basketball with his friend. Billy scored 7 points and his friend scored 9 points. What's the difference between Billy's points and his friend's points?
summary: var1 = find(Billy's basketball points) # 7, var2 = find(friend's basketball points) # 9, var1 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 9 - 7 = 2, return(var1) # 2

prompt: Jack received 3 emails in the afternoon, 6 emails in the morning and some more in the evening. If he received a total of 10 emails in the dayHow many emails did jack receive in the evening?
summary: var1 = find(afternoon emails) # 3, var2 = find(morning emails) # 6, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(total emails) # 10, var5 = subtract(var4, var3), CALL # 10 - (3 + 6) = 10 - 9 = 1, return(var5) # 1
fr_prompt: Jack a reçu 3 e-mails l'après-midi, 6 e-mails le matin et quelques autres le soir. S'il a reçu un total de 10 e-mails dans la journée, combien d'e-mails Jack a-t-il reçus dans la soirée ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(emails de l'après-midi) # 3, var2 = find(emails du matin) # 6, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(total emails) # 10, var5 = subtract(var4, var3), CALL # 10 - (3 + 6) = 10 - 9 = 1, retour(var5) # 1

prompt: David did 27 more push-ups but 7 less crunches than Zachary in gym class today. If Zachary did 5 push-ups and 17 crunchesHow many more crunches than push-ups did Zachary do?

fr_prompt: David a fait 27 pompes de plus mais 7 abdominaux de moins que Zachary en cours de gym aujourd'hui. Si Zachary a fait 5 pompes et 17 crunchsCombien de plus de crunchs que de pompes Zachary a-t-il fait ?

prompt: A family is preparing backpacks filled with school supplies to donate to children in need. They have 9 pencils and 15 notebooks. If they want to make all the backpacks the same, with no school supplies left over, what is the greatest number of backpacks they can fill?

prompt: Ulrich wants to buy a jump rope that costs $9, a board game that costs $9, and a playground ball that costs $5. He has saved $7 from his allowance, and his uncle gave him $15. How much more money does Ulrich need to buy the jump rope, the game, and the ball?

prompt: Marco and his dad went strawberry picking. Together they collected strawberries that weighed 36 pounds. On the way back Marco ' dad lost 8 pounds of strawberries. Marco's strawberries now weighed 12 pounds.How much did his dad's strawberries weigh now?
summary: var1 = find(total strawberries) #36, var2 = find(Marco's strawberries) #12, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 36 - 12 = 24, var3 = find(strawberries lost) #8, var4 = subtract(var1, var3), CALL # 24 - 8 = 16, return(var4) # 16
fr_prompt: Marco et son père sont allés cueillir des fraises. Ensemble, ils ont ramassé des fraises qui pesaient 36 livres. Sur le chemin du retour, le papa de Marco a perdu 8 kilos de fraises. Les fraises de Marco pesaient maintenant 12 livres. Combien pesaient les fraises de son père maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(total fraises) #36, var2 = trouver(fraises de Marco) #12, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 36 - 12 = 24, var3 = trouver(fraises perdues) #8, var4 = soustraire (var1, var3), APPEL # 24 - 8 = 16, retour (var4) # 16

prompt: Joan is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 7 cups of flour. She already put in 3 cups. How many more cups does she need to add ?
summary: var1 = find(flour needed) # 7, var2 = find(flour added) # 3, var3 = subtract(var1, var2) # 7 - 3 = 4, return(var3) # 4
fr_prompt: Joan prépare un gâteau. La recette demande 7 tasses de farine. Elle a déjà mis 3 tasses. Combien de tasses doit-elle encore ajouter ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(farine nécessaire) # 7, var2 = find(farine ajoutée) # 3, var3 = subtract(var1, var2) # 7 - 3 = 4, return(var3) # 4

prompt: Helen the hippo and her friends are preparing for thanksgiving at Helen's house. Helen baked 144 chocolate chip cookies and 397 raisin cookies yesterday. And she baked 85 raisin cookies and 403 chocolate chip cookies this morning.How many raisin cookies did Helen bake?
summary: var1 = find(yesterday raisin cookies) #397, var2 = add(var1, 85), CALL # 397 + 85 = 482, return(var2) #482
fr_prompt: Helen l'hippopotame et ses amis se préparent pour l'action de grâces chez Helen. Helen a préparé 144 biscuits aux pépites de chocolat et 397 biscuits aux raisins secs hier. Et elle a préparé 85 biscuits aux raisins secs et 403 biscuits aux pépites de chocolat ce matin. Combien de biscuits aux raisins secs Helen a-t-elle préparés ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(biscuits aux raisins secs d'hier) #397, var2 = add(var1, 85), CALL # 397 + 85 = 482, return(var2) #482

prompt: Josh had 9 marbles in his collection. He lost some marbles. If he has 4 marbles nowHow many marbles did he lose?
summary: var1 = find(marbles initially) # 9, var2 = find(marbles now) # 4, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 9 - 4 = 5, return(var3) # 5
fr_prompt: Josh avait 9 billes dans sa collection. Il a perdu quelques billes. S'il a 4 billes maintenant, combien de billes a-t-il perdues ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(billes initialement) # 9, var2 = trouver(billes maintenant) # 4, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), CALL # 9 - 4 = 5, return(var3) # 5

prompt: The kids from Oakwood Elementary School are visiting a bird zoo for their field trip. To get to the bird zoo from the school, the kids have to ride some buses. If there are 7 buses and each bus has 3 adult supervisors to guide the children, how many supervisors are there in total?
summary: var1 = find(number of buses) # 7, var2 = find(supervisors per bus) # 3, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 7 * 3 = 21, return(var1) # 21
fr_prompt: Les enfants de l'école élémentaire d'Oakwood visitent un zoo d'oiseaux pour leur excursion. Pour se rendre au zoo des oiseaux depuis l'école, les enfants doivent prendre des bus. S'il y a 7 bus et que chaque bus a 3 superviseurs adultes pour guider les enfants, combien y a-t-il de superviseurs au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre de bus) # 7, var2 = find(superviseurs par bus) # 3, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 7 * 3 = 21, return(var1) # 21

prompt: A full moon occurs every 30 days. If the last full moon occurred on a Friday, how many days will pass before a full moon occurs again on a Friday?
summary: var1 = LCM(30, 7) # LCM(30, 7) = 210, return(var1) # 210
fr_prompt: Une pleine lune se produit tous les 30 jours. Si la dernière pleine lune s'est produite un vendredi, combien de jours s'écouleront avant qu'une pleine lune ne se reproduise un vendredi ?
fr_summary: var1 = LCM(30, 7) # LCM(30, 7) = 210, retour(var1) # 210

prompt: A buffet offers ranch or caesar dressing. The ratio of ranch dressing used to caesar dressing used is 7:1. If the buffet uses 28 cases of ranch dressing, how many cases of caesar do they use?
summary: var1 = find(ranch dressing cases) # 28, var2 = divide(var1, 7), var3 = multiply(var2, 1), CALL # (28 / 7) * 1 = 4, return(var3) # 4
fr_prompt: Un buffet propose une vinaigrette ranch ou césar. Le rapport entre la vinaigrette ranch utilisée et la vinaigrette césar utilisée est de 7:1. Si le buffet utilise 28 caisses de vinaigrette ranch, combien de caisses de césar utilisent-ils ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(ranch dressing cases) # 28, var2 = diviser(var1, 7), var3 = multiplier(var2, 1), CALL # (28 / 7) * 1 = 4, return(var3) # 4

prompt: Marco and his dad went strawberry picking. Together they collected strawberries that weighed 22 pounds. On the way back Marco ' dad found 30 more pounds of strawberries. Marco's strawberries now weighed 36 pounds.How much did his dad's strawberries weigh now?
summary: var1 = find(total strawberries) # 22, var2 = find(strawberries found on the way back) # 30, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(Marco's strawberries) # 36, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 22 + 30 - 36 = 16, return(var5) # 16
fr_prompt: Marco et son père sont allés cueillir des fraises. Ensemble, ils ont ramassé des fraises qui pesaient 22 livres. Sur le chemin du retour, le papa de Marco a trouvé encore 30 livres de fraises. Les fraises de Marco pesaient maintenant 36 livres. Combien pesaient les fraises de son père maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(total fraises) # 22, var2 = trouver(fraises trouvées au retour) # 30, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(fraises de Marco) # 36, var5 = soustraire(var3, var4 ), APPEL # 22 + 30 - 36 = 16, retour(var5) # 16

prompt: Tiffany was buying hand towels for her house. She bought 9 packs with each pack having 3 towels in it. How many towels did she buy?
summary: var1 = find(packs) # 9, var2 = find(towels per pack) # 3, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 9 * 3 = 27, return(var3) # 27
fr_prompt: Tiffany achetait des essuie-mains pour sa maison. Elle a acheté 9 paquets avec chaque paquet contenant 3 serviettes. Combien de serviettes a-t-elle achetées ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(packs) # 9, var2 = find(serviettes par pack) # 3, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 9 * 3 = 27, return(var3) # 27

prompt: Kelly has 106 nintendo games.How many will she have left if she gives away 64 games?
summary: var1 = find(Kelly games) #106, var2 = subtract(var1, 64), CALL # 106 - 64 = 42, return(var2) # 42
fr_prompt: Kelly a 106 jeux nintendo. Combien lui en restera-t-il si elle donne 64 jeux ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (jeux Kelly) # 106, var2 = soustraire (var1, 64), APPEL # 106 - 64 = 42, retour (var2) # 42

prompt: Melissa scored 12 points in each game. If she scored a total of 36 pointsHow many games did she play?
summary: var1 = find(points) # 36, var2 = find(points per game) # 12, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 36 / 12 = 3, return(var3) # 3
fr_prompt: Melissa a marqué 12 points à chaque match. Si elle a marqué un total de 36 points, à combien de parties a-t-elle joué ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(points) # 36, var2 = find(points per game) # 12, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 36 / 12 = 3, return(var3) # 3

prompt: Faye was placing some pencils equally into 2 rows. If she had 6 pencilsHow many pencils did she place in each row?
summary: pencils = find(Faye's pencils) # 6, rows = find(rows) # 2, per_row = divide(pencils, rows), CALL # 6 / 2 = 3, return(per_row) # 3
fr_prompt: Faye plaçait des crayons également en 2 rangées. Si elle avait 6 crayons, combien de crayons a-t-elle placés dans chaque rangée ?
fr_summary: crayons = trouver (crayons de Faye) # 6, lignes = trouver (lignes) # 2, par ligne = diviser (crayons, ligne), COL # 6 / 2 = 3, retour (par ligne) # 3

prompt: Eight balls were in the basket. Some of the balls were removed from the basket. Now there are six balls. How many balls were removed from the basket?
summary: var1 = find(initial balls) # 8, var2 = find(final balls) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 8 - 6 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: Huit balles étaient dans le panier. Certaines balles ont été retirées du panier. Maintenant, il y a six balles. Combien de balles ont été retirées du panier ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(boules initiales) # 8, var2 = trouver(boules finales) # 6, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 8 - 6 = 2, retour(var3) # 2

prompt: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. If they have 8 sets of tables and each set has 7 chairs, how many chairs do they have for the guests?
summary: var1 = find(number of sets of tables) # 8, var2 = find(chairs per set) # 7, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 8 * 7 = 56, return(var1) # 56
fr_prompt: Ils ont décidé d'organiser la fête dans leur jardin. S'ils ont 8 sets de tables et que chaque set a 7 chaises, combien de chaises ont-ils pour les invités ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(nombre d'ensembles de tables) # 8, var2 = trouver(chaises par ensemble) # 7, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 8 * 7 = 56, retour(var1) # 56

prompt: Julia played tag with 16 kids on monday. If she played tag with 12 more kids on monday than on tuesdayHow many kids did she play with on tuesday?
summary: var1 = find(kids played with on monday) # 16, var2 = find(difference in kids played) # 12, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 16 - 12 = 4, return(var3) # 4
fr_prompt: Julia a joué avec 16 enfants lundi. Si elle a joué avec 12 enfants de plus le lundi que le mardi, avec combien d'enfants a-t-elle joué le mardi ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(les enfants ont joué avec le lundi) # 16, var2 = find(différence entre les enfants ont joué) # 12, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 16 - 12 = 4, return(var3) # 4

prompt: Matthew had 15 crackers. If Matthew gave equal numbers of crackers to his 5 friends and still had 10 crackers leftHow many crackers did each friend eat?
summary: var1 = find(Matthew crackers) #15, var2 = subtract(var1, 10), CALL # 15 - 10 = 5, var3 = divide(var2, 5), CALL # 5 / 5 = 1, return(var3) # 1
fr_prompt: Matthew avait 15 craquelins. Si Matthieu a donné un nombre égal de craquelins à ses 5 amis et qu'il lui restait encore 10 craquelins, combien de craquelins chaque ami a-t-il mangé ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(Matthew crackers) #15, var2 = soustraire(var1, 10), CALL # 15 - 10 = 5, var3 = diviser(var2, 5), CALL # 5 / 5 = 1, return(var3) # 1

prompt: After resting they decided to go for a swim. The depth of the water is 2 times Dean's height. Dean is 8 feet shorter than Ron. If Ron stands at 14 feetHow deep was the water?
summary: var1 = find(Ron's height) #14, var2 = subtract(var1, 8), CALL # 14 - 8 = 6, var3 = multiply(var2, 2), CALL # 6 * 2 = 12, return(var3) # 12
fr_prompt: Après s'être reposés, ils décidèrent d'aller se baigner. La profondeur de l'eau est 2 fois la hauteur de Dean. Dean est 8 pieds plus petit que Ron. Si Ron se tient à 14 pieds, quelle était la profondeur de l'eau ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(taille de Ron) #14, var2 = soustraire(var1, 8), CALL # 14 - 8 = 6, var3 = multiplier(var2, 2), CALL # 6 * 2 = 12, return(var3) # 12

prompt: A waiter had 13 customers. After some left he got 4 new customers. If he still had 9 customersHow many customers left?
summary: var1 = find(initial customers) # 13, var2 = find(new customers) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(remaining customers) # 9, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 13 + 4 - 9 = 8, return(var5) # 8
fr_prompt: Un serveur avait 13 clients. Après quelques départs, il a eu 4 nouveaux clients. S'il avait encore 9 clients, combien de clients restaient-ils ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(clients initiaux) # 13, var2 = trouver(nouveaux clients) # 4, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(clients restants) # 9, var5 = soustraire(var3, var4), APPEL # 13 + 4 - 9 = 8, retour(var5) # 8

prompt: Jake has 12 fewer peaches and 79 more apples than Steven. Steven has 19 peaches and 14 apples.How many peaches does Jake have?
summary: var1 = find(Steven's peaches) #19, var2 = subtract(var1, 12), CALL # 19 - 12 = 7, return(var2) #7
fr_prompt: Jacques a 12 pêches de moins et 79 pommes de plus que Steven. Steven a 19 pêches et 14 pommes. Combien de pêches Jacques a-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(les pêches de Steven) #19, var2 = soustraire(var1, 12), APPEL # 19 - 12 = 7, retourner(var2) #7

prompt: Luke scored 84 points after playing 2 rounds of a trivia game. If he gained the same number of points each roundHow many points did he score per round?
summary: var1 = find(Total points) # 84, var2 = find(Rounds) # 2, var3 = div(var1, var2), CALL # 84 / 2 = 42, return(var3) # 42
fr_prompt: Luke a marqué 84 points après avoir joué 2 tours d'un jeu-questionnaire. S'il a gagné le même nombre de points à chaque manche, combien de points a-t-il marqué par manche ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Total points) # 84, var2 = find(Rounds) # 2, var3 = div(var1, var2), CALL # 84 / 2 = 42, return(var3) # 42

prompt: With flu season coming up, Lexi decides to make get-well-soon kits. She has 10 cans of chicken soup and 15 boxes of tissue, which she wants to use to make identical kits with no materials left over. What is the greatest number of get-well-soon kits Lexi can make?
summary: var1 = find(cans of soup) # 10, var2 = find(boxes of tissue) # 15, var3 = gcd(var1, var2) # gcd(10, 15) = 5, return(var3) # 5
fr_prompt: À l'approche de la saison de la grippe, Lexi décide de fabriquer des trousses de rétablissement. Elle a 10 boîtes de soupe au poulet et 15 boîtes de mouchoirs, qu'elle souhaite utiliser pour fabriquer des kits identiques sans restes de matériaux. Quel est le plus grand nombre de trousses de rétablissement que Lexi peut fabriquer ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(boites de soupe) # 10, var2 = find(boites de mouchoirs) # 15, var3 = pgcd(var1, var2) # pgcd(10, 15) = 5, return(var3) # 5

prompt: Allen, Charles, Lex and Shiela spent days reading books for their book report. The texts were printed very small so they were only able to cover very few pages a day. Allen read about the Solar System. He read 10 pages a day of a book which has 120 pages. How many days did it take Allen to finish reading the book?
summary: var1 = find(book pages) # 120, var2 = find(pages read per day) # 10, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 120 / 10 = 12, return(var1) # 12
fr_prompt: Allen, Charles, Lex et Shiela ont passé des jours à lire des livres pour leur rapport de lecture. Les textes étaient imprimés très petits et ne pouvaient donc couvrir que très peu de pages par jour. Allen a lu sur le système solaire. Il lisait 10 pages par jour d'un livre de 120 pages. Combien de jours a-t-il fallu à Allen pour finir de lire le livre ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(pages du livre) # 120, var2 = trouver(pages lues par jour) # 10, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 120 / 10 = 12, retour(var1) # 12

prompt: Sam invited 9 friends to a birthday party, but 6 couldn't come. If he wanted to buy enough cupcakes so each person could have exactly 2, how many should he buy?
summary: var1 = find(invited friends) # 9, var2 = find(absent friends) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 9 - 6 = 3, var4 = find(cupcakes per person) # 2, var5 = multiply(var3, var4), CALL # 3 * 2 = 6, return(var5) # 6
fr_prompt: Sam a invité 9 amis à une fête d'anniversaire, mais 6 n'ont pas pu venir. S'il voulait acheter suffisamment de cupcakes pour que chaque personne puisse en avoir exactement 2, combien devrait-il en acheter ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(amis invités) # 9, var2 = trouver(amis absents) # 6, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 9 - 6 = 3, var4 = trouver(cupcakes par personne) # 2, var5 = multiplier(var3, var4), CALL # 3 * 2 = 6, return(var5) # 6

prompt: Jake has 7 fewer peaches than Steven and 8 more peaches than Jill. Steven has 17 peaches.How many peaches does Jill have?
summary: var1 = find(Steven peaches) # 17, var2 = find(difference between Steven and Jake) # 7, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = find(difference between Jake and Jill) # 8, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 17 - 7 = 10, 10 - 8 = 2, return(var5) # 2
fr_prompt: Jake a 7 pêches de moins que Steven et 8 pêches de plus que Jill. Steven a 17 pêches. Combien de pêches Jill a-t-elle ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(Steven pêches) # 17, var2 = trouver(différence entre Steven et Jake) # 7, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(différence entre Jake et Jill) # 8, var5 = soustraire(var3 , var4), APPEL # 17 - 7 = 10, 10 - 8 = 2, retour(var5) # 2

prompt: Cody had 45 dollars. For his birthday he got 9 more dollars but spent 19 on a new game. How much money does he have now?
summary: var1 = find(Cody's money) # 45, var2 = find(birthday money) # 9, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 45 + 9 = 54, var2 = find(money spent on game) # 19, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 54 - 19 = 35, return(var1) # 35
fr_prompt: Cody avait 45 dollars. Pour son anniversaire, il a reçu 9 dollars de plus mais en a dépensé 19 pour un nouveau jeu. Combien d'argent a-t-il maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(l'argent de Cody) # 45, var2 = find(l'argent d'anniversaire) # 9, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 45 + 9 = 54, var2 = find(l'argent dépensé pour le jeu) # 19, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 54 - 19 = 35, retour(var1) # 35

prompt: A box can hold 18 pieces of chalk. If there are 3,484 pieces of chalk, how many chalks are there in the box that is not full?
summary: var1 = find(chalk pieces) # 3,484, var2 = find(chalk pieces per box) # 18, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 3,484 / 18 = 193.56, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(193.56) = 193, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 18 * 193 = 3,474, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 3,484 - 3,474 = 10, return(var5) # 10
fr_prompt: Une boîte peut contenir 18 craies. S'il y a 3 484 craies, combien y a-t-il de craies dans la boîte qui n'est pas pleine ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(morceaux de craie) # 3 484, var2 = trouver(morceaux de craie par boîte) # 18, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 3 484 / 18 = 193,56, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down (193,56) = 193, var4 = multiplier (var2, var3), APPEL # 18 * 193 = 3 474, var5 = soustraire (var1, var4), APPEL # 3 484 - 3 474 = 10, retour (var5) # 10

prompt: Tony had $20. He paid $8 for a ticket to a baseball game. At the game, he bought a hot dog for $3. What amount of money did Tony have then?
summary: var1 = find(Tony's money) # 20, var2 = find(ticket cost) # 8, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 20 - 8 = 12, var2 = find(hot dog cost) # 3, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 12 - 3 = 9, return(var1) # 9
fr_prompt: Tony avait 20 $. Il a payé 8 $ pour un billet pour un match de baseball. Au match, il a acheté un hot-dog pour 3 $. Quelle somme d'argent Tony avait-il alors?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (l'argent de Tony) # 20, var2 = trouver (coût du billet) # 8, var1 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 20 - 8 = 12, var2 = trouver (coût du hot-dog) # 3, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 12 - 3 = 9, retour(var1) # 9

prompt: Andrew and Jeffrey walk together. When the ratio of Andrew's steps to Jeffrey's steps was 3:4. If Andrew walks 150 steps, how many steps does Jeffrey walk?
summary: var1 = find(Andrew steps) # 150, var2 = find(Andrew to Jeffrey ratio) # 3, var3 = find(Jeffrey to Andrew ratio) # 4, var4 = multiply(var1, var3), var5 = divide(var4, var2), return(var5) # 200
fr_prompt: Andrew et Jeffrey marchent ensemble. Quand le rapport des pas d'Andrew aux pas de Jeffrey était de 3:4. Si Andrew fait 150 pas, combien de pas Jeffrey fait-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (étapes d'Andrew) # 150, var2 = trouver (rapport d'Andrew à Jeffrey) # 3, var3 = trouver (rapport de Jeffrey à Andrew) # 4, var4 = multiplier (var1, var3), var5 = diviser (var4, var2 ), retour(var5) # 200

prompt: 10 red peaches and some more green peaches are in the basket. If there are a total of 15 peaches in the basketHow many green peaches are in the basket?
summary: var1 = find(Total peaches) # 15, var2 = find(Red peaches) # 10, var3 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 15 - 10 = 5, return(var3) # 5
fr_prompt: 10 pêches rouges et quelques autres pêches vertes sont dans le panier. S'il y a un total de 15 pêches dans le panier, combien y a-t-il de pêches vertes dans le panier ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Total pêches) # 15, var2 = find(Pêches rouges) # 10, var3 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 15 - 10 = 5, return(var3) # 5

prompt: Edward spent $2 on a board game and then he bought 4 action figures for $7 each. How much money did he spend on the game and figures?
summary: var1 = find(board game cost) # 2, var2 = find(action figures) # 4, var3 = find(figure cost each) # 7, var2 = var2 * var3, CALL # 4 * 7 = 28, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 28 = 30, return(var1) # 30
fr_prompt: Edward a dépensé 2 $ pour un jeu de société, puis il a acheté 4 figurines articulées pour 7 $ chacune. Combien d'argent a-t-il dépensé pour le jeu et les figurines ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (coût du jeu de société) # 2, var2 = trouver (figurines d'action) # 4, var3 = trouver (coût de la figure chacun) # 7, var2 = var2 * var3, APPEL # 4 * 7 = 28, var1 = ajouter ( var1, var2), APPEL # 2 + 28 = 30, retour(var1) # 30

prompt: Allan brought 2 balloons and Jake brought 3 balloons to the park.How many more balloons did Jake have than Allan in the park?
summary: var1 = find(Allan balloons) #2, var2 = subtract(3, 2), CALL # 3 - 2 = 1, return(var2) #1
fr_prompt: Allan a apporté 2 ballons et Jake a apporté 3 ballons au parc. Combien de ballons de plus Jake avait-il qu'Allan dans le parc ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(ballons Allan) #2, var2 = soustraire(3, 2), CALL # 3 - 2 = 1, return(var2) #1

prompt: Jack received 10 emails and 12 letters in the morning. He then received 3 emails and 44 letters in the afternoon.How many more emails did Jack receive in the morning than in the afternoon?
summary: var1 = find(emails in morning) # 10, var2 = find(emails in afternoon) # 3, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 10 - 3 = 7, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: Jack a reçu 10 e-mails et 12 lettres dans la matinée. Il a ensuite reçu 3 e-mails et 44 lettres dans l'après-midi. Combien d'e-mails de plus Jack a-t-il reçu le matin que l'après-midi ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(emails du matin) # 10, var2 = find(emails de l'après-midi) # 3, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 10 - 3 = 7, return(var3) # 7

prompt: Mrs. Santiago has 58 red roses. Mrs. Garrett has 24. What's the difference of the number of Mrs. Santiago's red roses and Mrs. Garrett's red roses?
summary: var1 = find(Mrs. Santiago roses) # 58, var2 = find(Mrs. Garrett roses) # 24, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 58 - 24 = 34, return(var1) # 34
fr_prompt: Mme Santiago a 58 roses rouges. Mme Garrett en a 24. Quelle est la différence entre le nombre de roses rouges de Mme Santiago et le nombre de roses rouges de Mme Garrett ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (Mme Santiago roses) # 58, var2 = trouver (Mme Garrett roses) # 24, var1 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 58 - 24 = 34, retour (var1) # 34

prompt: Summer is almost here and most animals are migrating back to cooler countries. There are 87 bird families living near a mountain. If 18 new bird families joined themHow many bird families live near the mountain now?
summary: var1 = find(bird families initially) # 87, var2 = find(new bird families) # 18, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 87 + 18 = 105, return(var3) # 105
fr_prompt: L'été est presque arrivé et la plupart des animaux migrent vers des pays plus frais. Il y a 87 familles d'oiseaux vivant près d'une montagne. Si 18 nouvelles familles d'oiseaux les rejoignent, combien de familles d'oiseaux vivent près de la montagne maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(familles d'oiseaux initialement) # 87, var2 = find(nouvelles familles d'oiseaux) # 18, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 87 + 18 = 105, return(var3) # 105

prompt: 94 students signed up for computer classes. There were 24 second graders and 29 third graders. The rest of the students were fourth graders. How many fourth graders took computer classes?
summary: var1 = find(second graders) # 24, var2 = find(third graders) # 29, var3 = add(var1, var2) # 24 + 29 = 53, var4 = subtract(94, var3) # 94 - 53 = 41, return(var4) # 41
fr_prompt: 94 étudiants se sont inscrits aux cours d'informatique. Il y avait 24 élèves de deuxième année et 29 élèves de troisième année. Les autres élèves étaient des élèves de quatrième année. Combien d'élèves de CM1 ont suivi des cours d'informatique ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (élèves de deuxième année) # 24, var2 = trouver (élèves de troisième année) # 29, var3 = ajouter (var1, var2) # 24 + 29 = 53, var4 = soustraire (94, var3) # 94 - 53 = 41, retour(var4) # 41

prompt: Every day, Ryan spends 4 hours on learning English and 3 hours on learning Chinese. How many hours does he spend on learning English and Chinese in all?
summary: var1 = find(hours for English) # 4, var2 = find(hours for Chinese) # 3, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 3 = 7, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: Chaque jour, Ryan passe 4 heures à apprendre l'anglais et 3 heures à apprendre le chinois. Combien d'heures passe-t-il à apprendre l'anglais et le chinois en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(heures pour l'anglais) # 4, var2 = find(heures pour le chinois) # 3, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 3 = 7, return(var3) # 7

prompt: Lewis earns $ 21 every week during the 216 weeks of harvest. If he has to pay $ 702 taxHow much money will have at the end of the harvest season?
summary: earnings = find(Lewis earnings per week) # 21, weeks = find(weeks of harvest) # 216, total_earnings = multiply(earnings, weeks), CALL # 21 * 216 = 4536, tax = find(tax to be paid) # 702, remaining = subtract(total_earnings, tax), CALL # 4536 - 702 = 3834, return(remaining) # 3834
fr_prompt: Lewis gagne 21 dollars chaque semaine pendant les 216 semaines de récolte. S'il doit payer 702 $ d'impôt, combien d'argent aura-t-il à la fin de la saison des récoltes ?
fr_summary: gains = trouver (gains Lewis par semaine) # 21, semaines = trouver (semaines de récolte) # 216, total_earnings = multiplier (gains, semaines), APPEL # 21 * 216 = 4536, taxe = trouver (taxe à payer) # 702, restant = soustraire (total_earnings, impôt), APPEL # 4536 - 702 = 3834, retour (restant) # 3834

prompt: 43 children were riding on the bus. At the bus stop some children got off the bus. Then there were 21 children left on the bus.How many children got off the bus at the bus stop?
summary: var1 = find(children on the bus) # 43, var2 = find(children left on the bus) # 21, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 43 - 21 = 22, return(var1) # 22
fr_prompt: 43 enfants montaient dans le bus. À l'arrêt de bus, des enfants sont descendus du bus. Ensuite, il restait 21 enfants dans le bus. Combien d'enfants sont descendus du bus à l'arrêt de bus ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(enfants dans le bus) # 43, var2 = trouver(enfants laissés dans le bus) # 21, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 43 - 21 = 22, retour(var1) # 22

prompt: Philip is buying pens and pencils from the store. Pens come in packages of 12, but pencils are sold in packages of 15. If Philip wishes to purchase the same number of pens as pencils, what is the smallest number of pens that he can buy?
summary: var1 = find(pens pack) # 12, var2 = find(pencils pack) # 15, var3 = lcm(var1, var2) # lcm(12, 15) = 60, return(var3) # 60
fr_prompt: Philip achète des stylos et des crayons au magasin. Les stylos sont vendus en paquets de 12, mais les crayons sont vendus en paquets de 15. Si Philippe souhaite acheter le même nombre de stylos que de crayons, quel est le plus petit nombre de stylos qu'il peut acheter ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pack de stylos) # 12, var2 = find(pack de crayons) # 15, var3 = lcm(var1, var2) # lcm(12, 15) = 60, return(var3) # 60

prompt: A grocery store had 79 bottles of regular soda, 53 bottles of diet soda and 42 apples.How many more bottles of regular soda than diet soda did they have?
summary: var1 = find(regular soda bottles) # 79, var2 = find(diet soda bottles) # 53, var3 = find(difference between reg and diet soda) # 79 - 53 = 26, CALL # 79 - 53 = 26, return(var3) # 26
fr_prompt: Une épicerie avait 79 bouteilles de soda ordinaire, 53 bouteilles de soda light et 42 pommes. Combien y avait-il de bouteilles de soda ordinaire de plus que de soda light ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (bouteilles de soda régulières) # 79, var2 = trouver (bouteilles de soda light) # 53, var3 = trouver (différence entre reg et soda light) # 79 - 53 = 26, APPEL # 79 - 53 = 26, retour ( var3) # 26

prompt: Bob strikes the drums every 9 seconds and the cymbals every 12 seconds. If he just struck both at the same time, how many seconds will pass before he again strikes them at the same time?
summary: var1 = find(Bob strikes the drums every 9 seconds) # 9, var2 = find(cymbals every 12 seconds) # 12, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(9,12) = 36, return(var3) # 36
fr_prompt: Bob frappe la batterie toutes les 9 secondes et les cymbales toutes les 12 secondes. S'il vient de frapper les deux en même temps, combien de secondes s'écouleront avant qu'il ne les frappe à nouveau en même temps ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Bob frappe la batterie toutes les 9 secondes) # 9, var2 = find(cymbales toutes les 12 secondes) # 12, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(9,12) = 36, return(var3 ) #36

prompt: Paco had 41 cookies. He gave 9 cookies to his friend and ate 18 cookies.How many more cookies did he eat than those he gave to his friend?
summary: var1 = find(cookies Paco gave to friend) # 9, var2 = find(cookies Paco ate) # 18, var1 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 18 - 9 = 9, return(var1) # 9
fr_prompt: Paco avait 41 biscuits. Il a donné 9 biscuits à son ami et en a mangé 18. Combien de biscuits a-t-il mangés de plus que ceux qu'il a donnés à son ami ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(cookies que Paco a donné à un ami) # 9, var2 = find(cookies que Paco a mangé) # 18, var1 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 18 - 9 = 9, return(var1) # 9

prompt: Christmas is near. Mr. Anderson, president of Nice People Inc. organized a charity event to share happiness to the less fortunate people. The first thing that he did is to visit an orphanage. There he dressed up as Santa and gave toys to the children. If he gave 134 toy cars to the boys and 269 dolls to the girls, how many toys did he give to all?
summary: var1 = find(toys for boys) # 134, var2 = find(toys for girls) # 269, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 134 + 269 = 403, return(var1) # 403
fr_prompt: Noël est proche. M. Anderson, président de Nice People Inc. a organisé un événement caritatif pour partager le bonheur des personnes les moins fortunées. La première chose qu'il fit fut de visiter un orphelinat. Là, il s'est déguisé en Père Noël et a donné des jouets aux enfants. S'il a donné 134 petites voitures aux garçons et 269 poupées aux filles, combien de jouets a-t-il donné à tous ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(jouets pour garçons) # 134, var2 = find(jouets pour filles) # 269, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 134 + 269 = 403, return(var1) # 403

prompt: Mikayla has a huge collection of music CDs. She gave 15 CDs to her friend. Now she has 78 CDs left. How many CDs were in Mikayla's collection at first?
summary: var1 = find(final CDs) # 78, var2 = find(given CDs) # 15, var3 = add(var1, var2) # 78 + 15 = 93, return(var3) # 93
fr_prompt: Mikayla possède une énorme collection de CD de musique. Elle a donné 15 CD à son amie. Maintenant, il lui reste 78 CD. Combien y avait-il de CD dans la collection de Mikayla au début ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(dernier CD) # 78, var2 = find(donné CD) # 15, var3 = add(var1, var2) # 78 + 15 = 93, return(var3) # 93

prompt: There were 8 people on the bus. At the next stop 12 more people got on the bus and 3 people got off.How many people are there on the bus now?
summary: var1 = find(people on bus) # 8, var2 = find(new passengers) # 12, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(people who got off) # 3, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # (8 + 12) - 3 = 20 - 3 = 17, return(var5) # 17
fr_prompt: Il y avait 8 personnes dans le bus. Au prochain arrêt, 12 autres personnes sont montées dans le bus et 3 personnes en sont descendues. Combien y a-t-il de personnes dans le bus maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(personnes dans le bus) # 8, var2 = trouver(nouveaux passagers) # 12, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(personnes qui sont descendues) # 3, var5 = soustraire(var3, var4) , APPEL # (8 + 12) - 3 = 20 - 3 = 17, retour(var5) # 17

prompt: Tiffany was collecting cans for recycling. On monday she had 10 bags of cans. She found 3 bags of cans on the next day and 7 bags of cans the day after that.How many bags did she have altogether?
summary: var1 = find(Monday's bags) # 10, var2 = find(Tuesday's bags) # 3, var3 = find(Wednesday's bags) # 7, var4 = add(var1, var2), var4 = add(var4,var3), CALL # 10 + 3 + 7 = 20, return(var4) # 20
fr_prompt: Tiffany ramassait des canettes pour les recycler. Le lundi, elle avait 10 sacs de canettes. Elle a trouvé 3 sacs de canettes le lendemain et 7 sacs de canettes le surlendemain. Combien de sacs avait-elle en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(sacs du lundi) # 10, var2 = find(sacs du mardi) # 3, var3 = find(sacs du mercredi) # 7, var4 = add(var1, var2), var4 = add(var4,var3), CALL # 10 + 3 + 7 = 20, retour(var4) # 20

prompt: Camryn practices the trumpet every 11th day and the flute every 3rd day. Camryn practiced both the trumpet and the flute today. How many days until Camryn practices the trumpet and flute again in the same day?
summary: var1 = find(trumpet practice day) # 11, var2 = find(flute practice day) # 3, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(11,3) = 33, return(var3) # 33
fr_prompt: Camryn pratique la trompette tous les 11 jours et la flûte tous les 3 jours. Camryn a pratiqué à la fois la trompette et la flûte aujourd'hui. Combien de jours avant que Camryn pratique à nouveau la trompette et la flûte dans la même journée ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(jour de pratique trompette) # 11, var2 = trouver(jour de pratique flûte) # 3, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), APPEL # lcm(11,3) = 33, retour(var3) # 33

prompt: After finding some bottle caps at the park danny has 32 bottle caps in his collection. If he had 25 bottle caps in his collection earlierHow many bottle caps did he find at the park?
summary: var1 = find(Danny's new collection) # 32, var2 = find(Danny's earlier collection) # 25, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 32 - 25 = 7, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: Après avoir trouvé des capsules de bouteilles au parc, Danny a 32 capsules de bouteilles dans sa collection. S'il avait 25 capsules de bouteilles dans sa collection auparavant, combien de capsules de bouteilles a-t-il trouvées au parc ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nouvelle collection de Danny) # 32, var2 = find(ancienne collection de Danny) # 25, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 32 - 25 = 7, return(var3) # 7

prompt: At the zoo, a cage had snakes and alligators. The total number of animals in the cage was 79. If 24 snakes and 51 alligators were hidingHow many animals were not hiding in all?
summary: var1 = find(total animals) # 79, var2 = find(hidden snakes) # 24, var3 = find(hidden alligators) # 51, var4 = add(var2, var3), var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 79 - (24 + 51) = 4, return(var5) # 4
fr_prompt: Au zoo, une cage contenait des serpents et des alligators. Le nombre total d'animaux dans la cage était de 79. Si 24 serpents et 51 alligators avaient Combien d'animaux ne se cachaient pas en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (total d'animaux) # 79, var2 = trouver (serpents cachés) # 24, var3 = trouver (alligators cachés) # 51, var4 = ajouter (var2, var3), var5 = soustraire (var1, var4), CALL # 79 - (24 + 51) = 4, retour(var5) # 4

prompt: For Gwen's birthday she received five dollars. If she spent three dollars. How much money did she still have?
summary: var1 = find(total gift) # 5, var2 = find(spent money) # 3, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 5 - 3 = 2, return(var3) # 2

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(don total) # 5, var2 = trouver(argent dépensé) # 3, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), CALL # 5 - 3 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: The ratio of Kate's stickers to Jenna's stickers is 7:4. Kate has 21 stickers. How many stickers does Jenna have?
summary: var1 = find(Kate stickers) # 21, var2 = find(Kate to Jenna ratio) # 7, var3 = find(Jenna to Kate ratio) # 4, var4 = multiply(var1, var3), var5 = divide(var4, var2), return(var5) # 12
fr_prompt: Le rapport des autocollants de Kate aux autocollants de Jenna est de 7:4. Kate a 21 autocollants. Combien d'autocollants possède Jenna ?

prompt: At the arcade Dave won 11 tickets. If he spent 5 tickets on a beanie and later won 10 more tickets, how many would he have?
summary: var1 = find(Dave's tickets) # 11, var2 = find(spent tickets) # 5, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 5 = 6, var2 = find(newly won tickets) # 10, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 10 = 16, return(var1) # 16

prompt: Rug A is 8 feet by 4 feet, and Rug B is 5 feet by 7 feet. Which rug should Mrs. Hilt buy if she wants the rug with the biggest area?
summary: var1 = find(area of rug A) # 8 * 4 = 32, var2 = find(area of rug B) # 5 * 7 = 35, if var1 < var2:, return("Rug B") # Rug B, else:, return("Rug A") # Rug A
fr_prompt: Le tapis A mesure 8 pieds sur 4 pieds et le tapis B mesure 5 pieds sur 7 pieds. Quel tapis Mme Hilt devrait-elle acheter si elle veut le tapis avec la plus grande surface ?

prompt: I see 115 cows grazing in the pasture. How many legs do I see?

fr_summary: var1 = find(vaches au pâturage) # 115, var2 = multiplier(var1, 4), CALL # 115 * 4 = 460, return(var2) # 460

prompt: Paige had 2 pencils in her desk, 2 in her backpack and 15 at home. How many pencils does Paige have?

prompt: Edward was playing basketball with his friend. Together they scored 13 points. If Edward scored 7 of the points. How many points did his friend score?

prompt: 63 people are going to the zoo. There are 3 cars to take people to the zoo. How many will go in each car if the same number go in each car?

prompt: 89 cookies are being shared equally among 4 people. How many does each person get?

summary: var1 = find(sweet cookies) # 22, var2 = find(salty cookies) # 75, var3 = subtract(var1, 15), var4 = subtract(var2, 54), CALL # 22 - 15 = 7, 75 - 54 = 21, return(var3) # 7

summary: var1 = find(dimes) # 2, var2 = find(nickels) # 2, var3 = find(quarters) # 7, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 2 = 4, var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 4 + 7 = 11, return(var5) # 11
fr_prompt: À la banque, un client a rendu 2 centimes, 2 nickels et 7 quarts. Quel est le nombre total de pièces remises par le client ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(dimes) # 2, var2 = trouver(nickels) # 2, var3 = trouver(quartiers) # 7, var4 = ajouter(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 2 = 4, var5 = ajouter(var4, var3), APPEL # 4 + 7 = 11, retour (var5) # 11

prompt: Mrs. Hilt gave 2 pieces of candy to each student in the group. The group had a total of 9 students in it. How many pieces of candy did Mrs. Hilt give away?
summary: var1 = find(candy pieces per student) # 2, var2 = find(total students) # 9, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 2 * 9 = 18, return(var3) # 18
fr_prompt: Mme Hilt a donné 2 bonbons à chaque élève du groupe. Le groupe comptait au total 9 élèves. Combien de bonbons Mme Hilt a-t-elle distribués ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(bonbons par élève) # 2, var2 = trouver(nombre total d'élèves) # 9, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 2 * 9 = 18, retour(var3) # 18

prompt: With 28 dollars 2 packs of dvds can be bought.How much does each pack cost?
summary: var1 = find(Dollars) # 28, var2 = find(Packs) # 2, var3 = div(var1, var2), CALL # 28 / 2 = 14, return(var3) # 14
fr_prompt: Avec 28 dollars, 2 packs de DVD peuvent être achetés. Combien coûte chaque pack ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Dollars) # 28, var2 = find(Packs) # 2, var3 = div(var1, var2), CALL # 28 / 2 = 14, return(var3) # 14

prompt: If you have 14 cookies in total and 7 bags having equal number of cookiesHow many cookies does each bag have?
summary: var1 = find(total cookies) # 14, var2 = find(number of bags) # 7, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 14 / 7 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: Si vous avez 14 cookies au total et 7 sacs contenant le même nombre de cookies, combien de cookies chaque sac contient-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(nombre total de cookies) # 14, var2 = trouver(nombre de sacs) # 7, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 14 / 7 = 2, retour(var3) # 2

prompt: Paul had 134 books. After giving 39 books to his friend and selling some books in a garage sale he had 68 books left.How many books did he sell in the garage sale?
summary: var1 = find(initial books) # 134, var2 = find(books given away) # 39, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = find(books left) # 68, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 134 - 39 = 95, 95 - 68 = 27, return(var5) # 27
fr_prompt: Paul avait 134 livres. Après avoir donné 39 livres à son ami et vendu quelques livres dans une vente de garage, il lui restait 68 livres. Combien de livres a-t-il vendus dans la vente de garage ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(livres initiaux) # 134, var2 = trouver(livres donnés) # 39, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(livres restants) # 68, var5 = soustraire(var3, var4), CALL # 134 - 39 = 95, 95 - 68 = 27, retour(var5) # 27

prompt: Ed had 6 more marbles than Doug. Doug lost 7 of his marbles at the playground. If Ed had 22 marblesHow many marbles does Doug have now?
summary: var1 = find(marbles Ed has) # 22, var2 = find(more marbles Ed has) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = find(marbles lost by Doug) # 7, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 22 - 6 - 7 = 9, return(var5) # 9
fr_prompt: Ed avait 6 billes de plus que Dougdoug n'en a perdu 7 au terrain de jeux. Si Ed a 22 billes Combien de billes Doug a-t-il maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(billes qu'Ed a) # 22, var2 = trouver(plus de billes qu'Ed a) # 6, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(billes perdues par Doug) # 7, var5 = soustraire(var3, var4), APPEL # 22 - 6 - 7 = 9, retour (var5) # 9

prompt: The map led them through the forest and into a cave. To open the cave doors, they need to put weights on the switch. If the switch already has 234 lbs. of weights and the total needed is 712 lbs., how much more weight to they need to add?
summary: var1 = find(total weight needed) # 712 lbs., var2 = find(current weight on switch) # 234 lbs., var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 712 - 234 = 478 lbs., return(var1) # 478 lbs.
fr_prompt: La carte les conduisit à travers la forêt et dans une grotte. Pour ouvrir les portes de la grotte, ils doivent mettre des poids sur l'interrupteur. Si le commutateur a déjà 234 lbs. de poids et le total nécessaire est de 712 livres, combien de poids supplémentaires doivent-ils ajouter ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (poids total nécessaire) # 712 livres, var2 = trouver (poids actuel sur l'interrupteur) # 234 livres, var1 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 712 - 234 = 478 livres, retour (var1) # 478 livres.

prompt: Jack loves to collect and read books. In fact, he has a mini-library in their house and he usually spends most of his time in it. The library is divided into different sections for different type of books. The science fiction section has 8 books. If each book has 478 pages, how many pages do all the 8 books have in total?
summary: var1 = find(pages per book) # 478, var2 = find(number of books) # 8, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 478 * 8 = 3824, return(var1) # 3824
