La bibliothèque est divisée en différentes sections pour différents types de livres. La section science-fiction compte 8 livres. Si chaque livre a 478 pages, combien de pages les 8 livres ont-ils au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pages par livre) # 478, var2 = find(nombre de livres) # 8, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 478 * 8 = 3824, return(var1) # 3824

prompt: Winter is almost here and most animals are migrating to warmer countries. There are 85 bird families living near the mountain. If 23 bird families flew away to africa and 37 bird families flew away to asiaHow many bird families were left near the mountain?
summary: var1 = find(total bird families near the mountain) # 85, var2 = find(bird families flown to Africa) # 23, var3 = find(bird families flown to Asia) # 37, var4 = add(var2, var3), var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 85 - (23 + 37) = 25, return(var5) # 25
fr_prompt: L'hiver est presque là et la plupart des animaux migrent vers des pays plus chauds. Il y a 85 familles d'oiseaux vivant près de la montagne. Si 23 familles d'oiseaux se sont envolées vers l'afrique et 37 familles d'oiseaux se sont envolées vers l'asie, combien de familles d'oiseaux sont restées près de la montagne ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre total de familles d'oiseaux près de la montagne) # 85, var2 = find(familles d'oiseaux transportés en Afrique) # 23, var3 = find(familles d'oiseaux transportés en Asie) # 37, var4 = add(var2, var3), var5 = soustraire(var1, var4), APPEL # 85 - (23 + 37) = 25, retour(var5) # 25

prompt: After the party, Kevin estimated that the total money they spent on food, drinks, and utensils sums up to $560.00. If they spent $268.00 on food and $118.00 on utensils and other stuff, how much did they spend on drinks?
summary: var1 = find(total money spent) # 560, var2 = find(money spent on food) # 268, var3 = find(money spent on utensils and other stuff) # 118, var2 = add(var2, var3), CALL # 268 + 118 = 386, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 560 - 386 = 174, return(var1) # 174

prompt: A video game store was getting rid of old games, selling them 3 for $34.26. If they sold 2 games, how much money would they have made?

prompt: Joe's Bath Shop sells bars of soap in boxes of 5 bars and bottles of soap in boxes of 19 bottles. An employee is surprised to discover that the shop sold the same number of bars and bottles last week. What is the smallest number of each type of soap that the shop could have sold?

prompt: Zeshaun bought stamps at the post office. Some of the stamps had a snowflake design, some had a truck design, and some had a rose design. Zeshaun bought 3 snowflake stamps. prompt: Matthew had 8 crackers to give to friends. If Matthew gave 2 crackers to each his friendsHow many friends did he give crackers to?

fr_prompt: Matthew avait 8 craquelins à donner à des amis. Si Matthieu a donné 2 crackers à chacun de ses amis, à combien d'amis a-t-il donné des crackers ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(initial crackers) # 8, var2 = find(crackers per friend) # 2, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 8 / 2 = 4, return(var3) # 4

prompt: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 11 cups of flour and 7 cups of sugar. She already put in some cups of flour. If she still needs 2 more cups of flour than sugarHow many cups of flour did she put in?
summary: var1 = find(flour) #11, var2 = find(sugar) #7, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 7 = 4, var4 = add(var2, 2), CALL # 7 + 2 = 9, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 11 - 9 = 2, return(var5) # 2
fr_prompt: Marie prépare un gâteau. La recette demande 11 tasses de farine et 7 tasses de sucre. Elle a déjà mis quelques tasses de farine. Si elle a encore besoin de 2 tasses de farine de plus que de sucre, combien de tasses de farine a-t-elle mises ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(farine) #11, var2 = trouver(sucre) #7, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 7 = 4, var4 = add(var2, 2), CALL # 7 + 2 = 9, var5 = soustraire(var1, var4), APPEL # 11 - 9 = 2, retour(var5) # 2

prompt: Tommy has $79. He wants to buy a $35 camera. He also wants to buy a $59 CD player. How much more money does Tommy need?
summary: var1 = find(camera cost) # 35, var2 = find(CD player cost) # 59, var3 = add(var1, var2) # 35 + 59 = 94, var4 = subtract(var3, 79) # 94 - 79 = 15, return(var4) # 15
fr_prompt: Tommy a 79 $. Il veut acheter un appareil photo à 35 $. Il veut aussi acheter un lecteur de CD à 59 $. De combien d'argent Tommy a-t-il encore besoin ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(coût de la caméra) # 35, var2 = trouver(coût du lecteur CD) # 59, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2) # 35 + 59 = 94, var4 = soustraire(var3, 79) # 94 - 79 = 15 , retour(var4) # 15

prompt: Paige was helping her mom plant flowers and they put 10 seeds in each flower bed. If they planted 60 seeds altogtherHow many flower beds did they have?
summary: var1 = find(total seeds) #60, var2 = divide(var1, 10), CALL # 60 / 10 = 6, return(var2) # 6

fr_summary: var1 = trouver (graines totales) # 60, var2 = diviser (var1, 10), APPEL # 60 / 10 = 6, retour (var2) # 6

prompt: Lewis earns $ 2 every week during the harvest. If he earns a total of $ 178How many weeks did the harvest last?
summary: var1 = find(total earnings) # 178, var2 = find(earnings per week) # 2, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 178 / 2 = 89, return(var3) # 89

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(gains totaux) # 178, var2 = trouver(gains par semaine) # 2, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 178 / 2 = 89, retour(var3) # 89

prompt: Dennis has 4028 pencils stored in boxes. If the are 53 boxes, how many pencils must go in each box?
summary: var1 = find(pencils) # 4028, var2 = find(boxes) # 53, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 4028 / 53 = 76, var4 = multiply(var3, var2), CALL # 76 * 53 = 4028, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 4028 - 4028 = 0, return(var3) # 76
fr_prompt: Dennis a 4028 crayons stockés dans des boîtes. S'il y a 53 cases, combien de crayons doivent mettre dans chaque case ?

prompt: David did 44 push-ups in gym class today. David did 9 more push-ups than Zachary.How many push-ups did Zachary do?
summary: var1 = find(David push-ups) # 44, var2 = find(Zachary push-ups) # 44 - 9 = 35, CALL # 44 - 9 = 35, return(var2) # 35

prompt: Lucy went to the grocery store. She bought 23 packs of cookie and some packs of cake. In total she had 27 packs of groceryHow many packs of cake did she buy in all?
summary: var1 = find(total packs of grocery) #27, var2 = find(cookie packs) #23, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 27 - 23 = 4, return(var3) #4

prompt: For lunch, 2 students selected chocolate milk, 15 selected strawberry milk and 3 selected regular milk. How many milks were taken total?
summary: var1 = find(chocolate milk) # 2, var2 = find(strawberry milk) # 15, var3 = find(regular milk) # 3, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 15 = 17, var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 17 + 3 = 20, return(var5) # 20
fr_prompt: Pour le déjeuner, 2 élèves ont sélectionné du lait au chocolat, 15 ont sélectionné du lait à la fraise et 3 ont sélectionné du lait régulier. Combien de laits ont été prélevés au total ?

prompt: Each CD rack holds 8 CDs. A shelf can hold four racks. How many total CDs can fit on the shelf?
summary: var1 = find(CDs per rack) # 8, var2 = find(racks per shelf) # 4, var1 = multiply(var1, var2) # 8 * 4 = 32, return(var1) # 32

prompt: Gwen had ninety-eight DS games. After she gave some to her friends she had ninety-one left. How many games did she give away?

fr_prompt: 39 élèves veulent des crêpes et 3 élèves veulent des gaufres. Quel est le rapport entre le nombre d'élèves qui veulent des crêpes et le nombre d'élèves qui veulent des gaufres ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(élèves qui veulent des crêpes) # 39, var2 = find(élèves qui veulent des gaufres) # 3, var3 = add(var1, var2), return(var1/var2) # 13

prompt: Paige had 2 pencils in her desk, 2 in her backpack and 15 at home. What's the difference between the number of pencils in Paige's backpack and at Paige's home?
summary: var1 = find(pencils in Paige's backpack) # 2, var2 = find(pencils at Paige's home) # 15, var1 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 15 - 2 = 13, return(var1) # 13
fr_prompt: Paige avait 2 crayons dans son bureau, 2 dans son sac à dos et 15 à la maison. Quelle est la différence entre le nombre de crayons dans le sac à dos de Paige et chez Paige ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(crayons dans le sac à dos de Paige) # 2, var2 = trouver(crayons chez Paige) # 15, var1 = soustraire(var2, var1), APPEL # 15 - 2 = 13, retour(var1) # 13

prompt: There are 270 students in a school. If the school has 5 students in each grades and each grade has the same number of studentsHow many grades are there in total?
summary: var1 = find(students in school) # 270, var2 = find(students in a grade) # 5, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 270 / 5 = 54, return(var3) # 54
fr_prompt: Il y a 270 élèves dans une école. Si l'école a 5 élèves dans chaque niveau et que chaque niveau a le même nombre d'élèves Combien y a-t-il de grammes au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(élèves à l'école) # 270, var2 = trouver(élèves d'une année) # 5, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 270 / 5 = 54, retour(var3) # 54

prompt: Karen is packing equal quantities of pretzels and crackers for snacks. Karen bags the pretzels in groups of 5 and the crackers in groups of 7. What is the smallest number of crackers that she can pack?
summary: var1 = find("pretzels group") # 5, var2 = find("crackers group") # 7, var3 = find_lcm(var1, var2) # LCM(5,7) = 35, return(var3) # 35
fr_prompt: Karen emballe des quantités égales de bretzels et de craquelins pour les collations. Karen emballe les bretzels par groupes de 5 et les craquelins par groupes de 7. Quel est le plus petit nombre de craquelins qu'elle peut emballer ?
fr_summary: var1 = find("bretzels group") # 5, var2 = find("crackers group") # 7, var3 = find_lcm(var1, var2) # LCM(5,7) = 35, return(var3) # 35

prompt: If you had 37 bags of cookies with 19 cookies in each bag, how many cookies would you have?
summary: var1 = find(bags of cookies) # 37, var2 = find(cookies per bag) # 19, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 37 * 19 = 703, return(var1) # 703

fr_summary: var1 = find(sacs de cookies) # 37, var2 = find(cookies par sac) # 19, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 37 * 19 = 703, return(var1) # 703

prompt: A store has forty-nine shirts. After selling some there were twenty-eight left. What's the difference between of the number of shirts before selling and after selling?
summary: var1 = find(Shirts before selling) # 49, var2 = find(Shirts left after selling) # 28, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 49 - 28 = 21, return(var1) # 21

prompt: Morgan has 65 red pens, 45 blue pens, and 58 black pens. How many pens does she have?
summary: var1 = find(Morgan red pens) # 65, var2 = find(Morgan blue pens) # 45, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 65 + 45 = 110, var2 = find(Morgan black pens) # 58, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 110 + 58 = 168, return(var1) # 168

summary: var1 = find(nails) #4, var2 = divide(var1, 2), CALL # 4 / 2 = 2, return(var2) #2

summary: var1 = find(total apples) # 14, var2 = find(bad apples) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 14 - 6 = 8, return(var3) # 8

summary: var1 = find(invitations in one pack) # 10, var2 = find(packs bought) # 7, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), var4 = find(invitations sent) # 2, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 10 * 7 = 70, 70 - 2 = 68, return(var5) # 68

prompt: Lenny has $84. He spent $24 on video games, and $21 at the grocery store. How much does Lenny have left?
summary: var1 = find(spent on video games) # 24, var2 = find(spent at grocery store) # 21, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 24 + 21 = 45, var4 = find(total money) # 84, var5 = subtract(var4, var3), CALL # 84 - 45 = 39, return(var5) # 39
fr_prompt: Lenny a 84 $. Il a dépensé 24 $ en jeux vidéo et 21 $ à l'épicerie. Combien reste-t-il à Lenny ?

prompt: There are 3300 bananas in Janice's banana collection. Janice also has 5 crayons. If the bananas are organized into 75 groups, how big is each group?
summary: var1 = find(bananas) # 3300, var2 = find(group size) # 75, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 3300 / 75 = 44, var4 = multiply(var3, var2), CALL # 44 * 75 = 3300, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 3300 - 3300 = 0, return(var3) # 44

summary: var1 = find(number of orange butterflies) # 20, var2 = find(total number of butterflies) # 33, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 33 - 20 = 13, return(var3) # 13

prompt: Kiara baked 30 oatmeal cookies and 48 chocolate chip cookies to package in plastic containers for her teacher friends at school. She wants to divide the cookies into identical containers so that each container has the same number of each kind of cookie. If she wants each container to have the greatest number of cookies possible, how many plastic containers does she need?
summary: var1 = find("oatmeal cookies") # 30, var2 = find("chocolate chip cookies") # 48, var3 = find_gcd(var1, var2) # GCD(30,48) = 6, return(var3) # 6

prompt: Matthew gave equal numbers of crackers and cakes to his 4 friends. If he had 10 crackers and 8 cakes initiallyHow many cakes did each person eat?
summary: var1 = find(total crackers) #10, var2 = subtract(var1, 4), CALL # 10 - 4 = 6, var3 = find(total cakes) #8, var4 = subtract(var3, 4), CALL # 8 - 4 = 4, var5 = divide(var4, 2), CALL # 4 / 2 = 2, return(var5) # 2

prompt: Katie spent a total $350.00 on her whole stay in the island. If she spent $125.00 on food and $135.00 on hotel rooms, how much did she spend on buying other stuff?
summary: var1 = find(total money spent) # 350, var2 = find(money spent on food) # 125, var3 = find(money spent on hotel rooms) # 135, var2 = add(var2, var3), CALL # 125 + 135 = 260, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 350 - 260 = 90, return(var1) # 90
fr_prompt: Katie a dépensé un total de 350,00 $ pour tout son séjour sur l'île. Si elle a dépensé 125,00 $ en nourriture et 135,00 $ en chambres d'hôtel, combien a-t-elle dépensé pour acheter d'autres choses ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(argent total dépensé) # 350, var2 = find(argent dépensé pour la nourriture) # 125, var3 = find(argent dépensé pour les chambres d'hôtel) # 135, var2 = add(var2, var3), CALL # 125 + 135 = 260, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 350 - 260 = 90, retour(var1) # 90

prompt: A video uploaded had 18 'up votes'. If the ratio of 'up votes' to 'down votes' was 9:2, how many 'down votes' did the video get?
summary: var1 = find(up votes) # 18, var2 = divide(var1, 9), var3 = multiply(var2, 2), CALL # (18 / 9) * 2 = 4, return(var3) # 4
fr_prompt: Une vidéo téléchargée avait 18 "votes positifs". Si le rapport entre les "votes favorables" et les "votes défavorables" était de 9:2, combien de "votes défavorables" la vidéo a-t-elle reçu ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (votes positifs) # 18, var2 = diviser (var1, 9), var3 = multiplier (var2, 2), APPEL # (18 / 9) * 2 = 4, retour (var3) # 4

prompt: Roger mowed his lawn 15 times total during the spring and summer. If he mowed it 9 times in the summer. How many times did he mow in the spring?
summary: var1 = find(total mows) # 15, var2 = find(summer mows) # 9, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 15 - 9 = 6, return(var3) # 6
fr_prompt: Roger a tondu sa pelouse 15 fois au total au printemps et en été. S'il l'a tondu 9 fois en été. Combien de fois a-t-il tondu au printemps ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(total mows) # 15, var2 = find(summer mows) # 9, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 15 - 9 = 6, return(var3) # 6

prompt: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. They have some sets of tables, each having the 3 chairs. If there are a total of 9 chairs in the backyardHow many sets of tables do they have?
summary: var1 = find(total chairs) # 9, var2 = find(chairs per set) # 3, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 9 / 3 = 3, return(var3) # 3
fr_prompt: Ils ont décidé d'organiser la fête dans leur jardin. Ils ont des ensembles de tables, chacune ayant les 3 chaises. S'il y a un total de 9 chaises dans le jardin, combien d'ensembles de tables ont-ils ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(total chaises) # 9, var2 = trouver(chaises par ensemble) # 3, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 9 / 3 = 3, retour(var3) # 3

prompt: Julia played tag with a total of 18 kids. She played with 4 kids on monday and yet with some more kids on tuesday.How many kids did she play with on tuesday?
summary: var1 = find(total kids) # 18, var2 = find(Monday's kids) # 4, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 18 - 4 = 14, return(var3) # 14
fr_prompt: Julia a joué avec un total de 18 enfants. Elle a joué avec 4 enfants le lundi et encore avec d'autres enfants le mardi. Avec combien d'enfants a-t-elle joué mardi ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (enfants totaux) # 18, var2 = trouver (enfants du lundi) # 4, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 18 - 4 = 14, retour (var3) # 14

prompt: Kevin collected toys to use as prizes at the fair. He collected 14 stuffed animals. He also collected 18 frisbees and several yo-yos. Kevin has 50 prizes in all. How many yo-yos did Kevin collect?
summary: var1 = find(stuffed animals) # 14, var2 = find(frisbees) # 18, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 14 + 18 = 32, var4 = subtract(50, var3), CALL # 50 - 32 = 18, return(var4) # 18
fr_prompt: Kevin a collecté des jouets à utiliser comme prix à la foire. Il a collectionné 14 animaux en peluche. Il a également récolté 18 frisbees et plusieurs yo-yos. Kevin a 50 prix en tout. Combien de yo-yos Kevin a-t-il collectés ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(animaux en peluche) # 14, var2 = find(frisbees) # 18, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 14 + 18 = 32, var4 = subtract(50, var3), CALL # 50 - 32 = 18, retour(var4) # 18

prompt: Zachary did 51 push-ups and David did 44 push-ups in gym class today.How many more push-ups did Zachary do than David?
summary: var1 = find(push-ups Zachary did) # 51, var2 = find(push-ups David did) # 44, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 51 - 44 = 7, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: Zachary a fait 51 pompes et David en a fait 44 en cours de gym aujourd'hui. Combien de pompes Zachary a-t-il faites de plus que David ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(les pompes que Zachary a faites) # 51, var2 = trouver(les pompes que David a faites) # 44, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 51 - 44 = 7, retour(var3) # 7

prompt: Jerry was weighing boxes for moving. The first was 2 pounds, the second was 11 pounds and the last was 5 pounds. What is the combined weight of all three boxes?
summary: var1 = find(first box weight) # 2, var2 = find(second box weight) # 11, var3 = find(third box weight) # 5, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 11 = 13, var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 13 + 5 = 18, return(var5) # 18
fr_prompt: Jerry pesait des cartons pour le déménagement. Le premier pesait 2 livres, le second 11 livres et le dernier 5 livres. Quel est le poids combiné des trois boîtes ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (poids de la première boîte) # 2, var2 = trouver (poids de la deuxième boîte) # 11, var3 = trouver (poids de la troisième boîte) # 5, var4 = ajouter (var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 11 = 13, var5 = ajouter(var4, var3), APPEL # 13 + 5 = 18, retour(var5) # 18

prompt: If Simon needs to make 519 gift bags at a rate of 42 bags per day, how many gift bags will he make on the last day?
summary: var1 = find(gift bags required) # 519, var2 = find(gift bags per day) # 42, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 519 / 42 = 12.33, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(12.33) = 12, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 42 * 12 = 504, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 519 - 504 = 15, return(var5) # 15
fr_prompt: Si Simon doit fabriquer 519 sacs-cadeaux à raison de 42 sacs-cadeaux par jour, combien de sacs-cadeaux fabriquera-t-il le dernier jour ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(sacs-cadeaux requis) # 519, var2 = find(sacs-cadeaux par jour) # 42, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 519 / 42 = 12.33, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(12.33) = 12, var4 = multiplier(var2, var3), CALL # 42 * 12 = 504, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 519 - 504 = 15, return(var5) # 15

prompt: A grocery store had 36 apples, 80 bottles of regular soda and 54 bottles of diet soda.How many more bottles than apple did they have?
summary: var1 = find(apples) #36, var2 = add(80, 54), CALL # 80 + 54 = 134, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 134 - 36 = 98, return(var3) # 98
fr_prompt: Une épicerie avait 36 ​​pommes, 80 bouteilles de soda ordinaire et 54 bouteilles de soda light. Combien y avait-il de bouteilles de plus que de pommes ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(pommes) #36, var2 = ajouter(80, 54), CALL # 80 + 54 = 134, var3 = soustraire(var2, var1), CALL # 134 - 36 = 98, return(var3) # 98

prompt: Baker made 62 cakes. Then he made 149 more cakes. He sold 144 of them.How many cakes would baker still have?
summary: var1 = find(cakes made initially) # 62, var2 = find(cakes made later) # 149, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(cakes sold) # 144, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 62 + 149 = 211, 211 - 144 = 67, return(var5) # 67
fr_prompt: Baker a fait 62 gâteaux. Puis il a fait 149 autres gâteaux. Il en a vendu 144. Combien de gâteaux le boulanger aurait-il encore ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(gâteaux faits initialement) # 62, var2 = trouver(gâteaux faits plus tard) # 149, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(gâteaux vendus) # 144, var5 = soustraire(var3, var4), APPEL # 62 + 149 = 211, 211 - 144 = 67, retour (var5) # 67

prompt: A school has 485 pupils. There are 232 girls and the rest are boys.How many boys are there in that school?
summary: var1 = find(Pupils in school) # 485, var2 = find(Girls in school) # 232, var1 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 485 - 232 = 253, return(var1) # 253
fr_prompt: Une école compte 485 élèves. Il y a 232 filles et le reste sont des garçons. Combien y a-t-il de garçons dans cette école ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Élèves à l'école) # 485, var2 = find(Filles à l'école) # 232, var1 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 485 - 232 = 253, return(var1) # 253

prompt: 53 campers went rowing in the morning 48 campers went rowing in the afternoon and 49 campers went rowing in the evening.How many more campers went rowing in the morning than in the evening?
summary: var1 = find(morning campers) # 53, var2 = find(evening campers) # 49, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 53 - 49 = 4, return(var3) # 4
fr_prompt: 53 campeurs ont ramé le matin 48 campeurs ont ramé l'après-midi et 49 campeurs ont ramé le soir. Combien de campeurs de plus ont ramé le matin que le soir ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(campeurs du matin) # 53, var2 = find(campeurs du soir) # 49, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 53 - 49 = 4, return(var3) # 4

prompt: The following week, they decided to go to Lake Huron and Lake Michigan. During their stay there, they caught a total of 30 pikes, 40 sturgeons and 75 herrings. How many fishes did they catch from the two lakes?
summary: var1 = find(pikes) # 30, var2 = find(sturgeons) # 40, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 30 + 40 = 70, var2 = find(herrings) # 75, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 70 + 75 = 145, return(var1) # 145
fr_prompt: La semaine suivante, ils décident d'aller au lac Huron et au lac Michigan. Durant leur séjour là-bas, ils ont attrapé un total de 30 brochets, 40 esturgeons et 75 harengs. Combien de poissons ont-ils pêchés dans les deux lacs ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(brochets) # 30, var2 = trouver(esturgeons) # 40, var1 = ajouter(var1, var2), CALL # 30 + 40 = 70, var2 = trouver(harengs) # 75, var1 = ajouter(var1, var2), APPEL # 70 + 75 = 145, retour (var1) # 145

prompt: Joe, Susie's brother, collected all 94 trading cards scattered in his room and placed them in boxes. If a full box can hold a maximum of 8 cards, how many boxes were fully filled?
summary: var1 = find(trading cards) # 94, var2 = find(cards per box) # 8, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 94 / 8 = 11 with a remainder of 6, return(var1) # 11
fr_prompt: Joe, le frère de Susie, a rassemblé les 94 cartes à collectionner dispersées dans sa chambre et les a placées dans des boîtes. Si une boîte pleine peut contenir un maximum de 8 cartes, combien de boîtes ont été entièrement remplies ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(cartes à échanger) # 94, var2 = trouver(cartes par boîte) # 8, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 94 / 8 = 11 avec un reste de 6, retour(var1) # 11

prompt: Noah made 12 kg of trail mix for his family's hiking trip. His family ate 8600 g of the trail mix on the hiking trip. How many grams of trail mix did Noah have left?
summary: var1 = find(trail mix made) # 12 kg, var2 = convert(var1, g), CALL # 12 kg * 1000 g/kg = 12000 g, var3 = find(trail mix eaten) # 8600 g, var4 = subtract(var2, var3), CALL # 12000 g - 8600 g = 3400 g, return(var4) # 3400 g
fr_prompt: Noah a préparé 12 kg de mélange montagnard pour la randonnée de sa famille. Sa famille a mangé 8600 g de mélange montagnard lors de la randonnée. Combien de grammes de mélange montagnard restait-il à Noah ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(mélange montagnard fait) # 12 kg, var2 = convertir(var1, g), CALL # 12 kg * 1000 g/kg = 12000 g, var3 = trouver(mélange montagnard consommé) # 8600 g, var4 = soustraire( var2, var3), APPEL # 12000 g - 8600 g = 3400 g, retour(var4) # 3400 g

prompt: Kelly has 22 nintendo games.How many does she need to buy so that she will have 140 games left?
summary: var1 = find(needed games) #140, var2 = subtract(var1, 22), CALL # 140 - 22 = 118, return(var2) # 118
fr_prompt: Kelly a 22 jeux nintendo. Combien doit-elle en acheter pour qu'il lui reste 140 jeux ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(jeux nécessaires) #140, var2 = soustraire(var1, 22), CALL # 140 - 22 = 118, return(var2) # 118

prompt: 86 students are going hiking. Each school- bus can take 9 students. How many students are left?
summary: var1 = find(students) # 86, var2 = find(students per bus) # 9, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 86 / 9 = 9.56, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(9.56) = 9, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 9 * 9 = 81, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 86 - 81 = 5, return(var5) # 5
fr_prompt: 86 élèves partent en randonnée. Chaque autobus scolaire peut transporter 9 élèves. Combien reste-t-il d'élèves ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(élèves) # 86, var2 = trouver(élèves par bus) # 9, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 86 / 9 = 9.56, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(9.56 ) = 9, var4 = multiplier (var2, var3), APPEL # 9 * 9 = 81, var5 = soustraire (var1, var4), APPEL # 86 - 81 = 5, retour (var5) # 5

prompt: 3 birds and 4 storks were sitting on the fence. 2 more birds came to join them.How many more birds than storks are sitting on the fence?
summary: var1 = find(birds) #3, var2 = find(storks) #4, var3 = find(birds joined) #2, var4 = add(var1, var3), CALL # 3 + 2 = 5, var5 = subtract(var4, var2), CALL # 5 - 4 = 1, return(var5) # 1
fr_prompt: 3 oiseaux et 4 cigognes étaient assis sur la clôture. 2 autres oiseaux sont venus les rejoindre. Combien d'oiseaux de plus que de cigognes sont assis sur la clôture ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(oiseaux) #3, var2 = trouver(cigognes) #4, var3 = trouver(oiseaux joints) #2, var4 = ajouter(var1, var3), CALL # 3 + 2 = 5, var5 = soustraire(var4 , var2), APPEL # 5 - 4 = 1, retour(var5) # 1

prompt: Austin is putting stickers in a sticker book. He put 8 stickers on the first page, 16 stickers on the second page, 24 stickers on the third page, and 32 stickers on the fourth page. If this pattern continues, how many stickers will Austin put on the fifth page?
summary: var1 = find(stickers on 1st page) # 8, var2 = find(stickers added per page) # 8, var3 = find(number of pages) # 5, var2 = multiply(var2, var3), var1 = add(var1, var2), return(var1) # 40
fr_prompt: Austin met des autocollants dans un livre d'autocollants. Il a mis 8 autocollants sur la première page, 16 autocollants sur la deuxième page, 24 autocollants sur la troisième page et 32 ​​autocollants sur la quatrième page. Si ce modèle continue, combien d'autocollants Austin mettra-t-il sur la cinquième page ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(autocollants sur la 1ère page) # 8, var2 = trouver(autocollants ajoutés par page) # 8, var3 = trouver(nombre de pages) # 5, var2 = multiplier(var2, var3), var1 = ajouter(var1, var2), retour(var1) # 40

prompt: 15 students split 122 portfolios of paintings. Each student should get the same number of portfolios. How many portfolios of paintings will each of them get?
summary: var1 = find(portfolios) # 122, var2 = find(students) # 15, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 122 / 15 = 8.13, var3 = round(var3), CALL # round(8.13) = 8, return(var3) # 8
fr_prompt: 15 étudiants se sont répartis 122 portfolios de peintures. Chaque élève doit recevoir le même nombre de portfolios. Combien de portfolios de peintures chacun recevra-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(portfolios) # 122, var2 = find(students) # 15, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 122 / 15 = 8.13, var3 = round(var3), CALL # round(8.13) = 8 , retour(var3) # 8

prompt: The Razorback shop makes $ 115 dollars off each jersey and $ 25 off each t-shirt. During the Arkansas and Texas tech game they sold 113 t-shirts and 78 jerseys.How much more does a jersey cost than a t-shirt?
summary: var1 = find(earnings per jersey) # 115, var2 = find(earnings per t-shirt) # 25, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 115 - 25 = 90, return(var3) # 90

fr_summary: var1 = find(gains par maillot) # 115, var2 = find(gains par t-shirt) # 25, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 115 - 25 = 90, return(var3) # 90

prompt: Haley bought 11 new shirts for school. If she returned 6 of them, how many did she end up with?
summary: var1 = find(shirts bought) # 11, var2 = find(shirts returned) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 6 = 5, return(var3) # 5

fr_summary: var1 = find(chemises achetées) # 11, var2 = find(chemises retournées) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 6 = 5, return(var3) # 5

prompt: In a school there are 315 girls and 309 boys. There are also 772 teachersHow many people are there in that school?
summary: var1 = find(Girls) # 315, var2 = find(Boys) # 309, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 315 + 309 = 624, var4 = find(Teachers) # 772, var5 = add(var3, var4), CALL # 624 + 772 = 1396, return(var5) # 1396
fr_prompt: Dans une école, il y a 315 filles et 309 garçons. Il y a aussi 772 enseignants. Combien y a-t-il de personnes dans cette école ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Girls) # 315, var2 = find(Boys) # 309, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 315 + 309 = 624, var4 = find(Teachers) # 772, var5 = add(var3, var4), APPEL # 624 + 772 = 1396, retour (var5) # 1396

prompt: Cindy had 41 pieces of candy. She ate six pieces in the morning, and twelve more pieces in the afternoon. How many pieces of candy does she have left?
summary: var1 = find(Cindy had candy) # 41, var2 = find(candy eaten in the morning) # 6, var3 = find(candy eaten in the afternoon) # 12, var4 = add(var2, var3), var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 41 - (6 + 12) = 41 - 18 = 23, return(var5) # 23
fr_prompt: Cindy avait 41 bonbons. Elle mangeait six morceaux le matin et douze autres morceaux l'après-midi. Combien lui reste-t-il de bonbons ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(Cindy avait des bonbons) # 41, var2 = trouver(bonbons mangés le matin) # 6, var3 = trouver(bonbons mangés l'après-midi) # 12, var4 = ajouter(var2, var3), var5 = soustraire( var1, var4), APPEL # 41 - (6 + 12) = 41 - 18 = 23, retour (var5) # 23

prompt: The first act included 5 clown mobiles, each stuffed with 28 clowns. How many clowns are inside all the clown mobiles combined?
summary: var1 = find(clowns per mobile) # 28, var2 = find(number of mobiles) # 5, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 28 * 5 = 140, return(var1) # 140
fr_prompt: Le premier acte comprenait 5 mobiles de clown, chacun rempli de 28 clowns. Combien y a-t-il de clowns dans tous les mobiles de clown combinés ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(clowns par mobile) # 28, var2 = find(nombre de mobiles) # 5, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 28 * 5 = 140, return(var1) # 140

prompt: Each pack of dvds costs 76 dollars. If there is a discount of 25 dollars on each packHow much do you have to pay to buy each pack?
summary: var1 = find(cost of dvds) # 76, var2 = find(discount amount) # 25, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 76 - 25 = 51, return(var1) # 51

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(coût des DVD) # 76, var2 = trouver(montant de la remise) # 25, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 76 - 25 = 51, retour(var1) # 51

prompt: At a candy store, there are 3 brown candy boxes, 3 black candy boxes, and 2 blue candy boxes. If 5 boxes are bought, how many candy boxes are left?
summary: var1 = find(brown boxes) # 3, var2 = find(black boxes) # 3, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 3 + 3 = 6, var4 = find(blue boxes) # 2, var5 = add(var3, var4), CALL # 6 + 2 = 8, var6 = find(boxes bought) # 5, var7 = subtract(var5, var6), CALL # 8 - 5 = 3, return(var7) # 3
fr_prompt: Dans un magasin de bonbons, il y a 3 boîtes de bonbons brunes, 3 boîtes de bonbons noires et 2 boîtes de bonbons bleues. Si 5 boîtes sont achetées, combien de boîtes de bonbons reste-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(boîtes brunes) # 3, var2 = trouver(boîtes noires) # 3, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), CALL # 3 + 3 = 6, var4 = trouver(boîtes bleues) # 2, var5 = ajouter (var3, var4), CALL # 6 + 2 = 8, var6 = find(boxes achetées) # 5, var7 = subtract(var5, var6), CALL # 8 - 5 = 3, return(var7) # 3

prompt: Henry and Margo both began traveling around a circular track. Henry is riding his bike, and Margo is walking. It takes Henry 7 minutes to make it all the way around, and Margo takes 12 minutes. How much time will pass until they meet at the starting line?
summary: var1 = find(Henry takes 7 minutes to make it all the way around) # 7, var2 = find(Margo takes 12 minutes) # 12, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(7,12) = 84, return(var3) # 84
fr_prompt: Henry et Margo ont tous deux commencé à voyager autour d'une piste circulaire. Henry fait du vélo et Margo marche. Il faut 7 minutes à Henry pour faire tout le tour et 12 minutes à Margo. Combien de temps s'écoulera-t-il jusqu'à ce qu'ils se rencontrent sur la ligne de départ ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Henry prend 7 minutes pour faire tout le tour) # 7, var2 = find(Margo prend 12 minutes) # 12, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(7,12) = 84 , retour(var3) # 84

prompt: Faye was cutting out some fabric for a friend. She cut a piece that was 3 centimeters wide and had an area of 24 square centimeters. How long was the piece?
summary: var1 = find(area) # 24, var2 = find(width) # 3, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 24 / 3 = 8, return(var3) # 8
fr_prompt: Faye découpait du tissu pour une amie. Elle a coupé un morceau de 3 centimètres de large et avait une superficie de 24 centimètres carrés. Combien de temps a duré la pièce ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(aire) # 24, var2 = trouver(largeur) # 3, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 24 / 3 = 8, retour(var3) # 8

prompt: Daniel and his brother Ben went to their grandfather's farm for a few weeks of vacation. During their stay at the farm, they were asked to take care of the animals. One day, his grandfather asked if he could count the total number of sheep that they have. If there are 3 herds of sheep and each herd has 20 sheep, how many sheep do they have in total?
summary: var1 = find(number of herds) # 3, var2 = find(number of sheep per herd) # 20, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 3 * 20 = 60, return(var1) # 60
fr_prompt: Daniel et son frère Ben sont allés à la ferme de leur grand-père pour quelques semaines de vacances. Pendant leur séjour à la ferme, on leur a demandé de s'occuper des animaux. Un jour, son grand-père lui a demandé s'il pouvait compter le nombre total de moutons qu'ils avaient. S'il y a 3 troupeaux de moutons et que chaque troupeau compte 20 moutons, combien de moutons ont-ils au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre de troupeaux) # 3, var2 = find(nombre de moutons par troupeau) # 20, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 3 * 20 = 60, return(var1) # 60

prompt: There are 141 pots. Each pot has 71 flowers and 91 sticks in it.How many flowers are there in all?
summary: var1 = find(flowers in a pot) #71, var2 = multiply(var1, 141), CALL # 71 * 141 = 10011, return(var2) # 10011
fr_prompt: Il y a 141 pots. Chaque pot contient 71 fleurs et 91 bâtons. Combien y a-t-il de fleurs en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(fleurs dans un pot) #71, var2 = multiplier(var1, 141), CALL # 71 * 141 = 10011, return(var2) # 10011

prompt: Ava bagged the plastic bottles after a recycling drive. She placed 45 bottles in the first bag, 53 bottles in the second bag, 61 bottles in the third bag, and 69 bottles in the fourth bag. If this pattern continues, how many plastic bottles will Ava put in the fifth bag?
summary: var1 = find("bottles in the first bag") # 45, var2 = find("bottles in the second bag") # 53, var3 = find("bottles in the third bag") # 61, var4 = find("bottles in the fourth bag") # 69, var5 = add(var4, 8) # 69 + 8 = 77, return(var5) # 77
fr_prompt: Ava a mis les bouteilles en plastique dans un sac après une campagne de recyclage. Elle a placé 45 bouteilles dans le premier sac, 53 bouteilles dans le deuxième sac, 61 bouteilles dans le troisième sac et 69 bouteilles dans le quatrième sac. Si cette tendance continue, combien de bouteilles en plastique Ava mettra-t-elle dans le cinquième sac ?
fr_summary: var1 = find("bouteilles dans le premier sac") # 45, var2 = find("bouteilles dans le deuxième sac") # 53, var3 = find("bouteilles dans le troisième sac") # 61, var4 = find(" bouteilles dans le quatrième sac") # 69, var5 = add(var4, 8) # 69 + 8 = 77, return(var5) # 77

prompt: Isha's pencil is 12 cubes long. If she gets another pencil that is 12 cubes long, how many cubes long are both pencils?
summary: var1 = find(pencil is cubes long) # 12, var2 = find(another pencil is cubes long) # 12, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 12 + 12 = 24, return(var3) # 24
fr_prompt: Le crayon d'Isha mesure 12 cubes de long. Si elle prend un autre crayon de 12 cubes de long, combien de cubes font les deux crayons ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (le crayon est long de cubes) # 12, var2 = trouver (un autre crayon est long de cubes) # 12, var3 = ajouter (var1, var2), APPEL # 12 + 12 = 24, retour (var3) # 24

prompt: 44 campers went rowing in the morning 39 campers went rowing in the afternoon and 31 campers went rowing in the evening.How many more campers went rowing in the morning than in the afternoon?
summary: var1 = find(Morning campers) # 44, var2 = find(Afternoon campers) # 39, var1 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 44 - 39 = 5, return(var1) # 5
fr_prompt: 44 campeurs ont ramé le matin 39 campeurs ont ramé l'après-midi et 31 campeurs ont ramé le soir. Combien de campeurs de plus ont ramé le matin que l'après-midi ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Campeurs du matin) # 44, var2 = find(Campeurs de l'après-midi) # 39, var1 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 44 - 39 = 5, return(var1) # 5

prompt: Paul and Vinnie deliver newspapers. Paul made $14 in tips. Vinnie made $16 more than Paul. How much did Vinnie make?
summary: var1 = find(Paul tips) # 14, var2 = add(var1, 16), CALL # 14 + 16 = 30, return(var2) # 30
fr_prompt: Paul et Vinnie livrent des journaux. Paul a fait 14 $ en pourboires. Vinnie a gagné 16 $ de plus que Paul. Combien a gagné Vinnie ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(conseils Paul) # 14, var2 = ajouter(var1, 16), APPEL # 14 + 16 = 30, retour(var2) # 30

prompt: Being his favorite, Michael has 4 times more flying robots than Tom. If Tom has 3 flying robots, how many flying robots does Michael have?
summary: var1 = find(Tom flying robots) # 3, var2 = find(ratio of flying robots between Michael and Tom) # 4, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 3 * 4 = 12, return(var1) # 12
fr_prompt: Étant son préféré, Michael a 4 fois plus de robots volants que Tom. Si Tom a 3 robots volants, combien de robots volants Michel a-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Tom robots volants) # 3, var2 = find(ratio de robots volants entre Michael et Tom) # 4, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 3 * 4 = 12, return(var1) # 12

prompt: John threw a Halloween party where 13 people showed up. If only 6 dressed up, how many people didn't wear costumes?
summary: var1 = find(total guests) # 13, var2 = find(guests in costume) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 13 - 6 = 7, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: John a organisé une fête d'Halloween où 13 personnes se sont présentées. S'il n'y avait que 6 personnes habillées, combien de personnes ne portaient pas de costumes ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre total d'invités) # 13, var2 = find(invités en costume) # 6, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 13 - 6 = 7, return(var3) # 7

prompt: Amy had 2 dollars. If she got 13 more dollars for doing chores and 3 more for her birthday, how much money does she have now?
summary: var1 = find(starting dollars) # 2, var2 = find(dollars from chores) # 13, var3 = find(dollars from birthday) # 3, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 13 = 15, var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 15 + 3 = 18, return(var5) # 18
fr_prompt: Amy avait 2 dollars. Si elle a reçu 13 dollars de plus pour ses tâches ménagères et 3 de plus pour son anniversaire, combien d'argent a-t-elle maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(dollars de départ) # 2, var2 = find(dollars des corvées) # 13, var3 = find(dollars de l'anniversaire) # 3, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 13 = 15, var5 = ajouter(var4, var3), APPEL # 15 + 3 = 18, retour(var5) # 18

prompt: The cafeteria had fifty-one apples. For lunch they handed out forty-one to students and decided to use the rest to make pies. If each pie takes five apples, how many pies could they make?
summary: var1 = find(apples) # 51, var2 = find(apples handed out) # 41, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 51 - 41 = 10, var2 = find(apples per pie) # 5, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 10 / 5 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: La cafétéria avait cinquante et une pommes. Pour le déjeuner, ils en ont distribué quarante et un aux étudiants et ont décidé d'utiliser le reste pour faire des tartes. Si chaque tarte prend cinq pommes, combien de tartes pourraient-ils faire ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(pommes) # 51, var2 = trouver(pommes distribuées) # 41, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 51 - 41 = 10, var2 = trouver(pommes par tarte) # 5, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 10 / 5 = 2, retour(var3) # 2

prompt: There are 4 boys and 5 girls in a preschool daycare. How many children are there in the daycare?
summary: var1 = find(boys) # 4, var2 = find(girls) # 5, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 5 = 9, return(var3) # 9
fr_prompt: Il y a 4 garçons et 5 filles dans une garderie préscolaire. Combien y a-t-il d'enfants à la garderie ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(garçons) # 4, var2 = trouver(filles) # 5, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), APPEL # 4 + 5 = 9, retour(var3) # 9

prompt: Yoda Soda is the intergalactic party drink that will have all your friends saying, "Mmmmmm, good this is!" You are throwing a party, and you need 5 liters of Yoda Soda for every 12 guests. If you have 36 guests, how many liters of Yoda Soda do you need?
summary: var1 = find(number of guests) # 36, var2 = find(liters for each 12 guests) # 5, var3 = divide(var1, 12), var4 = multiply(var3, var2), return(var4) # 15
fr_prompt: Yoda Soda est la boisson de fête intergalactique qui fera dire à tous vos amis : "Mmmmmm, c'est bon !" Vous organisez une fête et vous avez besoin de 5 litres de Yoda Soda pour 12 invités. Si vous avez 36 invités, de combien de litres de Yoda Soda avez-vous besoin ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre d'invités) # 36, var2 = find(litres pour 12 invités) # 5, var3 = diviser(var1, 12), var4 = multiplier(var3, var2), return(var4) # 15

prompt: Beth has 4 packs of crayons. Each pack has 10 crayons in it. She also has 6 extra crayons. How many crayons does Beth have altogether?
summary: var1 = find(packs of crayons) # 4, var2 = find(crayons per pack) # 10, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 4 * 10 = 40, var2 = find(extra crayons) # 6, var3 = add(var3, var2), CALL # 40 + 6 = 46, return(var3) # 46
fr_prompt: Beth a 4 paquets de crayons. Chaque paquet contient 10 crayons de couleur. Elle a également 6 crayons supplémentaires. Combien de crayons Beth a-t-elle en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(paquets de crayons) # 4, var2 = trouver(crayons par paquet) # 10, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 4 * 10 = 40, var2 = trouver(crayons supplémentaires) # 6, var3 = ajouter(var3, var2), APPEL # 40 + 6 = 46, retour(var3) # 46

prompt: David did 40 more push-ups but 17 less crunches than Zachary in gym class today. If Zachary did 34 push-ups and 62 crunchesHow many crunches did David do?
summary: var1 = find(Zachary push-ups) # 34, var2 = find(push-up difference) # 40, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(Zachary crunches) # 62, var5 = find(crunch difference) # 17, var6 = subtract(var4, var5), CALL # 62 - 17 = 45, return(var6) # 45
fr_prompt: David a fait 40 pompes de plus mais 17 abdominaux de moins que Zachary en cours de gym aujourd'hui. Si Zachary a fait 34 pompes et 62 crunchs, combien de crunchs David a-t-il fait ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Zachary push-ups) # 34, var2 = find(push-up difference) # 40, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(Zachary crunches) # 62, var5 = find(crunch difference) # 17, var6 = soustraire(var4, var5), APPEL # 62 - 17 = 45, retour(var6) # 45

prompt: Debby was placing her spare change into stacks. One stack had 4 coins and the other had 8. How many coins did she have total?
summary: var1 = find(stack 1) # 4, var2 = find(stack 2) # 8, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 8 = 12, return(var3) # 12
fr_prompt: Debby plaçait sa petite monnaie dans des piles. Une pile avait 4 pièces et l'autre en avait 8. Combien de pièces avait-elle au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(pile 1) # 4, var2 = trouver(pile 2) # 8, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), APPEL # 4 + 8 = 12, retour(var3) # 12

prompt: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 6 cups of sugar and 9 cups of flour. She already put in 2 cups of flour.How many more cups of flour than cups of sugar does she need to add now?
summary: var1 = find(cups of sugar called for) # 6, var2 = find(total cups of flour called for) # 9, var3 = find(cups of flour already added) # 2, var4 = subtract(var2, var3), var5 = subtract(var4, var1), CALL # 9 - 2 = 7, 7 - 6 = 1, return(var5) # 1
fr_prompt: Marie prépare un gâteau. La recette demande 6 tasses de sucre et 9 tasses de farine. Elle a déjà mis 2 tasses de farine. Combien de tasses de farine de plus que de tasses de sucre doit-elle ajouter maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(tasses de sucre demandées) # 6, var2 = trouver(total de tasses de farine demandées) # 9, var3 = trouver(tasses de farine déjà ajoutées) # 2, var4 = soustraire(var2, var3), var5 = soustraire(var4, var1), APPEL # 9 - 2 = 7, 7 - 6 = 1, retour(var5) # 1

prompt: Frank had 33 pieces of candy. He lost 24 of them. If he put the remaining pieces into bags with 9 pieces in each bagHow many bags would he have?
summary: var1 = find(initial candies) # 33, var2 = find(candies lost) # 24, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = find(candies per bag) # 9, var5 = divide(var3, var4), CALL # (33 - 24) / 9 = 9 / 9 = 1, return(var5) # 1
fr_prompt: Frank avait 33 bonbons. Il en a perdu 24. S'il mettait les pièces restantes dans des sacs de 9 pièces dans chaque sac, combien de sacs aurait-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(bonbons initiaux) # 33, var2 = trouver(bonbons perdus) # 24, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(bonbons par sachet) # 9, var5 = diviser(var3, var4), CALL # (33 - 24) / 9 = 9 / 9 = 1, retour(var5) # 1

prompt: It is Buddy's first day at a new school and he is feeling very nervous. His day begins with some bacon and egg prepared by his mother. After eating and preparing, Buddy headed out to catch the school bus from the nearest bus stop. Including Buddy, there were 39 students that got on the bus during the first stop. If 29 more students got on the bus at the second stop, how many students are riding the bus?
summary: var1 = find(students at first stop) # 39, var2 = find(students at second stop) # 29, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 39 + 29 = 68, return(var1) # 68
fr_prompt: C'est le premier jour de Buddy dans une nouvelle école et il se sent très nerveux. Sa journée commence avec du bacon et des œufs préparés par sa mère. Après avoir mangé et préparé, Buddy est parti prendre le bus scolaire à l'arrêt de bus le plus proche. Y compris Buddy, il y avait 39 étudiants qui sont montés dans le bus lors du premier arrêt. Si 29 ​​élèves de plus sont montés dans le bus au deuxième arrêt, combien d'élèves prennent le bus ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(étudiants au premier arrêt) # 39, var2 = find(étudiants au deuxième arrêt) # 29, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 39 + 29 = 68, return(var1) # 68

prompt: During Halloween, she was able to get a lot of candies from trick or treating. She decided to give away some of them to the homeless kids nearby. If she has 60 candies and gave away 40, how many does she have left?
summary: var1 = find(total number of candies Wendy has) # 60, var2 = find(candies given away by Wendy) # 40, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 60 - 40 = 20, return(var1) # 20
fr_prompt: Pendant Halloween, elle a pu obtenir beaucoup de bonbons grâce à des tours ou à des friandises. Elle a décidé d'en donner quelques-uns aux enfants sans abri à proximité. Si elle a 60 bonbons et en a donné 40, combien lui en reste-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(nombre total de bonbons que Wendy a) # 60, var2 = trouver(bonbons donnés par Wendy) # 40, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 60 - 40 = 20, retour(var1) # 20

prompt: A book has 3 chapters. The first chapter is 66 pages long the second chapter is 35 pages long and the third chapter is 24 pages long.How many pages does the book have altogether?
summary: var1 = find(pages in chapter 1) #66, var2 = find(pages in chapter 2) #35, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 66 + 35 = 101, var4 = find(pages in chapter 3) #24, var5 = add(var3, var4), CALL # 101 + 24 = 125, return(var5) # 125
fr_prompt: Un livre comporte 3 chapitres. Le premier chapitre est long de 66 pages, le deuxième chapitre est long de 35 pages et le troisième chapitre est long de 24 pages. Combien de pages le livre a-t-il en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pages du chapitre 1) #66, var2 = find(pages du chapitre 2) #35, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 66 + 35 = 101, var4 = find(pages du chapitre 3) #24, var5 = ajouter(var3, var4), APPEL # 101 + 24 = 125, retour(var5) # 125

prompt: Five red peaches and 14 green peaches are in the basket. How many peaches are in the basket?
summary: var1 = find(red peaches) # 5, var2 = find(green peaches) # 14, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 14 = 19, return(var3) # 19
fr_prompt: Cinq pêches rouges et 14 pêches vertes sont dans le panier. Combien y a-t-il de pêches dans le panier ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pêches rouges) # 5, var2 = find(pêches vertes) # 14, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 14 = 19, return(var3) # 19

prompt: Mrs. Snyder made 86 heart cookies. She made 36 red cookies and the rest are pink. How many pink cookies did she make?
summary: var1 = find(Mrs. Snyder made heart cookies) # 86, var2 = find(Mrs. Snyder made red cookies) # 36, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 86 - 36 = 50, return(var3) # 50
fr_prompt: Mme Snyder a fait 86 biscuits en forme de cœur. Elle a fait 36 ​​biscuits rouges et le reste est rose. Combien de cookies roses a-t-elle fait ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (Mme Snyder a fait des biscuits au cœur) # 86, var2 = trouver (Mme Snyder a fait des biscuits rouges) # 36, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 86 - 36 = 50, retour (var3) # 50

prompt: The Ferris wheel in paradise park has some seats. Each seat can hold 9 people. If 18 people can ride the wheel at the same timeHow many seats does the Ferris wheel have?
summary: var1 = find(People) # 18, var2 = find(Seat capacity) # 9, var3 = div(var1, var2), CALL # 18 / 9 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: La grande roue du parc paradisiaque a quelques sièges. Chaque siège peut accueillir 9 personnes. Si 18 personnes peuvent monter sur la roue en même temps, combien de sièges la grande roue a-t-elle ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Personnes) # 18, var2 = find(Capacité en sièges) # 9, var3 = div(var1, var2), CALL # 18 / 9 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: There are 124 students making 3 stars each for the school wall. How many stars will they make all together?
summary: var1 = find(students) # 124, var2 = find(stars per student) # 3, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 124 * 3 = 372, return(var3) # 372

fr_summary: var1 = find(étudiants) # 124, var2 = find(étoiles par étudiant) # 3, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 124 * 3 = 372, return(var3) # 372

prompt: A fast food restaurant had ninety-nine hotdogs. After selling some they had ninety-seven left. How many hotdogs did they sell?
summary: var1 = find(total hotdogs) # 99, var2 = find(left hotdogs) # 97, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 99 - 97 = 2, return(var3) # 2

fr_summary: var1 = find(total hotdogs) # 99, var2 = find(left hotdogs) # 97, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 99 - 97 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: Sum of a number and 15 is 96. Find the number.
summary: var1 = find(sum) # 96, var2 = find(addend) # 15, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), return(var1) # 81

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(somme) # 96, var2 = trouver(additionner) # 15, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), retour(var1) # 81

prompt: In a school there are 632 girls and 410 boys. 465 more girls joined the school.How many more girls than boys does the school have?
summary: var1 = find(boys) #410, var2 = find(girls) #632, var3 = add(var2, 465), CALL # 632 + 465 = 1097, var4 = subtract(var3, var1), CALL # 1097 - 410 = 687, return(var4) # 687
fr_prompt: Dans une école, il y a 632 filles et 410 garçons. 465 filles de plus ont rejoint l'école. Combien de filles de plus que de garçons l'école compte-t-elle ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(garçons) #410, var2 = trouver(filles) #632, var3 = ajouter(var2, 465), APPEL # 632 + 465 = 1097, var4 = soustraire(var3, var1), APPEL # 1097 - 410 = 687, retour(var4) # 687

prompt: Debby had twelve pounds of flour. If she bought another four pounds, how many pounds would she have total?
summary: var1 = find(starting flour) # 12, var2 = find(new flour) # 4, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 12 + 4 = 16, return(var1) # 16
fr_prompt: Debby avait douze livres de farine. Si elle achetait encore quatre livres, combien de livres aurait-elle au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(farine de départ) # 12, var2 = find(nouvelle farine) # 4, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 12 + 4 = 16, return(var1) # 16

prompt: Paige was helping her mom plant flowers and together they planted 54 seeds. If they put 6 seeds in each flower bed, how many flower beds did they have?
summary: var1 = find(seeds) # 54, var2 = find(seeds per flower bed) # 6, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 54 / 6 = 9, return(var3) # 9

prompt: Cade had 87 marbles. He gave 8 to Dylan. How many does he have left?
summary: var1 = find(Cade had marbles) # 87, var2 = find(gave to Dylan) # 8, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 87 - 8 = 79, return(var3) # 79

fr_summary: var1 = trouver (Cade avait des billes) # 87, var2 = trouver (donné à Dylan) # 8, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 87 - 8 = 79, retour (var3) # 79

prompt: One day, Trent and his friends had lunch while sitting at tables of 2. Another day, they had lunch at tables of 8. What is the smallest number of people that could be in the group?
summary: var1 = find("tables of 2") # 2, var2 = find("tables of 8") # 8, var3 = find_lcm(var1, var2) # LCM(2,8) = 8, return(var3) # 8

prompt: Jake has 13 more apples and 17 fewer peaches than Steven. Steven has 8 peaches and 12 apples.How many apples does Jake have?
summary: var1 = find(Steven's apples) #12, var2 = add(var1, 13), CALL # 12 + 13 = 25, var3 = find(Steven's peaches) #8, var4 = subtract(var3, 17), CALL # 8 - 17 = -9, return(var2) #25
fr_prompt: Jacques a 13 pommes de plus et 17 pêches de moins que Steven. Steven a 8 pêches et 12 pommes. Combien de pommes Jacques a-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(Pommes de Steven) #12, var2 = ajouter(var1, 13), CALL # 12 + 13 = 25, var3 = trouver(Pêches de Steven) #8, var4 = soustraire(var3, 17), CALL # 8 - 17 = -9, retour(var2) #25

prompt: The Ferris wheel in paradise park has 2 small seats and 23 large seats. Each small seat can hold 14 people and large seat can hold 54 people.How many people can ride the Ferris wheel on small seats?

fr_prompt: La grande roue du parc paradisiaque a 2 petits sièges et 23 grands sièges. Chaque petit siège peut contenir 14 personnes et le grand siège peut contenir 54 personnes. Combien de personnes peuvent monter sur la grande roue sur de petits sièges ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(petits sièges) #2, var2 = multiplier(var1, 14), CALL # 2 * 14 = 28, return(var2) # 28

prompt: A florist needed to use 2 pounds of fertilizer for 9 days and then on the final day use the normal amount plus another 4 pounds. How many pounds of fertilizer will she use all together?
summary: var1 = find(fertilizer for 9 days) # 2, var2 = find(days) # 9, var1 = var1 * var2, CALL # 2 * 9 = 18, var2 = find(fertilizer for final day) # 4, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 18 + 4 = 22, return(var1) # 22
fr_prompt: Un fleuriste devait utiliser 2 livres d'engrais pendant 9 jours, puis le dernier jour, utiliser la quantité normale plus 4 livres supplémentaires. Combien de livres d'engrais utilisera-t-elle en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(engrais pour 9 jours) # 2, var2 = trouver(jours) # 9, var1 = var1 * var2, CALL # 2 * 9 = 18, var2 = trouver(engrais pour le dernier jour) # 4, var1 = ajouter (var1, var2), APPEL # 18 + 4 = 22, retour (var1) # 22

prompt: Marco and his dad went strawberry picking. Marco's strawberries weighed 15 pounds. If together their strawberries weighed 37 pounds.How much did his dad's strawberries weigh?
summary: var1 = find(Marco strawberries) # 15, var2 = find(total strawberries) # 37, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 37 - 15 = 22, return(var3) # 22
fr_prompt: Marco et son père sont allés cueillir des fraises. Les fraises de Marco pesaient 15 livres. Si ensemble leurs fraises pesaient 37 livres. Combien pesaient les fraises de son père ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Marco fraises) # 15, var2 = find(total fraises) # 37, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 37 - 15 = 22, return(var3) # 22

prompt: The third graders are having a fair. They have 90 tickets to sell. They sold 38 tickets the first week and 17 tickets the second week. How many tickets do they have left to sell?
summary: var1 = find(tickets to sell) # 90, var2 = subtract(var1, 38), CALL # 90 - 38 = 52, var3 = subtract(var2, 17), CALL # 52 - 17 = 35, return(var3) # 35
fr_prompt: Les élèves de troisième ont une foire. Ils ont 90 billets à vendre. Ils ont vendu 38 billets la première semaine et 17 billets la deuxième semaine. Combien de billets leur reste-t-il à vendre ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(tickets to sell) # 90, var2 = subtract(var1, 38), CALL # 90 - 38 = 52, var3 = subtract(var2, 17), CALL # 52 - 17 = 35, return(var3) # 35

prompt: Kristen found gift bags in packs of 12 and bows in packs of 5. If Kristen wanted to have the same number of gift bags as bows, what is the smallest number of gift bags she would have to buy?

fr_prompt: Kristen a trouvé des sacs-cadeaux en paquets de 12 et des nœuds en paquets de 5. Si Kristen voulait avoir le même nombre de sacs-cadeaux que de nœuds, quel serait le plus petit nombre de sacs-cadeaux qu'elle devrait acheter ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(sacs-cadeaux en paquets de 12) # 12, var2 = trouver(noeuds en paquets de 5) # 5, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(12,5) = 60, return(var3 ) # 60

prompt: Uncle Dave bought 143 ice cream sandwiches. If he wants to give them to his 11 hungry nieces, how many can each niece get?

prompt: Denise is getting older and feels like she should donate her collection of stuffed animals to children who are less fortunate. She has 14 stuffed cats and 7 stuffed dogs, which she wants to divide into identical groups, with no stuffed animals left over. What is the greatest number of groups Denise can place her stuffed animals into?

fr_prompt: Denise vieillit et pense qu'elle devrait faire don de sa collection d'animaux en peluche aux enfants moins fortunés. Elle a 14 chats en peluche et 7 chiens en peluche, qu'elle veut diviser en groupes identiques, sans animaux en peluche restants. fr_summary: var1 = trouver(chats en peluche) # 14, var2 = trouver(chiens en peluche) # 7, var3 = pgcd(var1, var2) # pgcd(14, 7) = 7, retour(var3) # 7

prompt: Jermaine saved $43 in March. He saved $19 in April and $16 in May. Then Jermaine spent $77 on a keyboard. How much money does Jermaine have left?
summary: var1 = find(March savings) # 43, var2 = find(April savings) # 19, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 43 + 19 = 62, var2 = find(May savings) # 16, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 62 + 16 = 78, var2 = find(keyboard cost) # 77, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 78 - 77 = 1, return(var3) # 1
fr_prompt: Jermaine a économisé 43 $ en mars. Il a économisé 19 $ en avril et 16 $ en mai. Puis Jermaine a dépensé 77 $ pour un clavier. Combien d'argent il reste à Jermaine ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Économies de mars) # 43, var2 = find(Économies d'avril) # 19, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 43 + 19 = 62, var2 = find(Économies de mai) # 16, var1 = add (var1, var2), CALL # 62 + 16 = 78, var2 = find(coût du clavier) # 77, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 78 - 77 = 1, return(var3) # 1

prompt: When Maria got to the fair she had $87. When she left she had $16. What's the difference between the number of dollars when Maria got and left the fair?
summary: var1 = find(Maria's dollars when got to fair) # 87, var2 = find(Maria's dollars when left the fair) # 16, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 87 - 16 = 71, return(var1) # 71

prompt: It is 78 miles to Grandma's house. Mr. Welch drove 35 miles. He stopped to buy a pie for dessert. Then he drove 18 miles and stopped to put gas in the car. How many more miles until he reaches Grandma's house?

prompt: Tim has a bag of 36 orange-flavoured sweets and Peter has a bag of 44 grape-flavoured sweets. They have to divide up the sweets into small trays with equal number of sweets; each tray containing either orange-flavoured or grape-flavoured sweets only. If there is no remainder, what is the largest possible number of sweets in each tray?
summary: var1 = find(36 orange-flavoured sweets) # 36, var2 = find(44 grape-flavoured sweets) # 44, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(36,44) = 4, var4 = var1/var3, var5 = var2/var3, return(var3) # 4

prompt: John had 33 socks. If he threw away 19 old ones that didn't fit and bought 13 new ones, how many socks would he have?

prompt: Kevin started his science test at 2:34 p.m. and finished the test 75 minutes later. Kevin has football practice at 4:15 p.m. How much time did Kevin have between the end of the test and the beginning of football practice?

prompt: Frank was reading through his favorite book. The book had 612 pages equally distributed over 24 chapters. It took Frank 6 days to finish the book.How many pages did he read per day?

prompt: A waiter had 3 customers. After some more arrived he had 8 customers.How many new customers arrived?

prompt: A restaurant added a new outdoor section that was 4 feet wide and 6 feet long. What is the area of their new outdoor section?
summary: var1 = find(width) # 4, var2 = find(length) # 6, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 4 * 6 = 24, return(var3) # 24
fr_prompt: Un restaurant a ajouté une nouvelle section extérieure de 4 pieds de large et 6 pieds de long. Quelle est la superficie de leur nouvelle section extérieure ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(largeur) # 4, var2 = trouver(longueur) # 6, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 4 * 6 = 24, retour(var3) # 24

prompt: Tayli wishes to advertise her business, so she gives packs of 13 red flyers to each restaurant owner and sets of 20 blue flyers to each clothing store owner. At the end of the day, Tayli realizes that she gave out the same number of red and blue flyers. What is the minimum number of flyers of each color she distributed?
summary: var1 = find(red flyers) # 13, var2 = find(blue flyers) # 20, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(13,20) = 260, return(var3) # 260
fr_prompt: Tayli souhaite faire de la publicité pour son entreprise, elle donne donc des packs de 13 flyers rouges à chaque restaurateur et des sets de 20 flyers bleus à chaque propriétaire de magasin de vêtements. À la fin de la journée, Tayli se rend compte qu'elle a distribué le même nombre de dépliants rouges et bleus. Quel est le nombre minimum de dépliants de chaque couleur qu'elle a distribué ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(flyers rouges) # 13, var2 = find(flyers bleus) # 20, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(13,20) = 260, return(var3) # 260

prompt: For Halloween Bianca received seventeen pieces of candy. She ate two pieces then placed the rest into piles with three in each pile. How many piles could she make?
summary: var1 = find(candy) # 17, var2 = find(candy eaten) # 2, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 17 - 2 = 15, var2 = find(candy per pile) # 3, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 15 / 3 = 5, return(var3) # 5
fr_prompt: Pour Halloween, Bianca a reçu dix-sept bonbons. Elle a mangé deux morceaux puis a placé le reste en tas avec trois dans chaque tas. Combien de piles pourrait-elle faire ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(bonbons) # 17, var2 = trouver(bonbons mangés) # 2, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), CALL # 17 - 2 = 15, var2 = trouver(bonbons par tas) # 3, var3 = diviser (var1, var2), APPEL # 15 / 3 = 5, retour (var3) # 5

prompt: Lawrence has 5504 marbles. If he shares them among 64 friends, how many marbles does each friend get?
summary: var1 = find(marbles) # 5504, var2 = find(friends) # 64, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 5504 / 64 = 86, var4 = multiply(var3, var2), CALL # 86 * 64 = 5504, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 5504 - 5504 = 0, return(var3) # 86
fr_prompt: Lawrence a 5504 billes. S'il les partage entre 64 amis, combien de billes chaque ami reçoit-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(billes) # 5504, var2 = trouver(amis) # 64, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 5504 / 64 = 86, var4 = multiplier(var3, var2), APPEL # 86 * 64 = 5504, var5 = soustraire(var1, var4), APPEL # 5504 - 5504 = 0, retour(var3) # 86

prompt: On the first Saturday of spring, Jane woke up early to enjoy the whole day and help with chores at home. Jane had been saving large empty cans to serve as pots for sunflowers. If she has 54 sunflower seeds and there are 9 cans, how many seeds will be placed in each can if she places an equal number of seeds in each can?
summary: var1 = find(sunflower seeds) # 54, var2 = find(cans) # 9, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 54 / 9 = 6, return(var1) # 6
fr_prompt: Le premier samedi du printemps, Jane s'est réveillée tôt pour profiter de toute la journée et aider aux tâches ménagères. Jane avait gardé de grandes boîtes de conserve vides pour servir de pots à tournesols. Si elle a 54 graines de tournesol et qu'il y a 9 boîtes, combien de graines seront placées dans chaque boîte si elle place un nombre égal de graines dans chaque boîte ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(graines de tournesol) # 54, var2 = find(boites) # 9, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 54 / 9 = 6, return(var1) # 6

prompt: Lucy went to the grocery store. She bought 4 packs of cookie, 22 packs of cake and 16 packs of chocolate.How many packs of groceries did she buy in all?
summary: var1 = find(packs of cookies) # 4, var2 = find(packs of cake) # 22, var3 = find(packs of chocolate) # 16, var4 = add(var1, var2, var3), CALL # 4 + 22 + 16 = 42, return(var4) # 42
fr_prompt: Lucy est allée à l'épicerie. Elle a acheté 4 paquets de biscuits, 22 paquets de gâteaux et 16 paquets de chocolat. Combien de paquets d'épicerie a-t-elle achetés en tout ?

prompt: Everyday I eat 3 servings of veggies. How many servings of veggies do I eat in one week?
summary: var1 = find(servings per day) # 3, var2 = find(days in a week) # 7, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 3 * 7 = 21, return(var3) # 21

prompt: Wendy is a very generous kid. Every time her parents buy her some stuff, she always gives some of it to her friends. For her birthday this year, she received a new set of shoes. She now has a total of 33 pairs of shoes. If she gave away 14 pairs of shoes to her friends, how many pairs of shoes were left to her?
summary: var1 = find(total number of shoes Wendy has) # 33, var2 = find(shoes given away by Wendy) # 14, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 33 - 14 = 19, return(var1) # 19
fr_prompt: Wendy est une enfant très généreuse. Chaque fois que ses parents lui achètent des trucs, elle en donne toujours à ses amis. Pour son anniversaire cette année, elle a reçu un nouvel ensemble de chaussures. Elle a maintenant un total de 33 paires de chaussures. Si elle a donné 14 paires de chaussures à ses amis, combien de paires de chaussures lui reste-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(nombre total de chaussures que Wendy a) # 33, var2 = trouver(chaussures données par Wendy) # 14, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 33 - 14 = 19, retour(var1) # 19

prompt: Mrs. Hilt has 6 pizzas. Each pizza has 6 slices. She sold one-fourth of the pizza slices. How many slices were left?
summary: var1 = find(pizzas) # 6, var2 = find(slices per pizza) # 6, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 6 * 6 = 36, var4 = divide(var3, 4), CALL # 36 / 4 = 9, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 36 - 9 = 27, return(var5) # 27
fr_prompt: Mme Hilt a 6 pizzas. Chaque pizza a 6 tranches. Elle a vendu un quart des tranches de pizza. Combien de tranches restait-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(pizzas) # 6, var2 = trouver(tranches par pizza) # 6, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 6 * 6 = 36, var4 = diviser(var3, 4), CALL # 36 / 4 = 9, var5 = soustraire(var3, var4), APPEL # 36 - 9 = 27, retour(var5) # 27

prompt: Sarah picked 45 apples. Her brother picked 9 apples. How many times as many apples did Sarah pick?
summary: var1 = find(Sarah apples) # 45, var2 = find(brother apples) # 9, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 45 / 9 = 5, return(var3) # 5

prompt: Hannah is a professional skater. She practices 8 hours every weekend. She practices 17 more hours than that during the week. How many hours does Hannah practice each week?
summary: var1 = find(hours practiced on weekends) # 8, var2 = add(var1, 17), CALL # 8 + 17 = 25, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 8 + 25 = 33, return(var3) # 33
fr_prompt: Hannah est une patineuse professionnelle. Elle pratique 8 heures chaque week-end. Elle pratique 17 heures de plus que cela pendant la semaine. Combien d'heures Hannah pratique-t-elle chaque semaine ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(heures pratiquées le week-end) # 8, var2 = add(var1, 17), CALL # 8 + 17 = 25, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 8 + 25 = 33, return(var3) #33

prompt: There were 53 dollars in Olivia's wallet. She collected 91 more dollars from an atm. After she visited a supermarket there were 14 dollars left.How much more money did she spend at the supermarket than she collected at the atm?
summary: initial = find(initial dollars in wallet) # 53, collected = find(collected dollars) # 91, total = add(initial, collected), CALL # 53 + 91 = 144, remaining = find(remaining dollars) # 14, spent = subtract(total, remaining), CALL # 144 - 14 = 130, difference = subtract(spent, collected), CALL # 130 - 91 = 39, return(difference) # 39
fr_prompt: Il y avait 53 dollars dans le portefeuille d'Olivia. Elle a collecté 91 dollars de plus à un guichet automatique. Après avoir visité un supermarché, il restait 14 dollars. Combien d'argent a-t-elle dépensé en plus au supermarché qu'elle n'en a récupéré au distributeur ?
fr_summary: initial = trouver (dollars initiaux dans le portefeuille) # 53, collecté = trouver (dollars collectés) # 91, total = ajouter (initial, collecté), CALL # 53 + 91 = 144, restant = trouver (dollars restants) # 14, dépensé = soustraire (total, restant), APPEL # 144 - 14 = 130, différence = soustraire (dépensé, collecté), APPEL # 130 - 91 = 39, retour (différence) # 39

prompt: Zachary did 51 push-ups in gym class today. David did 22 more push-ups than Zachary. John did 4 push-ups less than David.How many push-ups did John do?
summary: var1 = find(Zachary push-ups) #51, var2 = add(var1, 22), CALL # 51 + 22 = 73, var3 = subtract(var2, 4), CALL # 73 - 4 = 69, return(var3) #69
fr_prompt: Zachary a fait 51 pompes en cours de gym aujourd'hui. David a fait 22 pompes de plus que Zachary. Jean a fait 4 pompes de moins que David.Combien de pompes Jean a-t-il fait ?

prompt: 29 birds were sitting in a tree. Some more fly up to the tree. Then there were 42 birds in the tree. How many more flew up to the tree?

fr_prompt: 29 oiseaux étaient assis dans un arbre. D'autres volent jusqu'à l'arbre. Ensuite, il y avait 42 oiseaux dans l'arbre. Combien d'autres ont volé jusqu'à l'arbre ?

prompt: Baker made 81 cakes. Then he made 92 more cakes. He sold 46 of them.How many more cakes did baker make than those he sold?
summary: var1 = find(Initial cakes) # 81, var2 = find(Cakes added) # 92, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 81 + 92 = 173, var4 = find(Cakes sold) # 46, var5 = sub(var3, var4), CALL # 173 - 46 = 127, return(var5) # 127
fr_prompt: Baker a fait 81 gâteaux. Puis il a fait 92 autres gâteaux. Il en a vendu 46. Combien de gâteaux le boulanger a-t-il fait de plus que ceux qu'il a vendus ?

prompt: Rachel had to complete 7 pages of math homework. If she had to complete 4 more pages of math homework than reading homeworkHow many pages of reading homework did she have to complete?

summary: var1 = find(Kaleb's saved dollars) # 39, var2 = find(allowance dollars) # 25, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 39 + 25 = 64, var2 = find(toy price) # 8, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 64 / 8 = 8, return(var3) # 8

prompt: Their last stop before leaving the zoo is the bird museum. There, they went through 7 bird exhibits, spending 9 minutes going around each exhibit. How much time did they spend going through the museum?

prompt: A company buys 88 bureaus for 14 offices. If each office should get an equal number of bureaus, how many more bureaus are needed at least?
summary: var1 = find(bureaus) # 88, var2 = find(offices) # 14, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 88 / 14 = 6.28, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(6.28) = 6, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 14 * 6 = 84, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 88 - 84 = 4, var6 = subtract(var2, var5), CALL # 14 - 4 = 10, return(var6) # 10
fr_prompt: Une entreprise achète 88 bureaux pour 14 bureaux. Si chaque bureau doit avoir un nombre égal de bureaux, combien de bureaux supplémentaires sont nécessaires au moins ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(bureaux) # 88, var2 = find(offices) # 14, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 88 / 14 = 6.28, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(6.28) = 6, var4 = multiplier (var2, var3), CALL # 14 * 6 = 84, var5 = soustraire (var1, var4), CALL # 88 - 84 = 4, var6 = soustraire (var2, var5), CALL # 14 - 4 = 10, retour(var6) # 10

prompt: 2 beavers were working on their home. 1 went for a swim. How many beavers are still working on their home?

prompt: Ariel is making flower arrangements. He has 7 roses and 14 daisies. If Ariel wants to make all the arrangements identical and have no flowers left over, what is the greatest number of flower arrangements that he can make?
summary: var1 = find(roses) # 7, var2 = find(daisies) # 14, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(7,14) = 7, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: Ariel fait des compositions florales. Il a 7 roses et 14 marguerites. Si Ariel veut faire tous les arrangements identiques et qu'il ne reste plus de fleurs, quel est le plus grand nombre d'arrangements floraux qu'il peut faire ?

prompt: Kiera has 14 blue envelopes. She has 6 fewer yellow envelopes than blue envelopes. She has 3 times as many green envelopes as yellow envelopes. How many envelopes does Kiera have in all?
summary: var1 = find(blue envelopes) # 14, var2 = find(yellow envelopes) # 14 - 6 = 8, var3 = multiply(var2, 3), CALL # 8 * 3 = 24, var4 = add(var1, var2), var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 14 + 8 + 24 = 46, return(var5) # 46
fr_prompt: Kiera a 14 enveloppes bleues. Elle a 6 enveloppes jaunes de moins que d'enveloppes bleues. Elle a 3 fois plus d'enveloppes vertes que d'enveloppes jaunes. Combien d'enveloppes Kiera a-t-elle en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(enveloppes bleues) # 14, var2 = trouver(enveloppes jaunes) # 14 - 6 = 8, var3 = multiplier(var2, 3), CALL # 8 * 3 = 24, var4 = ajouter(var1, var2), var5 = ajouter(var4, var3), APPEL # 14 + 8 + 24 = 46, retour(var5) # 46

prompt: Victor and his friend were buying trick decks from the magic shop for eight dollars each. How much did they spend if Victor bought six decks and his friend bought two decks?
summary: var1 = find(Victor's decks) # 6, var2 = find(friend's decks) # 2, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 2 = 8, var2 = find(cost per deck) # 8, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 8 * 8 = 64, return(var3) # 64
fr_prompt: Victor et son ami achetaient des jeux de tours au magasin de magie pour huit dollars chacun. Combien ont-ils dépensé si Victor a acheté six jeux et que son ami en a acheté deux ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(decks de Victor) # 6, var2 = find(decks d'un ami) # 2, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 2 = 8, var2 = find(coût par deck) # 8, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 8 * 8 = 64, retour(var3) # 64

prompt: Robin drank seven bottles of water in the morning and seven in the afternoon. How many bottles did Robin drink total?
summary: var1 = find(morning bottles) # 7, var2 = find(afternoon bottles) # 7, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 7 + 7 = 14, return(var1) # 14
fr_prompt: Robin a bu sept bouteilles d'eau le matin et sept l'après-midi. Combien de bouteilles Robin a-t-il bu au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(bouteilles du matin) # 7, var2 = find(bouteilles de l'après-midi) # 7, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 7 + 7 = 14, return(var1) # 14

prompt: Trevor counted 77 coins in his bank. He counted 29 quarters. The rest are dimes. How many more coints of the total than quarts does Trevor have?
summary: var1 = find(total coins) # 77, var2 = find(quarters) # 29, var3 = subtract(var1, var2) # 77 - 29 = 48, return(var3) # 48

prompt: Sam and Carlos are bowling with plastic pins in Sam's living room. Remarkably, Sam knocks down 8 pins on every bowl, and Carlos knocks down 9 pins on every bowl. At the end of the day, Sam and Carlos have knocked down the same total number of pins. What is the least number of total pins that Sam and Carlos could have each knocked down?
summary: var1 = find(Sam knocks down) # 8, var2 = find(Carlos knocks down) # 9, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(8,9) = 72, return(var3) # 72

À la fin de la journée, Sam et Carlos ont abattu le même nombre total de quilles. Quel est le plus petit nombre total de quilles que Sam et Carlos auraient pu faire tomber chacun ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Sam renverse) # 8, var2 = find(Carlos renverse) # 9, var3 = lcm(var1,var2), CALL # lcm(8,9) = 72, return(var3) # 72

prompt: Every day Ryan spends 5 hours on learning english and 4 hours on learning chinese. If he learns for 6 daysHow many hours does he spend on learning chinese in all?
summary: var1 = find(hours spent in learning english) # 5, var2 = find(hours spent in learning chinese) # 4, var3 = find(days learning) # 6, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 4 * 6 = 24, return(var4) # 24
fr_prompt: Chaque jour, Ryan passe 5 heures à apprendre l'anglais et 4 heures à apprendre le chinois. S'il apprend pendant 6 jours, combien d'heures passe-t-il à apprendre le chinois en tout ?
