prompt: If Simon needs to make 519 gift bags at a rate of 42 bags per day, how many days does he need to finish making all the gift boxes?
summary: var1 = find(gift bags required) # 519, var2 = find(gift bags per day) # 42, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 519 / 42 = 12.33, var3 = round_up(var3), CALL # round up(12.33) = 13, return(var3) # 13
fr_prompt: Si Simon doit fabriquer 519 sacs cadeaux à raison de 42 sacs par jour, combien de jours lui faut-il pour terminer la fabrication de tous les coffrets cadeaux ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(sacs-cadeaux requis) # 519, var2 = find(sacs-cadeaux par jour) # 42, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 519 / 42 = 12.33, var3 = round_up(var3), CALL # round haut(12.33) = 13, retour(var3) # 13

prompt: Bobby ate 23 pieces of candy. If he initially had 30 pieces of candyHow many pieces of candy does he still have left?
summary: var1 = find(pieces of candy initially) # 30, var2 = find(pieces eaten) # 23, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 30 - 23 = 7, return(var3) # 7

fr_summary: var1 = find(morceaux de bonbons initialement) # 30, var2 = find(morceaux mangés) # 23, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 30 - 23 = 7, return(var3) # 7

prompt: The two groups will also collect garbage from all the 453 houses in the city. If Lizzie's group covered 238 houses while the other group covered 190, how many more houses remain?
summary: var1 = find(total number of houses) # 453, var2 = find(houses cleaned by Lizzie's group) # 238, var3 = find(houses cleaned by other group) # 190, var2 = add(var2, var3), CALL # 238 + 190 = 428, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 453 - 428 = 25, return(var1) # 25
fr_prompt: Les deux groupes vont également ramasser les ordures des 453 maisons de la ville. Si le groupe de Lizzie couvrait 238 maisons tandis que l'autre groupe couvrait 190, combien reste-t-il de maisons ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(nombre total de maisons) # 453, var2 = find(maisons nettoyées par le groupe de Lizzie) # 238, var3 = find(maisons nettoyées par un autre groupe) # 190, var2 = add(var2, var3), CALL # 238 + 190 = 428, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 453 - 428 = 25, retour(var1) # 25

prompt: There are 10 shapes. How many will you have left over after making the groups of 5?
summary: var1 = find(number of shapes) # 10, var2 = divide(var1, 5), var3 = multiply(var2, 5), var4 = subtract(var1, var3), CALL # 10 - (5 * 2) = 0, return(var4) # 0
fr_prompt: Il y a 10 formes. Combien vous en restera-t-il après avoir fait les groupes de 5 ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(nombre de formes) # 10, var2 = diviser(var1, 5), var3 = multiplier(var2, 5), var4 = soustraire(var1, var3), CALL # 10 - (5 * 2) = 0, retour(var4) # 0

prompt: Cindy has 105 stickers. She uses 23 stickers. She buys 45 more stickers. How many stickers does Cindy have now?
summary: var1 = find(Cindy has stickers) # 105, var2 = find(stickers used) # 23, var3 = find(stickers bought) # 45, var4 = subtract(var1, var2), var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # (105 - 23) + 45 = 82 + 45 = 127, return(var5) # 127
fr_prompt: Cindy a 105 autocollants. Elle utilise 23 autocollants. Elle achète 45 autres autocollants. Combien d'autocollants Cindy a-t-elle maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (Cindy a des autocollants) # 105, var2 = trouver (autocollants utilisés) # 23, var3 = trouver (autocollants achetés) # 45, var4 = soustraire (var1, var2), var5 = ajouter (var4, var3), CALL # (105 - 23) + 45 = 82 + 45 = 127, retour(var5) # 127

prompt: Recently, the postal service sold stamps with famous people pictured on them. They sold 578,833 color stamps, as well as 523,776 black-and-white ones. About how many stamps did they sell?

fr_prompt: Récemment, le service postal a vendu des timbres avec des personnages célèbres représentés dessus. Ils ont vendu 578 833 timbres en couleur, ainsi que 523 776 en noir et blanc. Combien de timbres ont-ils vendus environ ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(tampons de couleur) # 578833, var2 = find(tampons en noir et blanc) # 523776, var1 = add(var1, var2), return(var1) # 1102609

prompt: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 12 cups of flour 14 cups of sugar and 7 cups of salt. She already put in 2 cups of flour.How many more cups of flour than cups of salt does she need to add now?
summary: var1 = find(total flour) # 12, var2 = find(flour added) # 2, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = find(total salt) # 7, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 12 - 2 = 10, 10 - 7 = 3, return(var5) # 3
fr_prompt: Marie prépare un gâteau. La recette demande 12 tasses de farine 14 tasses de sucre et 7 tasses de sel. Elle a déjà mis 2 tasses de farine. Combien de tasses de farine de plus que de tasses de sel doit-elle ajouter maintenant ?

prompt: Alicia loves collecting art. She has a whole house filled with all the art she obtained since she was a little kid. When she decided to move away, she started donating some of her art to different museums. First museum she went to was the Metropolitan museum in New York. She donated 46 medieval art pieces from the 70 she originally has. How many medieval art pieces were left with her?
summary: var1 = find(total number of medieval art pieces originally has) # 70, var2 = find(medieval art pieces donated) # 46, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 70 - 46 = 24, return(var1) # 24
fr_prompt: Alicia aime collectionner l'art. Elle a toute une maison remplie de tout l'art qu'elle a obtenu depuis qu'elle est petite. Lorsqu'elle a décidé de déménager, elle a commencé à donner une partie de son art à différents musées. Le premier musée où elle est allée était le Metropolitan Museum de New York. Elle a fait don de 46 œuvres d'art médiévales sur les 70 qu'elle possédait à l'origine. Combien d'œuvres d'art médiévales lui restaient-elles ?

prompt: Paige uploaded thirty-five pictures to Facebook. She put fourteen pics into one album and put the rest into three different albums. How many pictures were in each of the three albums?
summary: var1 = find(pictures) # 35, var2 = find(pictures in 1 album) # 14, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 35 - 14 = 21, var2 = find(number of albums) # 3, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 21 / 3 = 7, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: Paige a téléchargé trente-cinq photos sur Facebook. Elle a mis quatorze photos dans un album et a mis le reste dans trois albums différents. Combien y avait-il de photos dans chacun des trois albums ?

prompt: For Gwen's birthday she received 5 dollars from her dad. Her mom gave her 7 more dollars. If she spent 4 dollars.How much more money did she receive from her mom than she did from her dad?
summary: var1 = find(dollars dad) #5, var2 = find(dollars mom) #7, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 7 = 12, var4 = find(spent) #4, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 12 - 4 = 8, var6 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 7 - 5 = 2, return(var6) # 2
fr_prompt: Pour l'anniversaire de Gwen, elle a reçu 5 dollars de son père. Sa mère lui a donné 7 dollars de plus. Si elle a dépensé 4 dollars. Combien d'argent a-t-elle reçu de sa mère en plus que de son père ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(dollars papa) #5, var2 = trouver(dollars maman) #7, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 7 = 12, var4 = trouver(dépenser) #4, var5 = soustraire( var3, var4), CALL # 12 - 4 = 8, var6 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 7 - 5 = 2, return(var6) # 2

prompt: It's spring break at Rosewood High so Rachel and her family decided to take a trip across Europe. Since Rachel has always been fascinated by the French people, they began their tour with a visit to France. During their stay there, Rachel went to the famous Eiffel Tower. If she climbed 567 flights of stairs going up and 325 going down, what is the total number of steps that she took?
summary: var1 = find(up stairs) # 567, var2 = find(down stairs) # 325, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 567 + 325 = 892, return(var1) # 892

fr_summary: var1 = find(en haut des escaliers) # 567, var2 = find(en bas des escaliers) # 325, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 567 + 325 = 892, return(var1) # 892

prompt: At an ice cream shop the ratio of sugar cones sold to waffle cones sold is 5:4. If there are 45 sugar cones sold, how many waffles cones would be sold?
summary: var1 = find(sugar cones) # 45, var2 = divide(var1, 5), var3 = multiply(var2, 4 + 5), CALL # (45 / 5) * (4 + 5) = 54, var4 = divide(var3, 9), CALL # 54 / 9 = 6, return(var4) # 6
fr_prompt: Dans un magasin de crème glacée, le rapport entre les cornets de sucre vendus et les cornets de gaufre vendus est de 5:4. S'il y a 45 cônes de sucre vendus, combien de cônes de gaufres seraient vendus ?

fr_prompt: Il y a des chambres dans un bâtiment. 35 d'entre eux sont des salles de classe, 10 d'entre eux sont des bureaux et les 6 restants sont des salles de lecture. Combien y a-t-il de pièces dans le bâtiment ?

prompt: The book store is very busy today. There are 25 children listening to a story. 36 people are shopping for books. 17 people are at the checkout counter. How many people are at the bookstore?
summary: var1 = find(children) # 25, var2 = find(shoppers) # 36, var3 = add(var1, var2) # 25 + 36 = 61, var4 = find(checkout people) # 17, var5 = add(var3, var4) # 61 + 17 = 78, return(var5) # 78
fr_prompt: La librairie est très fréquentée aujourd'hui. Il y a 25 enfants qui écoutent une histoire. 36 personnes achètent des livres. 17 personnes sont à la caisse. Combien de personnes sont à la librairie ?

prompt: Adam had seventy-nine dollars saved up. After doing some chores his mother gave him another thirteen dollars. How much money does he have total?

prompt: Packages of cheddar cheese come with 12 slices, while packages of Swiss cheese come with 28 slices. If Randy bought the same number of slices of each type of cheese, what is the smallest number of slices of each type that Randy could have bought?

prompt: Zachary did 46 push-ups and 58 crunches in gym class today. David did 38 more push-ups but 62 less crunches than zachary.How many more crunches than push-ups did Zachary do?
summary: var1 = find(push-ups by Zachary) # 46, var2 = find(crunches by Zachary) # 58, var3 = find(more push-ups by David) # 38, var4 = add(var1, var3), var5 = find(less crunches by David) # 62, var6 = subtract(var2, var5), var7 = subtract(var2, var6), CALL # 58 - (58 - 62) = 12, return(var7) # 12
fr_prompt: Zachary a fait 46 pompes et 58 abdominaux en cours de gym aujourd'hui. David a fait 38 pompes de plus, mais 62 crunchs de moins que Zachary. Combien de crunchs de plus que de push-ups Zachary a-t-il fait ?

prompt: Our class got fifty-four books from the library. Then we got twenty-three more books from the library. How many books did our class get from the library?

prompt: When Amy got to the fair she had $15. When she left she had $11. How much money did she spend at the fair?
summary: var1 = find(arrival money) # 15, var2 = find(left money) # 11, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 15 - 11 = 4, return(var3) # 4
fr_prompt: Quand Amy est arrivée à la foire, elle avait 15 $. Quand elle est partie, elle avait 11 $. Combien d'argent a-t-elle dépensé à la foire ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (argent d'arrivée) # 15, var2 = trouver (argent restant) # 11, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 15 - 11 = 4, retour (var3) # 4

prompt: Mike collected seventy-one cans to recycle on Monday and twenty-seven more on Tuesday. How many cans did Mike collect all together?
summary: var1 = find(Monday cans) # 71, var2 = find(Tuesday cans) # 27, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 71 + 27 = 98, return(var1) # 98
fr_prompt: Mike a collecté soixante et onze canettes à recycler lundi et vingt-sept autres mardi. Combien de canettes Mike a-t-il ramassé en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Monday cans) # 71, var2 = find(Mardi canettes) # 27, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 71 + 27 = 98, return(var1) # 98

prompt: In Haley's class some boys love to play marbles. If Haley has 10 marbles and she gave 5 marbles to each boyHow many boys did she give the marbles to?
summary: var1 = find(Marbles) # 10, var2 = find(Marbles per boy) # 5, var3 = div(var1, var2), CALL # 10 / 5 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: Dans la classe de Haley, certains garçons adorent jouer aux billes. Si Haley a 10 billes et qu'elle en a donné 5 à chaque garçon, à combien de garçons a-t-elle donné les billes ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Marbles) # 10, var2 = find(Marbles par garçon) # 5, var3 = div(var1, var2), CALL # 10 / 5 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: Before she went home, she bought t-shirts, key chains and handmade bracelets as souvenirs. She spent $347.00 on key chains and bracelets which is $146.00 more than she spent on t-shirts. How much money did she spend on all the souvenirs?
summary: var1 = find(money spent on key chains and bracelets) # 347, var2 = subtract(var1, 146), CALL # 347 - 146 = 201, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 347 + 201 = 548, return(var1) # 548
fr_prompt: Avant de rentrer chez elle, elle a acheté des t-shirts, des porte-clés et des bracelets faits à la main comme souvenirs. Elle a dépensé 347,00 $ en porte-clés et bracelets, soit 146,00 $ de plus que ce qu'elle a dépensé en t-shirts. Combien d'argent a-t-elle dépensé pour tous les souvenirs ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(argent dépensé en porte-clés et bracelets) # 347, var2 = subtract(var1, 146), CALL # 347 - 146 = 201, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 347 + 201 = 548, return (var1) # 548

prompt: Some campers went rowing in the morning while 7 campers went rowing in the afternoon. If a total of 60 campers went rowing that dayHow many campers went rowing in the morning?
summary: var1 = find(total campers who went rowing) # 60, var2 = find(campers who went rowing in the afternoon) # 7, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 60 - 7 = 53, return(var3) # 53
fr_prompt: Certains campeurs sont allés ramer le matin tandis que 7 campeurs sont allés ramer l'après-midi. Si un total de 60 campeurs ont ramé ce jour-là, combien de campeurs ont ramé le matin ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(total des campeurs qui ont ramé) # 60, var2 = find(campeurs qui ont ramé l'après-midi) # 7, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 60 - 7 = 53, return(var3) # 53

prompt: Marco and his dad went strawberry picking. Together they collected strawberries that weighed 24 pounds. On the way back Marco lost 9 pounds of strawberries. Marco's strawberries now weighed 3 pounds.How much did his dad's strawberries weigh?
summary: var1 = find(total strawberries) # 24, var2 = find(strawberries lost) # 9, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = find(Marco's strawberries) # 3, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 24 - 9 - 3 = 12, return(var5) # 12
fr_prompt: Marco et son père sont allés cueillir des fraises. Ensemble, ils ont ramassé des fraises qui pesaient 24 livres. Sur le chemin du retour, Marco a perdu 9 livres de fraises. Les fraises de Marco pesaient maintenant 3 livres. Combien pesaient les fraises de son père ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(total fraises) # 24, var2 = trouver(fraises perdues) # 9, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(fraises de Marco) # 3, var5 = soustraire(var3, var4), CALL # 24 - 9 - 3 = 12, retour(var5) # 12

prompt: There are 20 different books in the ' crazy silly school ' series. If you are yet to read 5 of the booksHow many books have you already read?
summary: var1 = find(total books) #20, var2 = find(unread books) #5, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 20 - 5 = 15, return(var3) # 15
fr_prompt: Il y a 20 livres différents dans la série « crazy silly school ». Si vous n'avez pas encore lu 5 des livresCombien de livres avez-vous déjà lu ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(total books) #20, var2 = find(unread books) #5, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 20 - 5 = 15, return(var3) # 15

prompt: During a race Gwen jogged for 15 minutes. If the ratio of time she jogged to time she walked was 5:3, how many minutes did Gwen walk?
summary: var1 = find(jogged time) # 15, var2 = divide(var1, 5), var3 = multiply(var2, 3), CALL # (15 / 5) * 3 = 9, return(var3) # 9
fr_prompt: Lors d'une course, Gwen a couru pendant 15 minutes. Si le rapport entre le temps qu'elle a couru et le temps qu'elle a marché était de 5:3, combien de minutes Gwen a-t-elle marché ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(jogged time) # 15, var2 = diviser(var1, 5), var3 = multiplier(var2, 3), CALL # (15 / 5) * 3 = 9, return(var3) # 9

prompt: Jesse's room is 7 feet wide. If she needs a carpet of size 14 square feetWhat is the length of her room?
summary: var1 = find(width of room) # 7, var2 = find(size of carpet) # 14, var3 = divide(var2, var1), CALL # 14 / 7 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: La chambre de Jesse mesure 7 pieds de large. Si elle a besoin d'un tapis de 14 pieds carrés, quelle est la longueur de sa chambre ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(largeur de la pièce) # 7, var2 = find(taille du tapis) # 14, var3 = diviser(var2, var1), CALL # 14 / 7 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: Nell collects baseball cards. She had 573 cards. She gave 195 cards to John and yet some more to Jeff. Now she has 210 cards left.How many cards did Nell give to Jeff?
summary: var1 = find(total cards) # 573, var2 = find(cards given to John) # 195, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), var4 = find(current cards) # 210, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 573 - 195 - 210 = 168, return(var5) # 168
fr_prompt: Nell collectionne les cartes de baseball. Elle avait 573 cartes. Elle a donné 195 cartes à John et encore plus à Jeff. Maintenant, il lui reste 210 cartes. Combien de cartes Nell a-t-elle données à Jeff ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(cartes totales) # 573, var2 = trouver(cartes données à Jean) # 195, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(cartes actuelles) # 210, var5 = soustraire(var3, var4), APPEL # 573 - 195 - 210 = 168, retour (var5) # 168

prompt: They also gathered paper to create some star-shaped papier-mache. If each star requires 20 pieces of paper and they had 680 pieces of paper, how many stars were they able to make?
summary: var1 = find(pieces of paper) # 680, var2 = find(pieces of paper per star) # 20, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 680 / 20 = 34, return(var1) # 34
fr_prompt: Ils ont également rassemblé du papier pour créer du papier mâché en forme d'étoile. Si chaque étoile nécessite 20 morceaux de papier et qu'ils avaient 680 morceaux de papier, combien d'étoiles ont-ils pu fabriquer ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(morceaux de papier) # 680, var2 = find(morceaux de papier par étoile) # 20, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 680 / 20 = 34, return(var1) # 34

prompt: Ed had 19 more marbles than Doug. Ed lost some of his marbles at the playground. Now Ed has 8 more marbles than doug.How many marbles did Ed lose?
summary: var1 = find(Ed marbles) #19, var2 = subtract(var1, 8), CALL # 19 - 8 = 11, return(var2) #11
fr_prompt: Ed avait 19 billes de plus que Doug. Ed a perdu certaines de ses billes dans la cour de récréation. Maintenant, Ed a 8 billes de plus que Doug. Combien de billes Ed a-t-il perdues ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(Ed billes) #19, var2 = soustraire(var1, 8), APPEL # 19 - 8 = 11, retour(var2) #11

prompt: Paul spent $75. Now he has $11. What's the difference between the number of dollars that he spent and he has now?
summary: var1 = find(Paul's spent dollars) # 75, var2 = find(Paul's current dollars) # 11, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 75 - 11 = 64, return(var1) # 64
fr_prompt: Paul a dépensé 75 $. Maintenant, il a 11 $. Quelle est la différence entre le nombre de dollars qu'il a dépensé et qu'il a maintenant ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(dollars dépensés par Paul) # 75, var2 = find(dollars actuels de Paul) # 11, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 75 - 11 = 64, return(var1) # 64

prompt: Mrs. Hilt needs to share $3.75 equally among three total people. How much money will each person get?
summary: var1 = find(total money) # 3.75, var2 = find(people) # 3, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 3.75 / 3 = 1.25, return(var3) # 1.25
fr_prompt: Mme Hilt doit partager 3,75 $ également entre trois personnes au total. Combien d'argent chaque personne recevra-t-elle ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (argent total) # 3,75, var2 = trouver (personnes) # 3, var3 = diviser (var1, var2), APPEL # 3,75 / 3 = 1,25, retour (var3) # 1,25

prompt: Lucy went to the grocery store. She bought 12 packs of cookies and 16 packs of noodles. How many packs of groceries did she buy in all?
summary: var1 = find(packs of cookies) # 12, var2 = find(packs of noodles) # 16, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 12 + 16 = 28, return(var3) # 28
fr_prompt: Lucy est allée à l'épicerie. Elle a acheté 12 paquets de biscuits et 16 paquets de nouilles. Combien de paquets d'épicerie a-t-elle acheté en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(packs de cookies) # 12, var2 = find(packs de nouilles) # 16, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 12 + 16 = 28, return(var3) # 28

prompt: An industrial machine made 12 shirts. It can make 2 shirts a minute. How many minutes was the machine working?
summary: var1 = find(shirts made) # 12, var2 = find(shirts per minute) # 2, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 12 / 2 = 6, return(var3) # 6
fr_prompt: Une machine industrielle fabriquait 12 chemises. Il peut faire 2 chemises par minute. Combien de minutes la machine a-t-elle fonctionné ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(chemises faites) # 12, var2 = find(chemises par minute) # 2, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 12 / 2 = 6, return(var3) # 6

prompt: For the fifth grade play, the chairs have been put into 27 rows with 16 chairs in each row. How many chairs have been put out for the play?
summary: var1 = find(rows) # 27, var2 = find(chairs per row) # 16, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 27 * 16 = 432, return(var1) # 432
fr_prompt: Pour le jeu de cinquième année, les chaises ont été placées en 27 rangées avec 16 chaises dans chaque rangée. Combien de chaises ont été sorties pour la pièce ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(rows) # 27, var2 = find(chairs per row) # 16, var1 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 27 * 16 = 432, return(var1) # 432

prompt: It has been tradition in Shiela's home to hang a sock above the fireplace for each member of the family. This year, she placed a cinnamon ball every day in the socks for 5 of her family members. How long can she do this if she bought 50 cinnamon balls?
summary: var1 = find(cinnamon balls) # 50, var2 = find(family members) # 5, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 50 / 5 = 10, return(var1) # 10
fr_prompt: Dans la maison de Shiela, il est de tradition d'accrocher une chaussette au-dessus de la cheminée pour chaque membre de la famille. Cette année, elle a placé chaque jour une boule de cannelle dans les chaussettes de 5 membres de sa famille. Combien de temps peut-elle faire cela si elle a acheté 50 boules de cannelle ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (boulettes de cannelle) # 50, var2 = trouver (membres de la famille) # 5, var1 = diviser (var1, var2), APPEL # 50 / 5 = 10, retour (var1) # 10

prompt: Dan has $ 2. He bought a candy bar for $ 6 and a chocolate for $ 3.How much money did he spend to buy candy bar than he did to buy chocolate?
summary: var1 = find(candy bar cost) # 6, var2 = find(chocolate cost) # 3, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 6 - 3 = 3, return(var3) # 3
fr_prompt: Dan a 2 $. Il a acheté une barre chocolatée pour 6 $ et un chocolat pour 3 $. Combien d'argent a-t-il dépensé pour acheter une barre chocolatée que pour acheter du chocolat ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (coût de la barre chocolatée) # 6, var2 = trouver (coût du chocolat) # 3, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 6 - 3 = 3, retour (var3) # 3

prompt: Tiffany was collecting cans for recycling. On monday she had 4 bags of cans. The next day she found some more bags worth of cans. If she had a total of 6 bags altogetherHow many bags did she find on the next day?
summary: var1 = find(Monday bags) #4, var2 = find(total bags) #6, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 6 - 4 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: Tiffany ramassait des canettes pour les recycler. Le lundi, elle avait 4 sacs de canettes. Le lendemain, elle a trouvé d'autres sacs de canettes. Si elle avait un total de 6 sacs en tout, combien de sacs a-t-elle trouvés le lendemain ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(sacs du lundi) #4, var2 = trouver(total des sacs) #6, var3 = soustraire(var2, var1), APPEL # 6 - 4 = 2, retour(var3) # 2

prompt: Terry and Grace are building a gear machine. Terry used 37 building pieces. Grace used 45 pieces. How many building pieces did they use altogether?
summary: var1 = find(pieces used by Terry) # 37, var2 = find(pieces used by Grace) # 45, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 37 + 45 = 82, return(var3) # 82
fr_prompt: Terry et Grace construisent une machine à engrenages. Terry a utilisé 37 pièces de construction. Grace a utilisé 45 pièces. Combien de pièces de construction ont-ils utilisées en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pièces utilisées par Terry) # 37, var2 = find(pièces utilisées par Grace) # 45, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 37 + 45 = 82, return(var3) # 82

prompt: During Christmas a book store sold 72 books. If the ratio of books to bookmarks sold was 9:2, how many bookmarks did the store sell?
summary: var1 = find(books sold) # 72, var2 = divide(var1, 9), var3 = multiply(var2, 2), CALL # 72 / 9 * 2 = 16, return(var3) # 16
fr_prompt: A Noël, une librairie a vendu 72 livres. Si le rapport entre les livres et les signets vendus était de 9 : 2, combien de signets le magasin a-t-il vendus ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(livres vendus) # 72, var2 = diviser(var1, 9), var3 = multiplier(var2, 2), CALL # 72 / 9 * 2 = 16, return(var3) # 16

prompt: At a store, there are 92 computers. 31 are sold. 20 are shipped away to a company. How many computers are left?
summary: var1 = find(computers sold) # 31, var2 = find(computers shipped) # 20, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 31 + 20 = 51, var4 = find(total computers) # 92, var5 = subtract(var4, var3), CALL # 92 - 51 = 41, return(var5) # 41
fr_prompt: Dans un magasin, il y a 92 ordinateurs. 31 sont vendus. 20 sont expédiés à une entreprise. Combien d'ordinateurs reste-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(ordinateurs vendus) # 31, var2 = find(ordinateurs livrés) # 20, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 31 + 20 = 51, var4 = find(total des ordinateurs) # 92, var5 = soustraire (var4, var3), APPEL # 92 - 51 = 41, retour (var5) # 41

prompt: A group was sitting at a lunch table. After finishing, six people left and there were five left at the table. How many people were at the table to start with?
summary: var1 = find(people left) # 5, var2 = find(people left the table) # 6, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 6 = 11, return(var3) # 11
fr_prompt: Un groupe était assis à une table de déjeuner. Après avoir terminé, six personnes sont parties et il en restait cinq à table. Combien de personnes étaient à table pour commencer ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(les gens sont partis) # 5, var2 = find(les gens ont quitté la table) # 6, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 5 + 6 = 11, return(var3) # 11

prompt: Paul bought six boxes of chocolate candy and four boxes of caramel candy. If each box has nine pieces inside it, how much candy did he have total?
summary: var1 = find(boxes of chocolate candy) # 6, var2 = find(boxes of caramel candy) # 4, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 4 = 10, var2 = find(pieces per box) # 9, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 10 * 9 = 90, return(var3) # 90
fr_prompt: Paul a acheté six boîtes de bonbons au chocolat et quatre boîtes de bonbons au caramel. Si chaque boîte contient neuf morceaux, combien de bonbons avait-il au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(boites de bonbons au chocolat) # 6, var2 = find(boites de bonbons au caramel) # 4, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 4 = 10, var2 = find(morceaux par boite) # 9, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 10 * 9 = 90, retour(var3) # 90

prompt: 6 green peaches, 60 yellow peaches and 2 red peaches are in the basket.How many more green peaches than red peaches are in the basket?
summary: var1 = find(green peaches) #6, var2 = find(red peaches) #2, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 6 - 2 = 4, return(var3) #4
fr_prompt: 6 pêches vertes, 60 pêches jaunes et 2 pêches rouges sont dans le panier. Combien y a-t-il de plus de pêches vertes que de pêches rouges dans le panier ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(pêches vertes) #6, var2 = trouver(pêches rouges) #2, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 6 - 2 = 4, retour(var3) #4

prompt: 6 red peaches, 90 yellow peaches and 16 green peaches are in the basket.How many red and green peaches are in the basket?
summary: var1 = find(red peaches in basket) # 6, var2 = find(green peaches in basket) # 16, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 16 = 22, return(var3) # 22
fr_prompt: 6 pêches rouges, 90 pêches jaunes et 16 pêches vertes sont dans le panier. Combien y a-t-il de pêches rouges et vertes dans le panier ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pêches rouges dans le panier) # 6, var2 = find(pêches vertes dans le panier) # 16, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 16 = 22, return(var3) # 22

prompt: Dane eats lunch at 12:30. It takes him 20 minutes to eat. What time does Dane finish eating?
summary: var1 = find(Dane lunch time) # 12:30, var2 = find(eating time) # 20, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 12:30 + 20 = 12:50, return(var1) # 12:50
fr_prompt: Dane déjeune à 12h30. Il lui faut 20 minutes pour manger. À quelle heure Dane finit-il de manger ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Dane lunch time) # 12:30, var2 = find(manger time) # 20, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 12:30 + 20 = 12:50, return(var1) # 12 :50

prompt: There are 3 more sections that are undeveloped. Each of the remaining sections has a land area of 2435 square feet. What is the total area of the undeveloped land?
summary: var1 = find(square feet per section) # 2435, var2 = find(number of sections) # 3, var1 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 2435 * 3 = 7305, return(var1) # 7305
fr_prompt: Il y a 3 autres sections qui ne sont pas développées. Chacune des sections restantes a une superficie de 2435 pieds carrés. Quelle est la superficie totale du terrain non bâti?

prompt: Wendy was playing a video game where she scores five points for each treasure she finds. If she found four treasures on the first level and three on the second, what would her score be?
summary: var1 = find(treasures on level 1) # 4, var2 = find(treasures on level 2) # 3, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 3 = 7, var2 = find(points per treasure) # 5, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 7 * 5 = 35, return(var3) # 35
fr_prompt: Wendy jouait à un jeu vidéo où elle marque cinq points pour chaque trésor qu'elle trouve. Si elle trouvait quatre trésors au premier niveau et trois au second, quel serait son score ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(trésors au niveau 1) # 4, var2 = trouver(trésors au niveau 2) # 3, var1 = ajouter(var1, var2), CALL # 4 + 3 = 7, var2 = trouver(points par trésor) # 5, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), APPEL # 7 * 5 = 35, retour(var3) # 35

prompt: Maura collects seashells every summer. Her family stays at the beach house for 21 days. This summer, Maura found 75 seashells. She gave some to her little sister. Maura then had 57 seashells. How many seashells did Maura give to her sister?
summary: var1 = find(seashells found) # 75, var2 = find(seashells left) # 57, var3 = subtract(var1, var2) # 75 - 57 = 18, return(var3) # 18
fr_prompt: Maura ramasse des coquillages chaque été. Sa famille reste à la maison de la plage pendant 21 jours. Cet été, Maura a trouvé 75 coquillages. Elle en a donné à sa petite sœur. Maura possédait alors 57 coquillages. Combien de coquillages Maura a-t-elle donné à sa sœur ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(coquillages trouvés) # 75, var2 = trouver(coquillages restants) # 57, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2) # 75 - 57 = 18, retour(var3) # 18

prompt: At the zoo, a cage had 93 snakes and 97 alligators. If 40 alligators were hidingHow many alligators were not hiding?
summary: var1 = find(alligators) #97, var2 = find(alligators hiding) #40, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 97 - 40 = 57, return(var3) # 57
fr_prompt: Au zoo, une cage contenait 93 serpents et 97 alligators. Si 40 alligators se cachaient, combien d'alligators ne se cachaient pas ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (alligators) # 97, var2 = trouver (cacher les alligators) # 40, var3 = soustraire (var1, var2), APPEL # 97 - 40 = 57, retour (var3) # 57

prompt: After collecting materials, they started making recycled products to sell during the school's recycling fair. If Marcus made 26 pen holders from the milk bottles and Annie was able to make 37, how many pen holders were made?
summary: var1 = find(Marcus pen holders) # 26, var2 = find(pen holders from Annie) # 37, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 26 + 37 = 63, return(var1) # 63
fr_prompt: Après avoir collecté des matériaux, ils ont commencé à fabriquer des produits recyclés à vendre lors de la foire du recyclage de l'école. Si Marcus a fabriqué 26 porte-stylos à partir des bouteilles de lait et qu'Annie a pu en fabriquer 37, combien de porte-stylos ont été fabriqués ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(Marcus porte-stylos) # 26, var2 = find(porte-stylos d'Annie) # 37, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 26 + 37 = 63, return(var1) # 63

prompt: The difference of two numbers is 100. If one of the numbers is 91, find the other number.
summary: var1 = find(difference) # 100, var2 = find(first number) # 91, var1 = add(var2, var1), return(var1) # 191
fr_prompt: La différence de deux nombres est 100. Si l'un des nombres est 91, trouvez l'autre nombre.
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(différence) # 100, var2 = trouver(premier nombre) # 91, var1 = ajouter(var2, var1), retour(var1) # 191

prompt: Edward spent $ 6 to buy 2 books each book costing him the same amount of money. Now he has $ 12.How much did each book cost?
summary: var1 = find(money spent) # 6, var2 = find(number of books) # 2, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 6 / 2 = 3, return(var3) # 3
fr_prompt: Edward a dépensé 6 $ pour acheter 2 livres, chaque livre lui coûtant la même somme d'argent. Maintenant, il a 12 $. Combien coûte chaque livre ?

prompt: Jane can arrange 16 vases of flowers in a day. If there are 248 vases of flowers to be arranged, how many vases of flowers will she arrange on the last day?

prompt: Instead of buying from the store, Melody made Christmas cards for the elderly in a nursing home. She had 99 blue sequins which she plans to use as snowflakes for the cards. If she distributes the sequins equally to 12 cards, how many sequins will Melody have left?

prompt: Katie loves to travel. On her birthday, she decided to go on a trip on a mysterious continent. Her first destination was in an island of statues which is 436 miles from her place. She took a plane that made two stopovers, the 1st stopover after covering 132 miles and the 2nd stopover after another 236 miles. How much farther is the island from the 2nd stopover?
summary: var1 = find(distance to the island) # 436, var2 = find(distance covered in 1st stopover) # 132, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 436 - 132 = 304, var2 = find(distance covered in 2nd stopover) # 236, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 304 - 236 = 68, return(var1) # 68
fr_prompt: Katie aime voyager. Le jour de son anniversaire, elle a décidé de partir en voyage sur un continent mystérieux. Sa première destination était une île de statues située à 436 miles de chez elle. Elle a pris un avion qui a fait deux escales, la 1ère escale après avoir parcouru 132 milles et la 2e escale après encore 236 milles. À quelle distance se trouve l'île de la 2e escale ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(distance jusqu'à l'île) # 436, var2 = trouver(distance parcourue en 1ère escale) # 132, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 436 - 132 = 304, var2 = trouver(distance parcourue en 2ème escale) # 236, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 304 - 236 = 68, retour(var1) # 68

prompt: One bright sunny day, Betty decided to make bracelets from beautiful stones she bought from a local store. She bought 88 pink flower stones and wanted to make 8 bracelets out of these stones. How many pink flower stones will each bracelet have if she used the same number of stones in each bracelet?
summary: var1 = find(pink flower stones) # 88, var2 = find(bracelets) # 8, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 88 / 8 = 11, return(var1) # 11
fr_prompt: Par une belle journée ensoleillée, Betty a décidé de fabriquer des bracelets à partir de belles pierres qu'elle avait achetées dans un magasin local. Elle a acheté 88 pierres de fleurs roses et voulait faire 8 bracelets avec ces pierres. Combien de pierres de fleurs roses aura chaque bracelet si elle a utilisé le même nombre de pierres dans chaque bracelet ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (pierres de fleurs roses) # 88, var2 = trouver (bracelets) # 8, var1 = diviser (var1, var2), APPEL # 88 / 8 = 11, retour (var1) # 11

prompt: Roger is at the library helping put away books. There are fifty-four book to put away total but a librarian takes nineteen of them and leaves Roger with the rest. If he can fit five books on a shelf, how many shelves will he need?
summary: var1 = find(books) # 54, var2 = find(books taken) # 19, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 54 - 19 = 35, var2 = find(books per shelf) # 5, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 35 / 5 = 7, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: Roger est à la bibliothèque pour aider à ranger les livres. Il y a cinquante-quatre livres à ranger au total mais un bibliothécaire en prend dix-neuf et laisse Roger avec le reste. S'il peut mettre cinq livres sur une étagère, de combien d'étagères aura-t-il besoin ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(livres) # 54, var2 = trouver(livres pris) # 19, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 54 - 19 = 35, var2 = trouver(livres par étagère) # 5, var3 = diviser (var1, var2), APPEL # 35 / 5 = 7, retour (var3) # 7

prompt: The grasshopper and the frog had a jumping contest. The grasshopper jumped 25 inches. The frog jumped 15 inches farther than the grasshopper. How far did the frog jump?
summary: var1 = find(grasshopper jump) # 25, var2 = find(jump difference) # 15, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 25 + 15 = 40, return(var3) # 40
fr_prompt: La sauterelle et la grenouille ont fait un concours de sauts. La sauterelle a sauté de 25 pouces. La grenouille a sauté 15 pouces plus loin que la sauterelle. Jusqu'où la grenouille a-t-elle sauté ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (saut de sauterelle) # 25, var2 = trouver (différence de saut) # 15, var3 = ajouter (var1, var2), APPEL # 25 + 15 = 40, retour (var3) # 40

prompt: A book has 2 chapters. The first chapter is 60 pages long. If there are a total of 93 pages in the bookHow many pages are in the second chapter?
summary: var1 = find(pages in first chapter) # 60, var2 = find(pages in book) # 93, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 93 - 60 = 33, return(var3) # 33
fr_prompt: Un livre comporte 2 chapitres. Le premier chapitre fait 60 pages. S'il y a un total de 93 pages dans le livre, combien de pages y a-t-il dans le deuxième chapitre ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(pages du premier chapitre) # 60, var2 = trouver(pages du livre) # 93, var3 = soustraire(var2, var1), APPEL # 93 - 60 = 33, retour(var3) # 33

prompt: Carey and Pat are moving chairs to the gym. They agreed to move 74 chairs. Carey moved 28 chairs. Pat has moved 29 chairs. How many more chairs do they have left to move?
summary: var1 = find(total chairs) # 74, var2 = add(28, 29), CALL # 28 + 29 = 57, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 74 - 57 = 17, return(var3) # 17

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(total chaises) # 74, var2 = ajouter(28, 29), APPEL # 28 + 29 = 57, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 74 - 57 = 17, retour(var3) # 17

prompt: Because of the decision Sofia asked the students to suggest specific types of food. If 479 students suggested adding mashed potatoes while 489 suggested adding bacon to the menuHow many more students suggested bacon than those that suggested mashed potatoes?

Si 479 élèves ont suggéré d'ajouter de la purée de pommes de terre tandis que 489 ont suggéré d'ajouter du bacon au menu, combien d'élèves de plus ont suggéré du bacon que ceux qui ont suggéré de la purée de pommes de terre ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (suggérateurs de purée de pommes de terre) # 479, var2 = trouver (suggérateurs de bacon) # 489, var3 = soustraire (var2, var1), APPEL # 489 - 479 = 10, retour (var3) # 10

prompt: A post office has five hundred eighty-two pieces of junk mail they want to split evenly between seven mail trucks. How many extra pieces of junk mail will they have if they give each truck the same amount?
summary: var1 = find(pieces of junk mail) # 582, var2 = find(trucks) # 7, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 582 / 7 = 83, var4 = multiply(var2, var3) # 83 * 7 = 581, var1 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 582 - 581 = 1, return(var1) # 1
fr_prompt: Un bureau de poste a cinq cent quatre-vingt-deux pièces de courrier indésirable qu'il souhaite répartir également entre sept camions de courrier. Combien de courriers indésirables supplémentaires auront-ils s'ils donnent à chaque camion le même montant ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(morceaux de courrier indésirable) # 582, var2 = trouver(camions) # 7, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 582 / 7 = 83, var4 = multiplier(var2, var3) # 83 * 7 = 581, var1 = soustraire(var1, var4), APPEL # 582 - 581 = 1, retour(var1) # 1

fr_summary: var1 = trouver (saut de sauterelle) # 13, var2 = trouver (différence de saut) # 2, var3 = sous (var1, var2), APPEL # 13 - 2 = 11, retour (var3) # 11

prompt: Last Saturday, Marie sold 425 magazines and 275 newspapers. What is the total number of reading materials she sold?
summary: var1 = find(sold magazines) # 425, var2 = find(sold newspapers) # 275, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 425 + 275 = 700, return(var3) # 700

summary: var1 = find(cupcakes per package) # 4, var2 = find(number of packages) # 3, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 4 * 3 = 12, var4 = find(cupcakes eaten) # 5, var5 = subtract(var3, var4), CALL # 12 - 5 = 7, return(var5) # 7

prompt: Jack is reading a 285-page book. If he reads 23 pages per day, how many pages will he read on the last day?
summary: var1 = find(pages in book) # 285, var2 = find(pages per day) # 23, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 285 / 23 = 12.39, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(12.39) = 12, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 23 * 12 = 276, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 285 - 276 = 9, return(var5) # 9

prompt: Janine owns a catering service company. She was hired to cater for the mayor's 50th birthday. For the appetizers, she needs to make 750 mini meat pies. She divided her crew into 3 teams. If the first team made 235, and the second made 275, how many pies should the third team make?

prompt: There were 36 dogs and 29 cats in a pet center. After 20 of the dogs were adopted by people, the pet center collected another 12 cats. How many pets were there in the pet center in the end?

fr_prompt: Il y avait 36 ​​chiens et 29 chats dans une animalerie. Après que 20 des chiens aient été adoptés par des personnes, le centre pour animaux de compagnie a récupéré 12 autres chats. Combien d'animaux de compagnie y avait-il dans le centre pour animaux de compagnie à la fin ?

prompt: It is Easter time and the kids in the neighborhood of Easterville are very excited about the annual Easter egg hunt. The parents have decided to hide the eggs in a lot of different places. Combien d'œufs étaient cachés au total ?

prompt: A book had a length of 5 inches and a total area of 50 square inches. How wide is the book?

prompt: Having been to Paris, Rob also remembered the Eiffel Tower which was the tallest structure in the world at the time it was built. If the height of Eiffel Tower is 324 m, how much lower is it compared to 830m height, today’s tallest man-made structure, the Burj Khalifa?
summary: var1 = find(height of Burj Khalifa) # 830, var2 = find(height of Eiffel Tower) # 324, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 830 - 324 = 506, return(var1) # 506
fr_prompt: Ayant été à Paris, Rob s'est également souvenu de la Tour Eiffel qui était la structure la plus haute du monde au moment de sa construction. Si la hauteur de la tour Eiffel est de 324 m, combien est-elle inférieure par rapport à 830 m de hauteur, la plus haute structure artificielle d'aujourd'hui, la Burj Khalifa ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(hauteur de Burj Khalifa) # 830, var2 = find(hauteur de la Tour Eiffel) # 324, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 830 - 324 = 506, return(var1) # 506

prompt: Dan has $ 3. He bought 2 candy bar for $ 4, each one costing the same amount of money.How much did each candy bar cost?
summary: var1 = find(Dan has) #3, var2 = find(candy bar cost) #4, var3 = divide(var2, 2), CALL # 4 / 2 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: Dan a 3 $. Il a acheté 2 barres chocolatées pour 4 $, chacune coûtant la même somme d'argent. Combien a coûté chaque barre chocolatée ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(Dan a) #3, var2 = trouver(coût de la barre chocolatée) #4, var3 = diviser(var2, 2), APPEL # 4 / 2 = 2, retour(var3) # 2

prompt: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 65 sacks of unripe oranges and 46 sacks of ripe oranges per day.How many sacks of unripe oranges will they have after 6 days of harvest?
summary: var1 = find(ripe oranges per day) # 46, var2 = find(unripe oranges per day) # 65, var3 = find(day count) # 6, var4 = multiply(var1, var3), var5 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 46 * 6 = 276, 65 * 6 = 390, return(var5) # 390
fr_prompt: Il est ensuite allé voir la récolte des oranges. Il a découvert qu'ils récoltaient 65 sacs d'oranges non mûres et 46 sacs d'oranges mûres par jour. Combien de sacs d'oranges non mûres auront-ils après 6 jours de récolte ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (oranges mûres par jour) # 46, var2 = trouver (oranges non mûres par jour) # 65, var3 = trouver (nombre de jours) # 6, var4 = multiplier (var1, var3), var5 = multiplier (var2, var3 ), APPEL # 46 * 6 = 276, 65 * 6 = 390, retour (var5) # 390

prompt: Christian's mother prepared lemonade. Every pitcher of lemonade can serve 5 glasses. If she was able to serve 30 glasses of lemonade, how many pitchers of lemonade did she prepare?
summary: var1 = find(glasses of lemonade) # 30, var2 = find(glasses per pitcher) # 5, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 30 / 5 = 6, return(var1) # 6
fr_prompt: La mère de Christian a préparé de la limonade. Chaque pichet de limonade peut servir 5 verres. Si elle a pu servir 30 verres de limonade, combien de pichets de limonade a-t-elle préparé ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(verres de limonade) # 30, var2 = find(verres par pichet) # 5, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 30 / 5 = 6, return(var1) # 6

prompt: At the fair the 'Twirly Tea Cups' ride can hold nine people per teacup. If the ride has seven tea cups, how many total people can ride at a time?
summary: var1 = find(people per teacup) # 9, var2 = multiply(var1, 7), CALL # 9 * 7 = 63, return(var2) # 63
fr_prompt: Lors de la foire, le manège «Twirly Tea Cups» peut accueillir neuf personnes par tasse de thé. Si le manège a sept tasses de thé, combien de personnes au total peuvent monter à la fois ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(personnes par tasse) # 9, var2 = multiplier(var1, 7), APPEL # 9 * 7 = 63, retour(var2) # 63

prompt: A chef was making pies. He made 2 apple, 4 pecan and 7 pumpkin pies. How many pies did he make total?
summary: var1 = find(apple pies) # 2, var2 = find(pecan pies) # 4, var3 = find(pumpkin pies) # 7, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 4 = 6, var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 6 + 7 = 13, return(var5) # 13
fr_prompt: Un chef faisait des tartes. Il a fait 2 tartes aux pommes, 4 aux pacanes et 7 à la citrouille. Combien de tartes a-t-il fait au total ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (tartes aux pommes) # 2, var2 = trouver (tartes aux noix de pécan) # 4, var3 = trouver (tartes à la citrouille) # 7, var4 = ajouter (var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 4 = 6, var5 = ajouter (var4, var3), APPEL # 6 + 7 = 13, retour (var5) # 13

prompt: Lucy put sixty-eight shells in her bucket. She found some more shells and now she has eighty-nine shells. How many more did she find?
summary: var1 = find(Lucy's shells) # 68, var2 = find(shells found) # 89 - 68, var3 = subtract(89, var1), CALL # 89 - 68 = 21, return(var3) # 21
fr_prompt: Lucy a mis soixante-huit coquillages dans son seau. Elle a trouvé d'autres coquillages et maintenant elle en a quatre-vingt-neuf. Combien en a-t-elle trouvé d'autres ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(coquillages de Lucy) # 68, var2 = find(coquillages trouvés) # 89 - 68, var3 = subtract(89, var1), CALL # 89 - 68 = 21, return(var3) # 21

prompt: Ryan learns english and chinese for 7 days. Every day he spends 4 hours on learning english and 5 hours on learning chinese.How many hours does he spend on learning english and chinese in all?
summary: var1 = find(hours spent in learning english) # 4, var2 = find(hours spent in learning chinese) # 5, var3 = add(var1, var2), var4 = find(days Ryan learns) # 7, var5 = multiply(var3, var4), CALL # (4 + 5) * 7 = 9 * 7 = 63, return(var5) # 63
fr_prompt: Ryan apprend l'anglais et le chinois pendant 7 jours. Chaque jour, il passe 4 heures à apprendre l'anglais et 5 heures à apprendre le chinois. Combien d'heures passe-t-il à apprendre l'anglais et le chinois en tout ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(heures passées à apprendre l'anglais) # 4, var2 = trouver(heures passées à apprendre le chinois) # 5, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), var4 = trouver(jours Ryan apprend) # 7, var5 = multiplier( var3, var4), APPEL # (4 + 5) * 7 = 9 * 7 = 63, retour (var5) # 63

prompt: 46 campers went rowing on a day. 43 campers went rowing in the morning and some more campers went rowing in the afternoon.How many campers went rowing in the afternoon?
summary: var1 = find(total rowing campers) # 46, var2 = find(morning rowing campers) # 43, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 46 - 43 = 3, return(var3) # 3
fr_prompt: 46 campeurs sont allés ramer sur une journée. 43 campeurs ont ramé le matin et quelques autres ont ramé l'après-midi. Combien de campeurs ont ramé l'après-midi ?

prompt: Olivia spent 38 dollars at a supermarket. If there were 128 dollars in her wallet initiallyHow much money does she have left?
summary: var1 = find(dollars initially) # 128, var2 = find(dollars spent) # 38, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 128 - 38 = 90, return(var3) # 90

fr_summary: var1 = find(dollars initialement) # 128, var2 = find(dollars dépensés) # 38, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 128 - 38 = 90, return(var3) # 90

prompt: Jack received 4 emails and sent 2 letters in the morning. He then received 6 emails and sent 8 letters in the afternoon.How many emails did Jack send in the day?
summary: var1 = find(emails received in the morning) # 4, var2 = find(letters sent in the morning) # 2, var3 = find(emails received in the afternoon) # 6, var4 = find(letters sent in the afternoon) # 8, var5 = add(var2, var4), CALL # 2 + 8 = 10, return(var5) # 10
fr_prompt: Jack a reçu 4 e-mails et envoyé 2 lettres le matin. Il a ensuite reçu 6 e-mails et envoyé 8 lettres dans l'après-midi. Combien d'e-mails Jack a-t-il envoyés dans la journée ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(emails reçus le matin) # 4, var2 = find(lettres envoyées le matin) # 2, var3 = find(emails reçus l'après-midi) # 6, var4 = find(lettres envoyées l'après-midi) # 8, var5 = ajouter(var2, var4), APPEL # 2 + 8 = 10, retour(var5) # 10

prompt: Debby drinks 6 bottles a day. If she bought a total of 12 water bottlesHow many days would they last her?
summary: var1 = find(total water bottles) #12, var2 = divide(var1, 6), CALL # 12 / 6 = 2, return(var2) #2

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(nombre total de bouteilles d'eau) #12, var2 = diviser(var1, 6), APPEL # 12 / 6 = 2, retourner(var2) #2

prompt: A school ordered 195 new pencils for the state tests. If they gave each student 3 pencils, how many students are in the school?
summary: var1 = find(new pencils) # 195, var2 = find(pencils per student) # 3, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 195 / 3 = 65, return(var3) # 65

prompt: A pet store had seven Siamese cats. If they sold four of them, how many cats did they still have?
summary: var1 = find(Siamese cats) # 7, var2 = find(cats sold) # 4, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 7 - 4 = 3, return(var3) # 3

prompt: Molly swam 45 meters on Saturday. She swam 28 meters on Sunday. The pool is 25 meters long. How many meters did Molly swim in all?

prompt: An envelope from the post office is 6 inches wide with a total area of 36 square inches. What is the height of the envelope?
summary: var1 = find(width of envelope) # 6, var2 = find(area of envelope) # 36, var2 = divide(var2, var1), CALL # 36 / 6 = 6, return(var2) # 6

prompt: Haley's favorite band was holding a concert where tickets were four dollars each. Haley bought three tickets for herself and her friends and five extra tickets in case anyone else wanted to go. How much did she spend?

fr_prompt: Le groupe préféré de Haley organisait un concert où les billets coûtaient quatre dollars chacun. Haley a acheté trois billets pour elle et ses amis et cinq billets supplémentaires au cas où quelqu'un d'autre voudrait y aller. Combien a-t-elle dépensé ?

prompt: There were 86 trees in a park. 15 of them died and another 23 of them were cut. How many trees were still left?
summary: var1 = find(dead trees) # 15, var2 = find(cut trees) # 23, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 23 = 38, var4 = find(total trees) # 86, var5 = subtract(var4, var3), CALL # 86 - 38 = 48, return(var5) # 48
fr_prompt: Il y avait 86 arbres dans un parc. 15 d'entre eux sont morts et 23 autres ont été coupés. Combien d'arbres restaient-ils encore ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(arbres morts) # 15, var2 = trouver(arbres coupés) # 23, var3 = ajouter(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 23 = 38, var4 = trouver(arbres totaux) # 86, var5 = soustraire (var4, var3), APPEL # 86 - 38 = 48, retour (var5) # 48

summary: var1 = find(math pages) # 6, var2 = find(reading pages) # 4, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 4 = 10, var2 = find(problems per page) # 3, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 10 * 3 = 30, return(var3) # 30

prompt: There were 106 dollars in Olivia's wallet. After she visited a supermarket and a showroom there were 26 dollars left. If she spent 49 dollars at the showroomHow much did she spend at the supermarket?

fr_prompt: Il y avait 106 dollars dans le portefeuille d'Olivia. Après avoir visité un supermarché et une salle d'exposition, il restait 26 dollars. Si elle a dépensé 49 dollars au showroom, combien a-t-elle dépensé au supermarché ?

prompt: At the zoo Zoe took sixty-seven pictures. If her sister took another seventeen pictures, how many did they take total?

prompt: Two clocks ring once at the same time. After that, the first clock rings after every 90 minutes, and the second after every 60 minutes. After how many minutes will they again ring together?

fr_prompt: Deux horloges sonnent une fois en même temps. Après cela, la première horloge sonne toutes les 90 minutes et la seconde toutes les 60 minutes. Au bout de combien de minutes sonneront-ils à nouveau ensemble ?

prompt: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 41 sacks of unripe oranges and 86 sacks of ripe oranges per day.How many more sacks of ripe oranges than unripe oranges are harvested per day?
summary: var1 = find(unripe oranges harvested) # 41, var2 = find(ripe oranges harvested) # 86, var3 = subtract(var2, var1), CALL # 86 - 41 = 45, return(var3) # 45
fr_prompt: Il est ensuite allé voir la récolte des oranges. Il a découvert qu'ils récoltaient 41 sacs d'oranges non mûres et 86 sacs d'oranges mûres par jour. Combien de sacs d'oranges mûres de plus que d'oranges non mûres sont récoltés par jour ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(oranges non mûres récoltées) # 41, var2 = trouver(oranges mûres récoltées) # 86, var3 = soustraire(var2, var1), APPEL # 86 - 41 = 45, retour(var3) # 45

prompt: A clothing company used 2 buttons on jeans and 5 buttons on shirts. If they made 9 shirts and 1 pair of jeans, how many buttons would they use total?
summary: var1 = find(jeans) # 1, var2 = find(buttons per jeans) # 2, var1 = var1 * var2, CALL # 1 * 2 = 2, var2 = find(shirts) # 9, var3 = find(buttons per shirt) # 5, var2 = var2 * var3, CALL # 9 * 5 = 45, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 45 = 47, return(var1) # 47
fr_prompt: Une entreprise de vêtements a utilisé 2 boutons sur des jeans et 5 boutons sur des chemises. S'ils fabriquaient 9 chemises et 1 jean, combien de boutons utiliseraient-ils au total ?

prompt: A chef needs to cook 12 potatoes. He has already cooked 6. If each potato takes 6 minutes to cook, how long will it take him to cook the rest?
summary: var1 = find(potatoes) # 12, var2 = find(cooked potatoes) # 6, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 12 - 6 = 6, var2 = find(minutes per potato) # 6, var3 = multiply(var1, var2), CALL # 6 * 6 = 36, return(var3) # 36
fr_prompt: Un chef doit cuire 12 pommes de terre. Il en a déjà cuit 6. Si chaque pomme de terre met 6 minutes à cuire, combien de temps lui faudra-t-il pour cuire le reste ?

prompt: He has 9 apples more than Adam and Jackie together do. Adam and Jackie have 7 apples between them.How many apples does He have?
summary: var1 = find(apples with Adam and Jackie) # 7, var2 = find(apples He has over them) # 9, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 7 + 9 = 16, return(var3) # 16
fr_prompt: Il a 9 pommes de plus qu'Adam et Jackie ensemble. Adam et Jackie ont 7 pommes à eux deux. Combien de pommes a-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pommes avec Adam et Jackie) # 7, var2 = find(pommes qu'il a sur eux) # 9, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 7 + 9 = 16, return(var3) # 16

prompt: Jesse's room is 7 feet long. If she needs a carpet of size 14 square feetWhat is the width of her room?
summary: var1 = find(size of carpet in square feet) # 14, var2 = find(length of room) # 7, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 14 / 7 = 2, return(var3) # 2
fr_prompt: La chambre de Jesse mesure 7 pieds de long. Si elle a besoin d'un tapis de 14 pieds carrés, quelle est la largeur de sa chambre ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(taille du tapis en pieds carrés) # 14, var2 = find(longueur de la pièce) # 7, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 14 / 7 = 2, return(var3) # 2

prompt: Matt had 4 small cans of gold paint. If the 34 stars that they made were to be distributed equally to the cans of paint, how many stars will be left unpainted?
summary: var1 = find(stars) # 34, var2 = find(cans of paint) # 4, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 34 / 4 = 8 with a remainder of 2, var4 = find(remainder) # 2, return(var4) # 2
fr_prompt: Matt avait 4 petits pots de peinture dorée. Si les 34 étoiles qu'ils ont fabriquées devaient être réparties également dans les pots de peinture, combien d'étoiles resteraient non peintes ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(étoiles) # 34, var2 = trouver(pots de peinture) # 4, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 34 / 4 = 8 avec un reste de 2, var4 = trouver(reste) # 2 , retour(var4) # 2

prompt: It's New Year's Eve. Benjamin and his family went to New York City to take part in the celebration that is going to take place later that night. Before the evening celebrations, Benjamin wanted to see some of the famous places in NYC first. From the hotel, he walked 234 steps to the nearest restaurant then another 378 steps to Central Park. How many steps did he take to get to Central Park from the hotel?
summary: var1 = find(steps to restaurant) # 234, var2 = find(steps to Central Park) # 378, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 234 + 378 = 612, return(var1) # 612
fr_prompt: C'est le réveillon du Nouvel An. Benjamin et sa famille se sont rendus à New York pour participer à la célébration qui aura lieu plus tard dans la nuit. Avant les célébrations du soir, Benjamin voulait d'abord voir certains des endroits célèbres de New York. De l'hôtel, il a marché 234 marches jusqu'au restaurant le plus proche, puis 378 marches supplémentaires jusqu'à Central Park. Combien de pas a-t-il fait pour se rendre à Central Park depuis l'hôtel ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(étapes vers restaurant) # 234, var2 = find(étapes vers Central Park) # 378, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 234 + 378 = 612, return(var1) # 612

prompt: Olivia had 11 quarters. If she spent 4 of them buying a soda, how many coins did she have left?
summary: var1 = find(quarters) # 11, var2 = find(quarters spent) # 4, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 11 - 4 = 7, return(var3) # 7
fr_prompt: Olivia avait 11 trimestres. Si elle en a dépensé 4 pour acheter un soda, combien de pièces lui restait-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(quartiers) # 11, var2 = trouver(quartiers dépensés) # 4, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 11 - 4 = 7, retour(var3) # 7

prompt: Being a nature lover, she also gave some money to three forest reserves. If she donated $570.00 to Treetown National Park and The Forest Reserve which is $140.00 more than what she gave to Animal Preservation Park, how much did she donate to all three parks?
summary: var1 = find(money donated to Treetown National Park and The Forest Reserve) # 570, var2 = subtract(var1, 140), CALL # 570 - 140 = 430, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 570 + 430 = 1000, return(var3) # 1000
fr_prompt: Amoureuse de la nature, elle a également donné de l'argent à trois réserves forestières. Si elle a donné 570,00 $ au parc national de Treetown et à la réserve forestière, soit 140,00 $ de plus que ce qu'elle a donné à Animal Preservation Park, combien a-t-elle donné aux trois parcs ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (argent donné au parc national de Treetown et à la réserve forestière) # 570, var2 = soustraire (var1, 140), APPEL # 570 - 140 = 430, var3 = ajouter (var1, var2), APPEL # 570 + 430 = 1000, retour(var3) # 1000

prompt: Ned ordered some pizzas for a party. During the party four were eaten. Now he has seven left. How many pizzas did Ned order for the party?
summary: var1 = find(left pizzas) # 7, var2 = find(eaten pizzas) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 7 + 4 = 11, return(var3) # 11
fr_prompt: Ned a commandé des pizzas pour une fête. Pendant la fête, quatre ont été mangés. Maintenant, il en reste sept. Combien de pizzas Ned a-t-il commandées pour la fête ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(gauche pizzas) # 7, var2 = find(mangé pizzas) # 4, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 7 + 4 = 11, return(var3) # 11

prompt: Mrs. Smith gave 53 strawberries to 8 girls equally. How many strawberries were left?
summary: var1 = find(strawberries) # 53, var2 = find(girls) # 8, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 53 / 8 = 6.63, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(6.63) = 6, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 8 * 6 = 48, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 53 - 48 = 5, return(var5) # 5
fr_prompt: Mme Smith a donné 53 fraises à 8 filles également. Combien restait-il de fraises ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(fraises) # 53, var2 = trouver(filles) # 8, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 53 / 8 = 6.63, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(6.63) = 6, var4 = multiplier(var2, var3), CALL # 8 * 6 = 48, var5 = soustraire(var1, var4), CALL # 53 - 48 = 5, return(var5) # 5

prompt: Carol was sending out birthday invitations to 10 friends. If each package of invitations she bought had 2 invitations in itHow many packs does she need so that no friend gets left out?
summary: var1 = find(friends invited) #10, var2 = divide(var1, 2), CALL # 10 / 2 = 5, return(var2) # 5

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(amis invités) #10, var2 = diviser(var1, 2), APPEL # 10 / 2 = 5, retour(var2) # 5

prompt: At the arcade Debby spent 2 tickets on a hat, 10 on a stuffed animal and 2 on a yoyo. How many tickets did she spend total?
summary: var1 = find(tickets on hat) # 2, var2 = find(tickets on stuffed animal) # 10, var3 = find(tickets on yoyo) # 2, var4 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 2 + 10 = 12, var5 = add(var4, var3), CALL # 12 + 2 = 14, return(var5) # 14
fr_prompt: À l'arcade, Debby a dépensé 2 billets pour un chapeau, 10 pour un animal en peluche et 2 pour un yoyo. Combien de billets a-t-elle dépensé au total ?

prompt: My car gets 20 miles per gallon of gas. If Grandma's house is 100 miles away, how many gallons of gas would it take to get to her house?
summary: var1 = find(distance) # 100, var2 = find(miles per gallon) # 20, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 100 / 20 = 5, return(var3) # 5

fr_summary: var1 = find(distance) # 100, var2 = find(miles per gallon) # 20, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 100 / 20 = 5, return(var3) # 5

prompt: Jordon has a different kind of number machine. Her machine doubles the number and adds 3 more. So when Jordon put in 25, the number 53 came out of the machine. Jordon put in the number 16. What number do you think came out of her machine?
summary: var1 = find(original number) # 16, var2 = multiply(var1, 2) # 16 * 2 = 32, var3 = add(var2, 3) # 32 + 3 = 35, return(var3) # 35
fr_prompt: Jordan a un autre type de machine à numéros. Sa machine double le nombre et en ajoute 3 de plus. Ainsi, lorsque Jordon a mis 25, le nombre 53 est sorti de la machine. Jordon a mis le numéro 16. Selon vous, quel numéro est sorti de sa machine ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (nombre d'origine) # 16, var2 = multiplier (var1, 2) # 16 * 2 = 32, var3 = ajouter (var2, 3) # 32 + 3 = 35, retourner (var3) # 35

prompt: The Khan Corporation would like to donate 48 computers and 32 printers to local schools. What is the greatest number of schools that The Khan Corporation can donate to?
summary: var1 = find(48 computers) # 48, var2 = find(32 printers) # 32, var3 = gcd(var1,var2), CALL # gcd(48,32) = 16, return(var3) # 16

prompt: While shopping, Maria bought 35 green towels and 21 white towels. If she gave her mother 34 of them, how many towels did Maria end up with?
summary: var1 = find(green towels) # 35, var2 = find(white towels) # 21, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 35 + 21 = 56, var4 = subtract(var3, 34), CALL # 56 - 34 = 22, return(var4) # 22

prompt: Faye was placing her pencils and crayons into 11 rows with 31 pencils and 27 crayons in each row.How many pencils and crayons does she have altogether?
summary: var1 = find(pencils in 1 row) #31, var2 = multiply(var1, 11), CALL # 31 * 11 = 341, var3 = find(crayons in 1 row) #27, var4 = multiply(var3, 11), CALL # 27 * 11 = 297, var5 = add(var2, var4), CALL # 341 + 297 = 638, return(var5) # 638
fr_prompt: Faye plaçait ses crayons et ses crayons en 11 rangées avec 31 crayons et 27 crayons dans chaque rangée. Combien de crayons et de crayons a-t-elle en tout ?

prompt: Paco had 36 cookies. He gave 14 cookies to his friend and ate 10 cookies.How many cookies did Paco have left?
summary: total_cookies = find(total cookies) # 36, given = find(given cookies) # 14, eaten = find(eaten cookies) # 10, after_given = subtract(total_cookies, given), CALL # 36 - 14 = 22, remaining = subtract(after_given, eaten), CALL # 22 - 10 = 12, , return(remaining) # 12
fr_prompt: Paco avait 36 ​​biscuits. Il a donné 14 cookies à son ami et en a mangé 10. Combien de cookies restait Paco ?
fr_summary: total_cookies = trouver (total_cookies) # 36, donné = trouver (donné des cookies) # 14, mangé = trouver (manger des cookies) # 10, après_donné = soustraire (total_cookies, donné), APPEL # 36 - 14 = 22, restant = soustraire (après_donné, mangé), CALL # 22 - 10 = 12, , retour (restant) # 12

prompt: Her last stop was the post office. There she sent her rock collection to the Geological Museum in London. She was left with her 15 favorite stones after sending away a part of her collection. If she originally has 78 stones in her collection, how many did she send away?

prompt: The farmer had 127 apples. He gave 88 apples to his neighbor. How many apples does he have now?

prompt: Greg and Brad started reading their books at the same time. Greg read 18 pages a day. Brad read 26 pages a day. How many more pages did Brad read than Greg?

prompt: Bobby had 19 pieces of candy. He ate 2 pieces of candy.How many pieces of candy does he still have left?

prompt: He also had 26 aquariums for saltwater animals. The aquarium had 52 saltwater animals in total and every aquarium had the same number of animals.How many saltwater animals does each aquarium have?

prompt: For Halloween Faye scored 47 pieces of candy. She ate 25 pieces the first night and then her sister gave her 40 more pieces. How many pieces of candy does Faye have now?
summary: var1 = find(starting candy) # 47, var2 = find(eaten candy) # 25, var1 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 47 - 25 = 22, var2 = find(sister candy) # 40, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 22 + 40 = 62, return(var1) # 62

prompt: Mrs. Sheridan has 11 cats. Mrs. Garrett has 24 cats. What's the difference of the number of Mrs. Sheridan's cats and Mrs. Garrett's cats?

prompt: A waiter had nineteen customers. After some left he still had four customers. What's the difference between the number of customers before leaving and after leaving?

prompt: For the school bake sale Katie made 26 cupcakes. If she sold 20 of them and then made 20 more, how many cupcakes would she have?
summary: var1 = find(starting cupcakes) # 26, var2 = find(sold cupcakes) # 20, var1 = sub(var1, var2), CALL # 26 - 20 = 6, var2 = find(new cupcakes) # 20, var1 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 6 + 20 = 26, return(var1) # 26

prompt: Carol was sending out birthday invitations to her friends. If each package of invitations she bought had 9 invitations in it and she bought 5 packs, how many friends can she invite?

fr_summary: var1 = find(invitations par pack) # 9, var2 = find(total packs) # 5, var3 = multiplier(var1, var2), CALL # 9 * 5 = 45, return(var3) # 45

prompt: Jerry had some action figures on a shelf in his room. Later he added 7 more action figures to the shelf. If there are a total of 10 action figures on his shelf nowHow many action figures did he have initially on the shelf?
summary: var1 = find(action figures on shelf now) # 10, var2 = find(action figures added later) # 7, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 10 - 7 = 3, return(var1) # 3

prompt: Bernard had 15 red notebooks, 17 blue notebooks and 19 white notebooks. He gave some of them to Tom and had 5 left. How many notebooks did Bernard give Tom?

fr_prompt: Bernard avait 15 cahiers rouges, 17 cahiers bleus et 19 cahiers blancs. Il en a donné quelques-uns à Tom et il en restait 5. Combien de cahiers Bernard a-t-il donné à Tom ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(red notebooks) # 15, var2 = find(blue notebooks) # 17, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 17 = 32, var4 = find(white notebooks) # 19, var5 = add (var3, var4), CALL # 32 + 19 = 51, var6 = find(notebooks after) # 5, var7 = subtract(var5, var6), CALL # 51 - 5 = 46, return(var7) # 46

prompt: Skittles come in packages of 6. Juan ate 24 Skittles. How many Skittles does he have left?

prompt: There are 64 marbles in Phyllis's marble collection. If the marbles are organized into 32 groups, how big is each group?
summary: var1 = find(marbles) # 64, var2 = find(group size) # 32, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 64 / 32 = 2, var4 = multiply(var3, var2), CALL # 2 * 32 = 64, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 64 - 64 = 0, return(var3) # 2

prompt: A large bag of balls was kept under Haley's bed. Her mom placed the balls in bags for children in foster homes. If every bag can contain 4 balls and Haley has 36 balls, how many bags will be used?
summary: var1 = find(balls) # 36, var2 = find(balls per bag) # 4, var1 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 36 / 4 = 9, return(var1) # 9
fr_prompt: Un grand sac de balles était gardé sous le lit de Haley. Sa maman a placé les balles dans des sacs pour enfants dans des foyers d'accueil. Si chaque sac peut contenir 4 balles et que Haley en a 36, ​​combien de sacs seront utilisés ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(balles) # 36, var2 = trouver(balles par sac) # 4, var1 = diviser(var1, var2), APPEL # 36 / 4 = 9, retour(var1) # 9

prompt: There were 6 soccer balls in the bag. Coach B. found several additional soccer balls, and placed them in the bag. There are now 24 balls in the bag. How many soccer balls did he pick up?
summary: var1 = find(balls before) # 6, var2 = find(balls after) # 24, var3 = subtract(var2, var1) # 24 - 6 = 18, return(var3) # 18
fr_prompt: Il y avait 6 ballons de football dans le sac. L'entraîneur B. a trouvé plusieurs ballons de football supplémentaires et les a placés dans le sac. Il y a maintenant 24 balles dans le sac. Combien de ballons de foot a-t-il ramassés ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(boules avant) # 6, var2 = trouver(boules après) # 24, var3 = soustraire(var2, var1) # 24 - 6 = 18, retour(var3) # 18

prompt: Zachary did 59 push-ups and 44 crunches in gym class today. David did 19 more push-ups but 27 less crunches than zachary.How many push-ups did David do?
summary: var1 = find(push-ups Zachary did) # 59, var2 = find(more push-ups David did) # 19, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 59 + 19 = 78, return(var3) # 78
fr_prompt: Zachary a fait 59 pompes et 44 abdominaux en cours de gym aujourd'hui. David a fait 19 pompes de plus mais 27 abdominaux de moins que zachary. Combien de pompes David a-t-il faites ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (les pompes que Zachary a faites) # 59, var2 = trouver (plus de pompes que David a faites) # 19, var3 = ajouter (var1, var2), APPEL # 59 + 19 = 78, retour (var3) # 78

prompt: Lastly, she donated $800.00 to three different soup kitchens in her town. If she gave $300.00 to the first soup kitchen and $238.00 to the second, how much did she donate to the third?
summary: var1 = find(total money donated to soup kitchens) # 800, var2 = find(money donated to 1st soup kitchen) # 300, var3 = find(money donated to 2nd soup kitchen) # 238, var2 = add(var2, var3), CALL # 300 + 238 = 538, var1 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 800 - 538 = 262, return(var1) # 262
fr_prompt: Enfin, elle a fait don de 800,00 $ à trois soupes populaires différentes de sa ville. Si elle a donné 300,00 $ à la première soupe populaire et 238,00 $ à la seconde, combien a-t-elle donné à la troisième ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(argent total donné aux soupes populaires) # 800, var2 = find(argent donné à la 1ère soupe populaire) # 300, var3 = find(argent donné à la 2e soupe populaire) # 238, var2 = add(var2, var3) , APPEL # 300 + 238 = 538, var1 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 800 - 538 = 262, retour(var1) # 262

prompt: Mother bought some potatoes. She used 15 of the potatoes to make salads and 24 of the potatoes for mashed potatoes. If there were 13 potatoes left, how many potatoes did mother buy at first?
summary: var1 = find(potatoes used for salads) # 15, var2 = find(potatoes used for mashed potatoes) # 24, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 24 = 39, var2 = find(potatoes left) # 13, var3 = add(var3, var2), CALL # 39 + 13 = 52, return(var3) # 52
fr_prompt: Maman a acheté des pommes de terre. Elle a utilisé 15 des pommes de terre pour faire des salades et 24 des pommes de terre pour la purée de pommes de terre. S'il restait 13 pommes de terre, combien de pommes de terre mère a-t-elle achetées en premier ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(pommes de terre utilisées pour les salades) # 15, var2 = find(pommes de terre utilisées pour la purée de pommes de terre) # 24, var3 = add(var1, var2), CALL # 15 + 24 = 39, var2 = find(pommes de terre restantes) # 13, var3 = ajouter(var3, var2), APPEL # 39 + 13 = 52, retour(var3) # 52

prompt: 15 students split 122 portfolios of paintings. Each student should get the same number of portfolios. How many portfolios of paintings will be left?
summary: var1 = find(portfolios) # 122, var2 = find(students) # 15, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 122 / 15 = 8.13, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(8.13) = 8, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 15 * 8 = 120, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 122 - 120 = 2, return(var5) # 2
fr_prompt: 15 étudiants se sont répartis 122 portfolios de peintures. Chaque élève doit recevoir le même nombre de portfolios. Combien de portefeuilles de peintures restera-t-il ?
fr_summary: var1 = find(portfolios) # 122, var2 = find(students) # 15, var3 = diviser(var1, var2), CALL # 122 / 15 = 8.13, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(8.13) = 8, var4 = multiplier(var2, var3), CALL # 15 * 8 = 120, var5 = soustraire(var1, var4), CALL # 122 - 120 = 2, return(var5) # 2

prompt: A grocery store had 67 bottles of regular soda and 9 bottles of diet soda.How many more bottles of regular soda than diet soda did they have?
summary: var1 = find(regular soda) #67, var2 = subtract(var1, 9), CALL # 67 - 9 = 58, return(var2) # 58

fr_summary: var1 = trouver (soda ordinaire) # 67, var2 = soustraire (var1, 9), APPEL # 67 - 9 = 58, retour (var2) # 58

prompt: Cory made 4500 g of candy. He saved 1 kg to eat later. He divided the rest of the candy over 7 bowls to serve at his party. How many grams of candy did Cory serve in each bowl?
summary: var1 = find(candy Cory made) # 4500 g, var2 = find(candy Cory saved) # 1000 g, var3 = subtract(var1, var2), CALL # 4500 - 1000 = 3500 g, var4 = find(number of bowls) # 7, return(var3/var4) # 500 g
fr_prompt: Cory a fait 4500 g de bonbons. Il a économisé 1 kg pour manger plus tard. Il a divisé le reste des bonbons dans 7 bols à servir lors de sa fête. Combien de grammes de bonbons Cory a-t-il servis dans chaque bol ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver(bonbon Cory fabriqué) # 4500 g, var2 = trouver(bonbon Cory économisé) # 1000 g, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), CALL # 4500 - 1000 = 3500 g, var4 = trouver(nombre de bols) # 7, retour(var3/var4) # 500 g

prompt: Six students were sitting at each table in the lunchroom. There are 34 tables. How many students were sitting in the lunchroom?

prompt: Megan had seventeen bottles of water. If she drank three of them, how many bottles would Megan have left?

fr_summary: var1 = trouver(total bouteilles) # 17, var2 = trouver(bouteilles ivres) # 3, var3 = soustraire(var1, var2), APPEL # 17 - 3 = 14, retour(var3) # 14

prompt: The Razorback t-shirt shop makes $ 106 dollars off each t-shirt sold. During the Arkansas game and the Texas tech game they sold a total of 242 t-shirts. If they sold 115 t-shirts during the Arkansas gameHow many t-shirts did they sell during the Texas tech game?

Pendant le match de l'Arkansas et le match technologique du Texas, ils ont vendu un total de 242 t-shirts. S'ils ont vendu 115 t-shirts pendant le jeu de l'Arkansas, combien de t-shirts ont-ils vendus pendant le jeu technologique du Texas ?
fr_summary: var1 = trouver (t-shirts Arkansas) # 115, var2 = soustraire (242, var1), APPEL # 242 - 115 = 127, retour (var2) # 127

prompt: Allan and Jake brought 3 balloons to the park. If Allan brought 2 balloonsHow many balloons did Jake bring to the park?

prompt: Betty has 367 beads and wants to use all the beads to make necklaces. If she wants to make 15 necklaces with each having the same number of beads, how many more beads does she need?
summary: var1 = find(beads) # 367, var2 = find(necklaces) # 15, var3 = divide(var1, var2), CALL # 367 / 15 = 24.47, var3 = round_down(var3), CALL # round down(24.47) = 24, var4 = multiply(var2, var3), CALL # 15 * 24 = 360, var5 = subtract(var1, var4), CALL # 367 - 360 = 7, var6 = subtract(var2, var5), CALL # 15 - 7 = 8, return(var6) # 8

prompt: Stanley, a car enthusiast, loves to drive across different places as a hobby. So for his vacation, he decided to go around his favorite places.
